文章內容:
How can new technologies and innovations help reduce disaster risk? Hear innovators & experts discuss the latest trends at the United Nations on 1-3 May.

? webtv.un.org 
?? bit.ly/Resilience2018
#GlobalGoals #resilienceintegrated

There is arguably no single preventive health intervention more cost-effective than immunization, which prevents 2-3 million deaths each year. The World Health Organization (WHO) aims to strengthen routine immunization, accelerate control of vaccine-preventable diseases, introduce new vaccines, and spur research and development for the next generation of vaccines and technologies.#VaccinesWork

http://www.who.int/features/factfiles/immunization/en/

文章內容:
Governments meet today through 10 May in Bonn, Germany, for the next round of UN climate change negotiations to further develop the guidelines for implementing the #ParisAgreement.

This will allow the agreement to become operational. The guidelines, or operating manual, will be finalized at this year's #COP24 in Poland and will allow the agreement to become operational. Details: https://goo.gl/rHNve1
留言: ["OKYD Ambassador welcomes news about operating manual, to be finalized at this year's #COP24 in Poland and will allow the agreement to become operational", 'Smart Efficient Adaptable Sustainability of Modern Global Community \n...']

文章內容:
Want a better world? The 17 Sustainable Development Goals are the world's bold and ambitious plan to end poverty, protect the planet and ensure that all people enjoy peace and prosperity. 

We can do this. 

Learn why all 193 UN Member States signed off on this big, bold plan:  www.un.org/sustainabledevelopment #GlobalGoals ?
留言:
["OKYD Ambassador lauds and support HOPE in implementing 17 Sustainable Development Goals that are the world's bold and ambitious plan to end poverty, protect the planet and ensure that all people enjoy peace and prosperity.", "This won't work at all. .
Reason : 1.World Nations are depending on 3.World countries to produce cheaply and supply them..", 'Anyone who love Earth where will repay you for to co-exist shared by all
each other in the world!', 'HOPE', 'Wishes and support from NADAM FOUNDATION.', '#GlobalGoals', 'yeah', 'Towards achieving the SDGs, we have written and published the books: A B C & 1 2 3 ON THE SDGs Campaigns and SKILLS FOR SDGs PRENEURSHIP and now available at https://www.amazon.com/author/amosobi', "Open Letter
We open this open letter due to our disappointment to the Government of the Republic of Indonesia, GOVERNMENT SOUTH SUMATRA PROVINCE and GOVERNMENT OF MUSI BANYUSIN DISTRICT, our country is located in BENUA ASIA, SOUTH OF BENUA SOUTHEAST ASIA, whose countries are incorporated in ASEAN ORGANIZATION.
We also regret, regret, and deeply disappointed in, THE INTERNATIONAL WORLD, GENERAL SECRETARY GENERAL OF UNITED NATIONS, UNFCCC PARTICIPANTS, UNIVERSALITY UNION, UNINTERRUPTIVE, UNFCCC, NEVER help, or at least look, meet us , whether we report this is true, or just engineering, a figment.
Through our open letter, which we make to be known by the public, so that there is international concern about the solution, the solution to the problems we experienced, this open letter, After the letter CLOSED, letter in the AMPLOP, we give to the the following parties, in the country of representation of the Republic of Indonesia, we:

To
Dear
1. SECRETARY GENERAL OF UNITED NATIONS
through
A. UNDP OF THE REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA, (B). UNOCHA REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA, (C). UNIDO REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA

2. HEAD OF UNFCCC PARTICIPANT COUNTRIES through BIG DUTA
a. President of the United States (b). President of China (c). Prime Minister of Japan
d. Dutch Prime Minister (e). British Prime Minister (f). Prime Minister of France
g. Prime Minister of Australia (h). Prime minister of Norway (i) .Danish Prime Minister
j. German Chancellor

3. EUROPEAN UNION INDONESIA
(Receipt in our Chronology photo)

IN-
           The place
With respect,
Apologize first,
We have sent letters directly to representative offices of UNITED NATIONS, EUROPEAN UNION, and ambassadors of UNFCCC participating countries in the Republic of Indonesia.
We report on the impacts, consequences, of forestry development in the Indonesian republic, in which forestry activities are in order to maintain the survival of all living creatures on this earth. DEMA keeps the earth temperature rise below 2 degrees, in order to keep global carbon stocks, to reduce impact greenhouse gas emissions and so on.
In the Paris Agreement (paris cop 21), there is agreement that the impact of the activities for the survival of all living beings on this planet is the responsibility of the whole world joined in the UNFCCC.
Why do the parties we have given the above report do not care about this issue, even though we have reported that forestry development in Indonesia has adversely affected the community inside and around the forest of industrial plants, on this problem forestry activities undertaken by PT. EARTH PERSADA PERMAI, APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP., Whose products are pulp and paper, and marketed, exported to European Union countries, to participating countries of UNFCCC.
According to what we read and hear uni europe requires the product of forest industry from indonesian must pass flegt certification, environmentally friendly product, product that does not damage the natural environment, sustainable forest development and sustainable. Why when we give report about alleged violation to:

LAW OF THE REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA NUMBER 16 YEAR 2016 REGARDING PARIS AGREEMENT TO THE UNITED NATIONS FRAMEWORK CONVENTION ON CLIMATE CHANGE (PARIS AGREEMENT TO THE UNITED STATES CONVENTION OF THE NATIONS ON CLIMATE CHANGE).

LAW OF THE REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA NUMBER 11 YEAR 2013 REGARDING NAGOYA PRESENTATION OF PROTOCOL ON ACCESS TO GENETIC RESOURCES AND THE FAIR AND EQUITABLE SHARING OF BENEFITS ARISSING FROM THEIR UTILIZATION TO THE CONVENTION ON BIOLOGICAL DIVERSITY (NAGOYA PROTOCOL ABOUT ACCESS TO GENETIC RESOURCES AND DISTRIBUTION OF ADVANTAGES OF FAIR AND CONSIDERATIONS ARISING OUT OF THE USE OF THE BIOLOGICAL CONVENTIONS OF BIODIVERSITY)

LAW OF THE REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA NUMBER 11 YEAR 2005 REGARDING INTERNATIONAL CERTIFICATION OF COVENANT ON ECONOMIC, SOCIAL AND CULTURAL RIGHTS (KOVENANINTERNASIONAL ON ECONOMIC, SOCIAL AND CULTURAL RIGHTS)

we are very sorry, very disappointed, very sad The UNITED NATIONS, UNFCCC PARTICIPANTS COUNTRIES, EUROPEAN UNION, no matter on the problems that are the impact of forestry activities in order to maintain the survival of this planet earth.
We also report on our concerns with PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI, APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP, to the parties providing the audit and certification of the company's activities, but the answer we received was very disappointing, only one audit and certification company provided answers, some companies that do not respond to, respond to, our reports, about objections, refutations, rebuttal, our complaints, against the results of their assessment of PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI, APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP.
In addition to alleged violations of the applicable laws of the Republic of Indonesia, we have also reported on:
1. Permasala han business land, cultivated land, community gardens that have been evicted, forced to work, in serobot by PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI, APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP.
2. Problems graves / graves that have been dius by the PT.BPP, APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP.
3. Corporate obligations that have not been implemented, build a life plant of 20% of the working area or embedded area.
4. Equity participation of village co-operatives.
5.DUGAAN VIOLATION OF HUMAN RIGHTS HUMAN RIGHTS that the company did to the community. 
There are many more problems that we convey as written in our letter, which is addressed to the ranks of the central government of the Republic of Indonesia and representatives of these countries in over in the republic of Indonesia.Because it is very painful, sad for us, our report to the ranks of the central government of the republic of indonesia, which then reply to our letter by requesting the government SOUTH SUMATERA PROVINCE through GOVERNOR, and GOVERNOR REGENCY OF MUSI NAYUASIN through its REGENT, respect, respect the local government where the company works. Through this open letter, we ask with all humility, with great respect and respect that the INTERNATIONAL WORLD may play an active role and take responsibility for the impacts of forest development in our country. We also ask the participating countries, UNFCCC MEMBER, european union, and any country that receives forest products of the Republic of Indonesia produced by APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP, in order to consider, review, purchase of products. We are ready to prove to the international world what we have write, we declare, we report in our open letter, if the international world is to prove the truth of our report, and we sincerely hope that the international world will prove, investigate, check the truth of our report. So this open letter we write, sincerely hope the international community cares for our problems, in accordance with international agreements and commitments on CLIMATE CHANGE. 
REPORT OF COMMUNITY OF REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA
MURSAL 
ARJONI"]

文章內容:
Everyone needs safe water to drink and access to decent sanitation. The UN's new #Fin4Dev report says this will take an annual US$114 billion to achieve, which is three times the historical financing trend. Countries and businesses must invest more in water. ???

Read the report: bit.ly/iatf2018 #GlobalGoals #EveryDrop

To the forestry authorities in the republic of Indonesia we have reported our concerns to the ENVIRONMENTAL MINISTRY OF LIFE and FORESTRY REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA.

There are many more issues that we convey as stated in our letter, which is addressed to the ranks of the central government of the Republic of Indonesia and representatives of the countries mentioned above in the republic of Indonesia. It is very painful, sad for us, our report to the ranks of the central government of the republic of indonesia, which then reply our letter by requesting to the government SOUTH SUMATERA PROVINCE through GOVERNOR, and GOVERNOR REGENCY MUSI BANYUASIN through its REGENT, not respected, respect, obey by the local government where the company works. We are ready to prove to the international world what we have written, we declare, we report in our open letter, if the international world is to prove the truth of our report, and we sincerely hope that the international world will prove, investigate, this is our report. So this open letter we write, with the hope that the international community cares for our problems, in accordance with international agreements and commitments on CLIMATE CHANGE. 
COMMUNITY REPORTING OF THE REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA
ARJONI
MURSAL"]

7. Problems of alleged violation of permission either by PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI, APP GROUP, SINAR MAS ROUP and its contractor company.
In addition to the alleged violations of the prevailing regulations of the Republic of Indonesia, we have also reported on: 
1. Problems of business land, cultivated land, abandoned community gardens, forced labor, serobot by PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI, APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP. 
2. Problems graves / graves that have been dius by the PT.BPP, APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP.
3. Corporate obligations that have not been implemented, build a life plant of 20% of the working area or embedded area. 
4. Equity participation of village cooperatives. 
5.RESIDENCE OF HUMAN RIGHTS HUMAN RIGHTS that the company does to the public. 
There are many more issues that we convey as stated in our letter, which is addressed to the ranks of the central government of the Republic of Indonesia and representatives of the countries mentioned above in the republic of Indonesia. It is very painful, sad for us, our report to the ranks of the central government of the republic of indonesia, which then reply our letter by requesting to the government SOUTH SUMATERA PROVINCE through GOVERNOR, and GOVERNOR REGENCY MUSI BANYUASIN through its REGENT, not respected, respect, obey by the local government where the company works. Through this open letter, we ask with all humility, with great respect and respect that the INTERNATIONAL WORLD may take an active and responsible role in the impacts of forest development in our country. We also ask the participating countries, UNFCCC MEMBER, european union, and any country that receives forest products of the Republic of Indonesia produced by APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP, in order to consider, review, purchase of the product. We are ready to prove to the international world what we have written, we declare, we report in our open letter, if the international world is to prove the truth of our report, and we sincerely hope that the international world will prove, investigate, this is our report. So this open letter we write, with the hope that the international community cares for our problems, in accordance with international agreements and commitments on CLIMATE CHANGE. 
COMMUNITY REPORTING OF THE REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA
ARJONI
MURSAL"]

5. Disposal of waste to the source of springs or streams. 
6. Narrowing, widening and silting the river.
7. Problems of alleged violation of permission either by PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI, APP GROUP, SINAR MAS ROUP and its contractor company.
In addition to the alleged violations of the prevailing regulations of the Republic of Indonesia, we have also reported on: 
1. Problems of business land, cultivated land, abandoned community gardens, forced labor, serobot by PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI, APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP. 
2. Problems graves / graves that have been dius by the PT.BPP, APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP.
3. Corporate obligations that have not been implemented, build a life plant of 20% of the working area or embedded area. 
4. Equity participation of village cooperatives. 
5.RESIDENCE OF HUMAN RIGHTS HUMAN RIGHTS that the company does to the public. 
There are many more issues that we convey as stated in our letter, which is addressed to the ranks of the central government of the Republic of Indonesia and representatives of the countries mentioned above in the republic of Indonesia. It is very painful, sad for us, our report to the ranks of the central government of the republic of indonesia, which then reply our letter by requesting to the government SOUTH SUMATERA PROVINCE through GOVERNOR, and GOVERNOR REGENCY MUSI BANYUASIN through its REGENT, not respected, respect, obey by the local government where the company works. Through this open letter, we ask with all humility, with great respect and respect that the INTERNATIONAL WORLD may take an active and responsible role in the impacts of forest development in our country. We also ask the participating countries, UNFCCC MEMBER, european union, and any country that receives forest products of the Republic of Indonesia produced by APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP, in order to consider, review, purchase of the product. We are ready to prove to the international world what we have written, we declare, we report in our open letter, if the international world is to prove the truth of our report, and we sincerely hope that the international world will prove, investigate, this is our report. So this open letter we write, with the hope that the international community cares for our problems, in accordance with international agreements and commitments on CLIMATE CHANGE. 
COMMUNITY REPORTING OF THE REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA
ARJONI
MURSAL"]

Through this open letter, after a closed letter we give to the parties below, we question the international commitment of CLIMATE CHANGE and the impact of the FORESTRY activities to safeguard climate change, in order to maintain the survival of all living beings, the living beings on this planet .

To
Dear

3. EUROPEAN UNION INDONESIA
(Receipt in our Chronology photo)

IN-
The place
With respect,
Apologize first,

So this open letter we write, with the hope that the international community cares for our problems, in accordance with international agreements and commitments on CLIMATE CHANGE.

It is very painful, sad for us, our report to the ranks of the central government of the republic of indonesia, which then reply our letter by requesting to the government SOUTH SUMATERA PROVINCE through GOVERNOR, and GOVERNOR REGENCY MUSI BANYUASIN through its REGENT, not respected, respect, obey by the local government where the company works. 文章內容:
60-90% of marine pollution is made of plastic, and each year, more than 8 million tons of plastic leak into the ocean. Is your plastic drinking straw really necessary? Could you find an alternative? 

Commit to #BeatPlasticPollution and reduce your use of plastic this #EarthDay! www.cleanseas.org

['We pray for fulfilment of gobal sustainable goals to save our common mother earth for all of us living in it.', "May there be sustainable officers' post created for those trained in SD courses to fulfill gobal sustainable goals.", 'Strong political will and sound policy are crucial to have this realized', "Open Letter
After the letter is CLOSED, letter in the AMPLOP, we give to the parties below, in the country of representation of the Republic of Indonesia, this letter we make for and in the know by the general public:
Our disappointment to the international community, to the united nations, to the European Union, to the heads of UNFCCC member countries, we enlarge through this letter, as our international community deserves to question the international attitude to our problems in accordance with the signed by the international world together.
Through this open letter, after a closed letter we give to the parties below, we question the international commitment of CLIMATE CHANGE and the impact of the FORESTRY activities to safeguard climate change, in order to maintain the survival of all living beings, the living beings on this planet .

To
Dear
1. SECRETARY GENERAL OF UNITED NATIONS
through
A. UNDP OF THE REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA
B. UNOCHA REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA
C. UNIDO OF THE REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA

2. HEAD OF UNFCCC PARTICIPANT COUNTRIES through BIG DUTA
a. President of the United States b. Chinese President c. Prime Minister of Japan
d. Dutch Prime Minister e. British Prime Minister f. French Prime Minister g. Prime Minister of Australia h. Prime minister of Norway i. Danish Prime Minister
j. German Chancellor

3. EUROPEAN UNION INDONESIA
(Receipt in our Chronology photo)

IN-
The place
With respect,
Apologize first,
We have delivered letters directly to representative offices of UNITED NATIONS, EUROPEAN UNION, and ambassadors of UNFCCC participating countries in the Republic of Indonesia.
We report on the impacts, consequences, of forestry development in the Indonesian republic, in which forestry activities are in order to maintain the survival of all living creatures on this earth. DEMA keeps the earth temperature rise below 2 degrees, in order to keep global carbon stocks, to reduce impact greenhouse gas emissions and so on.
In the Paris Agreement (paris cop 21), there is agreement that the impact of the activities for the survival of all living beings on this planet is the responsibility of the whole world joined in the UNFCCC.
Why do the parties we have given the above report do not care about this issue, even though we have reported that forestry development in Indonesia has adversely affected the community inside and around the forest of industrial plants, on this problem forestry activities undertaken by PT. EARTH PERSADA PERMAI, APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP., Whose products are pulp and paper, and marketed, exported to European Union countries, to participating countries of UNFCCC.
According to what we read and hear uni europe requires the product of forest industry from indonesian must pass flegt certification, environmentally friendly product, product that does not damage the natural environment, sustainable forest development and sustainable. Why when we give report about alleged violation to:

LAW OF THE REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA NUMBER 16 YEAR 2016 REGARDING PARIS AGREEMENT TO THE UNITED NATIONS FRAMEWORK CONVENTION ON CLIMATE CHANGE (PARIS AGREEMENT TO THE CONVENTION OF THE UNDERSTANDING UNITED STATES OF THE CLIMATE CHANGE).

LAW OF THE REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA NUMBER 11 YEAR 2013 REGARDING NAGOYA PRESENTATION OF PROTOCOL ON ACCESS TO GENETIC RESOURCES AND THE FAIR AND EQUITABLE SHARING OF BENEFITS ARISSING FROM THEIR UTILIZATION TO THE CONVENTION ON BIOLOGICAL DIVERSITY (NAGOYA PROTOCOL ON ACCESS TO GENETIC RESOURCES AND DISTRIBUTION OF ADVANTAGES OF FAIR AND CONSIDERATIONS ARISING OUT OF THE USE OF THE BIOLOGICAL CONVENTIONS OF BIODIVERSITY)

LAW OF THE REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA NUMBER 11 YEAR 2005 REGARDING INTERNATIONAL CERTIFICATION OF COVENANT ON ECONOMIC, SOCIAL AND CULTURAL RIGHTS (KOVENANINTERNASIONAL ON ECONOMIC, SOCIAL AND CULTURAL RIGHTS)

we are very sorry, very disappointed, very sad The UNITED NATIONS, UNFCCC PARTICIPANTS COUNTRIES, EUROPEAN UNION, no matter on the problems that are the impact of forestry activities in order to maintain the survival of this planet earth.
We also report on our concerns with PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI, APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP, to the parties providing the audit and certification of this company's activities, but the answer we received was very disappointing, only one audit and certification company provided answers, some companies that do not respond to, respond to, our reports, about objections, refutations, rebuttal, our complaints, against the results of their assessment of PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI, APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP.
To the forestry authorities in the republic of Indonesia we have reported our concerns to the ENVIRONMENTAL MINISTRY OF LIFE and FORESTRY REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA.
1. Usage k by nature of PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI, APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP, which is suspected of not performing obligations on TAX FOREST RESOURCES PROVISION (PPSDH) and REBOIZATION FUND (DR)
2. Planting and harvesting in watersheds (DAS).
3. Utilization of protected areas for the benefit of nursery facilities and infrastructure.
4. Changing landscapes by changing, transferring, bodies and river currents.
5. Disposal of waste to the source of springs or streams. 
6. Narrowing, widening and silting the river.
7. Problems of alleged violation of permission either by PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI, APP GROUP, SINAR MAS ROUP and its contractor company.
In addition to the alleged violations of the prevailing regulations of the Republic of Indonesia, we have also reported on: 
1. Problems of business land, cultivated land, abandoned community gardens, forced labor, serobot by PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI, APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP. 
2. Problems graves / graves that have been dius by the PT.BPP, APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP.
3. Corporate obligations that have not been implemented, build a life plant of 20% of the working area or embedded area. 
4. Equity participation of village cooperatives. 
5.RESIDENCE OF HUMAN RIGHTS HUMAN RIGHTS that the company does to the public. 
There are many more issues that we convey as stated in our letter, which is addressed to the ranks of the central government of the Republic of Indonesia and representatives of the countries mentioned above in the republic of Indonesia. It is very painful, sad for us, our report to the ranks of the central government of the republic of indonesia, which then reply our letter by requesting to the government SOUTH SUMATERA PROVINCE through GOVERNOR, and GOVERNOR REGENCY MUSI BANYUASIN through its REGENT, not respected, respect, obey by the local government where the company works. Through this open letter, we ask with all humility, with great respect and respect that the INTERNATIONAL WORLD may take an active and responsible role in the impacts of forest development in our country. We also ask the participating countries, UNFCCC MEMBER, european union, and any country that receives forest products of the Republic of Indonesia produced by APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP, in order to consider, review, purchase of the product. We are ready to prove to the international world what we have written, we declare, we report in our open letter, if the international world is to prove the truth of our report, and we sincerely hope that the international world will prove, investigate, this is our report. So this open letter we write, with the hope that the international community cares for our problems, in accordance with international agreements and commitments on CLIMATE CHANGE. 
COMMUNITY REPORTING OF THE REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA
ARJONI
MURSAL"]

To the forestry authorities in the republic of Indonesia we have reported our concerns to the ENVIRONMENTAL MINISTRY OF LIFE and FORESTRY REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA.
1. Usage k by nature of PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI, APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP, which is suspected of not performing obligations on TAX FOREST RESOURCES PROVISION (PPSDH) and REBOIZATION FUND (DR)
2. Planting and harvesting in watersheds (DAS).

4. Changing landscapes by changing, transferring, bodies and river currents.

ARJONI

After the letter is CLOSED, letter in the AMPLOP, we give to the parties below, in the country of representation of the Republic of Indonesia, this letter we make for and in the know by the general public:
Our disappointment to the international community, to the united nations, to the European Union, to the heads of UNFCCC member countries, we enlarge through this letter, as our international community deserves to question the international attitude to our problems in accordance with the signed by the international world together.
Through this open letter, after a closed letter we give to the parties below, we question the international commitment of CLIMATE CHANGE and the impact of the FORESTRY activities to safeguard climate change, in order to maintain the survival of all living beings, the living beings on this planet .

To
Dear
1. SECRETARY GENERAL OF UNITED NATIONS
through
A. UNDP OF THE REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA
B. UNOCHA REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA
C. UNIDO OF THE REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA

2. HEAD OF UNFCCC PARTICIPANT COUNTRIES through BIG DUTA
a. President of the United States b. Chinese President c. Prime Minister of Japan
d. Dutch Prime Minister e. British Prime Minister f. French Prime Minister g. Prime Minister of Australia h. Prime minister of Norway i. Danish Prime Minister
j. German Chancellor

3. EUROPEAN UNION INDONESIA
(Receipt in our Chronology photo)

IN-
The place
With respect,
Apologize first,
We have delivered letters directly to representative offices of UNITED NATIONS, EUROPEAN UNION, and ambassadors of UNFCCC participating countries in the Republic of Indonesia.
We report on the impacts, consequences, of forestry development in the Indonesian republic, in which forestry activities are in order to maintain the survival of all living creatures on this earth. DEMA keeps the earth temperature rise below 2 degrees, in order to keep global carbon stocks, to reduce impact greenhouse gas emissions and so on.
In the Paris Agreement (paris cop 21), there is agreement that the impact of the activities for the survival of all living beings on this planet is the responsibility of the whole world joined in the UNFCCC.
Why do the parties we have given the above report do not care about this issue, even though we have reported that forestry development in Indonesia has adversely affected the community inside and around the forest of industrial plants, on this problem forestry activities undertaken by PT. EARTH PERSADA PERMAI, APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP., Whose products are pulp and paper, and marketed, exported to European Union countries, to participating countries of UNFCCC.
According to what we read and hear uni europe requires the product of forest industry from indonesian must pass flegt certification, environmentally friendly product, product that does not damage the natural environment, sustainable forest development and sustainable. Why when we give report about alleged violation to:

LAW OF THE REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA NUMBER 16 YEAR 2016 REGARDING PARIS AGREEMENT TO THE UNITED NATIONS FRAMEWORK CONVENTION ON CLIMATE CHANGE (PARIS AGREEMENT TO THE CONVENTION OF THE UNDERSTANDING UNITED STATES OF THE CLIMATE CHANGE).

LAW OF THE REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA NUMBER 11 YEAR 2013 REGARDING NAGOYA PRESENTATION OF PROTOCOL ON ACCESS TO GENETIC RESOURCES AND THE FAIR AND EQUITABLE SHARING OF BENEFITS ARISSING FROM THEIR UTILIZATION TO THE CONVENTION ON BIOLOGICAL DIVERSITY (NAGOYA PROTOCOL ON ACCESS TO GENETIC RESOURCES AND DISTRIBUTION OF ADVANTAGES OF FAIR AND CONSIDERATIONS ARISING OUT OF THE USE OF THE BIOLOGICAL CONVENTIONS OF BIODIVERSITY)

LAW OF THE REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA NUMBER 11 YEAR 2005 REGARDING INTERNATIONAL CERTIFICATION OF COVENANT ON ECONOMIC, SOCIAL AND CULTURAL RIGHTS (KOVENANINTERNASIONAL ON ECONOMIC, SOCIAL AND CULTURAL RIGHTS)

we are very sorry, very disappointed, very sad The UNITED NATIONS, UNFCCC PARTICIPANTS COUNTRIES, EUROPEAN UNION, no matter on the problems that are the impact of forestry activities in order to maintain the survival of this planet earth.
We also report on our concerns with PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI, APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP, to the parties providing the audit and certification of this company's activities, but the answer we received was very disappointing, only one audit and certification company provided answers, some companies that do not respond to, respond to, our reports, about objections, refutations, rebuttal, our complaints, against the results of their assessment of PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI, APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP.
To the forestry authorities in the republic of Indonesia we have reported our concerns to the ENVIRONMENTAL MINISTRY OF LIFE and FORESTRY REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA.
1. Usage k by nature of PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI, APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP, which is suspected of not performing obligations on TAX FOREST RESOURCES PROVISION (PPSDH) and REBOIZATION FUND (DR)
2. Planting and harvesting in watersheds (DAS).
3. Utilization of protected areas for the benefit of nursery facilities and infrastructure.
4. Changing landscapes by changing, transferring, bodies and river currents.
5. Disposal of waste to the source of springs or streams. 
6. Narrowing, widening and silting the river.
7. Problems of alleged violation of permission either by PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI, APP GROUP, SINAR MAS ROUP and its contractor company.
In addition to the alleged violations of the prevailing regulations of the Republic of Indonesia, we have also reported on: 
1. Problems of business land, cultivated land, abandoned community gardens, forced labor, serobot by PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI, APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP. 
2. Problems graves / graves that have been dius by the PT.BPP, APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP.
3. Corporate obligations that have not been implemented, build a life plant of 20% of the working area or embedded area. 
4. Equity participation of village cooperatives. 
5.RESIDENCE OF HUMAN RIGHTS HUMAN RIGHTS that the company does to the public. 
There are many more issues that we convey as stated in our letter, which is addressed to the ranks of the central government of the Republic of Indonesia and representatives of the countries mentioned above in the republic of Indonesia. It is very painful, sad for us, our report to the ranks of the central government of the republic of indonesia, which then reply our letter by requesting to the government SOUTH SUMATERA PROVINCE through GOVERNOR, and GOVERNOR REGENCY MUSI BANYUASIN through its REGENT, not respected, respect, obey by the local government where the company works. Through this open letter, we ask with all humility, with great respect and respect that the INTERNATIONAL WORLD may take an active and responsible role in the impacts of forest development in our country. We also ask the participating countries, UNFCCC MEMBER, european union, and any country that receives forest products of the Republic of Indonesia produced by APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP, in order to consider, review, purchase of the product. We are ready to prove to the international world what we have written, we declare, we report in our open letter, if the international world is to prove the truth of our report, and we sincerely hope that the international world will prove, investigate, this is our report. So this open letter we write, with the hope that the international community cares for our problems, in accordance with international agreements and commitments on CLIMATE CHANGE. 
COMMUNITY REPORTING OF THE REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA
ARJONI
MURSAL"]

Our disappointment to the international community, to the united nations, to the European Union, to the heads of UNFCCC member countries, we enlarge through this letter, as our international community deserves to question the international attitude to our problems in accordance with the signed by the international world together.
Through this open letter, after a closed letter we give to the parties below, we question the international commitment of CLIMATE CHANGE and the impact of the FORESTRY activities to safeguard climate change, in order to maintain the survival of all living beings, the living beings on this planet .

To
Dear
1. SECRETARY GENERAL OF UNITED NATIONS
through
A. UNDP OF THE REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA
B. UNOCHA REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA
C. UNIDO OF THE REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA

2. HEAD OF UNFCCC PARTICIPANT COUNTRIES through BIG DUTA
a. President of the United States b. Chinese President c. Prime Minister of Japan
d. Dutch Prime Minister e. British Prime Minister f. French Prime Minister g. Prime Minister of Australia h. Prime minister of Norway i. Danish Prime Minister
j. German Chancellor

3. EUROPEAN UNION INDONESIA
(Receipt in our Chronology photo)

IN-
The place
With respect,
Apologize first,
We have delivered letters directly to representative offices of UNITED NATIONS, EUROPEAN UNION, and ambassadors of UNFCCC participating countries in the Republic of Indonesia.
We report on the impacts, consequences, of forestry development in the Indonesian republic, in which forestry activities are in order to maintain the survival of all living creatures on this earth. DEMA keeps the earth temperature rise below 2 degrees, in order to keep global carbon stocks, to reduce impact greenhouse gas emissions and so on.
In the Paris Agreement (paris cop 21), there is agreement that the impact of the activities for the survival of all living beings on this planet is the responsibility of the whole world joined in the UNFCCC.
Why do the parties we have given the above report do not care about this issue, even though we have reported that forestry development in Indonesia has adversely affected the community inside and around the forest of industrial plants, on this problem forestry activities undertaken by PT. EARTH PERSADA PERMAI, APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP., Whose products are pulp and paper, and marketed, exported to European Union countries, to participating countries of UNFCCC.
According to what we read and hear uni europe requires the product of forest industry from indonesian must pass flegt certification, environmentally friendly product, product that does not damage the natural environment, sustainable forest development and sustainable. Why when we give report about alleged violation to:

LAW OF THE REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA NUMBER 16 YEAR 2016 REGARDING PARIS AGREEMENT TO THE UNITED NATIONS FRAMEWORK CONVENTION ON CLIMATE CHANGE (PARIS AGREEMENT TO THE CONVENTION OF THE UNDERSTANDING UNITED STATES OF THE CLIMATE CHANGE).

LAW OF THE REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA NUMBER 11 YEAR 2013 REGARDING NAGOYA PRESENTATION OF PROTOCOL ON ACCESS TO GENETIC RESOURCES AND THE FAIR AND EQUITABLE SHARING OF BENEFITS ARISSING FROM THEIR UTILIZATION TO THE CONVENTION ON BIOLOGICAL DIVERSITY (NAGOYA PROTOCOL ON ACCESS TO GENETIC RESOURCES AND DISTRIBUTION OF ADVANTAGES OF FAIR AND CONSIDERATIONS ARISING OUT OF THE USE OF THE BIOLOGICAL CONVENTIONS OF BIODIVERSITY)

LAW OF THE REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA NUMBER 11 YEAR 2005 REGARDING INTERNATIONAL CERTIFICATION OF COVENANT ON ECONOMIC, SOCIAL AND CULTURAL RIGHTS (KOVENANINTERNASIONAL ON ECONOMIC, SOCIAL AND CULTURAL RIGHTS)

we are very sorry, very disappointed, very sad The UNITED NATIONS, UNFCCC PARTICIPANTS COUNTRIES, EUROPEAN UNION, no matter on the problems that are the impact of forestry activities in order to maintain the survival of this planet earth.
We also report on our concerns with PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI, APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP, to the parties providing the audit and certification of this company's activities, but the answer we received was very disappointing, only one audit and certification company provided answers, some companies that do not respond to, respond to, our reports, about objections, refutations, rebuttal, our complaints, against the results of their assessment of PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI, APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP.
To the forestry authorities in the republic of Indonesia we have reported our concerns to the ENVIRONMENTAL MINISTRY OF LIFE and FORESTRY REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA.
1. Usage k by nature of PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI, APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP, which is suspected of not performing obligations on TAX FOREST RESOURCES PROVISION (PPSDH) and REBOIZATION FUND (DR)
2. Planting and harvesting in watersheds (DAS).
3. Utilization of protected areas for the benefit of nursery facilities and infrastructure.
4. Changing landscapes by changing, transferring, bodies and river currents.
5. Disposal of waste to the source of springs or streams. 
6. Narrowing, widening and silting the river.
7. Problems of alleged violation of permission either by PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI, APP GROUP, SINAR MAS ROUP and its contractor company.
In addition to the alleged violations of the prevailing regulations of the Republic of Indonesia, we have also reported on: 
1. Problems of business land, cultivated land, abandoned community gardens, forced labor, serobot by PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI, APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP. 
2. Problems graves / graves that have been dius by the PT.BPP, APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP.
3. Corporate obligations that have not been implemented, build a life plant of 20% of the working area or embedded area. 
4. Equity participation of village cooperatives. 
5.RESIDENCE OF HUMAN RIGHTS HUMAN RIGHTS that the company does to the public. 
There are many more issues that we convey as stated in our letter, which is addressed to the ranks of the central government of the Republic of Indonesia and representatives of the countries mentioned above in the republic of Indonesia. It is very painful, sad for us, our report to the ranks of the central government of the republic of indonesia, which then reply our letter by requesting to the government SOUTH SUMATERA PROVINCE through GOVERNOR, and GOVERNOR REGENCY MUSI BANYUASIN through its REGENT, not respected, respect, obey by the local government where the company works. Through this open letter, we ask with all humility, with great respect and respect that the INTERNATIONAL WORLD may take an active and responsible role in the impacts of forest development in our country. We also ask the participating countries, UNFCCC MEMBER, european union, and any country that receives forest products of the Republic of Indonesia produced by APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP, in order to consider, review, purchase of the product. We are ready to prove to the international world what we have written, we declare, we report in our open letter, if the international world is to prove the truth of our report, and we sincerely hope that the international world will prove, investigate, this is our report. So this open letter we write, with the hope that the international community cares for our problems, in accordance with international agreements and commitments on CLIMATE CHANGE. 
COMMUNITY REPORTING OF THE REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA
ARJONI
MURSAL"]

through

(Receipt in our Chronology photo)

IN-
           The place
With respect,
Apologize first,
We have sent letters directly to representative offices of UNITED NATIONS, EUROPEAN UNION, and ambassadors of UNFCCC participating countries in the Republic of Indonesia.
We report on the impacts, consequences, of forestry development in the Indonesian republic, in which forestry activities are in order to maintain the survival of all living creatures on this earth. DEMA keeps the earth temperature rise below 2 degrees, in order to keep global carbon stocks, to reduce impact greenhouse gas emissions and so on.
In the Paris Agreement (paris cop 21), there is agreement that the impact of the activities for the survival of all living beings on this planet is the responsibility of the whole world joined in the UNFCCC.
Why do the parties we have given the above report do not care about this issue, even though we have reported that forestry development in Indonesia has adversely affected the community inside and around the forest of industrial plants, on this problem forestry activities undertaken by PT. EARTH PERSADA PERMAI, APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP., Whose products are pulp and paper, and marketed, exported to European Union countries, to participating countries of UNFCCC.
According to what we read and hear uni europe requires the product of forest industry from indonesian must pass flegt certification, environmentally friendly product, product that does not damage the natural environment, sustainable forest development and sustainable. Why when we give report about alleged violation to:

LAW OF THE REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA NUMBER 16 YEAR 2016 REGARDING PARIS AGREEMENT TO THE UNITED NATIONS FRAMEWORK CONVENTION ON CLIMATE CHANGE (PARIS AGREEMENT TO THE UNITED STATES CONVENTION OF THE NATIONS ON CLIMATE CHANGE).

LAW OF THE REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA NUMBER 11 YEAR 2013 REGARDING NAGOYA PRESENTATION OF PROTOCOL ON ACCESS TO GENETIC RESOURCES AND THE FAIR AND EQUITABLE SHARING OF BENEFITS ARISSING FROM THEIR UTILIZATION TO THE CONVENTION ON BIOLOGICAL DIVERSITY (NAGOYA PROTOCOL ABOUT ACCESS TO GENETIC RESOURCES AND DISTRIBUTION OF ADVANTAGES OF FAIR AND CONSIDERATIONS ARISING OUT OF THE USE OF THE BIOLOGICAL CONVENTIONS OF BIODIVERSITY)

LAW OF THE REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA NUMBER 11 YEAR 2005 REGARDING INTERNATIONAL CERTIFICATION OF COVENANT ON ECONOMIC, SOCIAL AND CULTURAL RIGHTS (KOVENANINTERNASIONAL ON ECONOMIC, SOCIAL AND CULTURAL RIGHTS)

we are very sorry, very disappointed, very sad The UNITED NATIONS, UNFCCC PARTICIPANTS COUNTRIES, EUROPEAN UNION, no matter on the problems that are the impact of forestry activities in order to maintain the survival of this planet earth.

In addition to alleged violations of the applicable laws of the Republic of Indonesia, we have also reported on:
1. Permasala han business land, cultivated land, community gardens that have been evicted, forced to work, in serobot by PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI, APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP.
2. Problems graves / graves that have been dius by the PT.BPP, APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP.
3. Corporate obligations that have not been implemented, build a life plant of 20% of the working area or embedded area.
4. Equity participation of village co-operatives.
5.DUGAAN VIOLATION OF HUMAN RIGHTS HUMAN RIGHTS that the company did to the community. 
There are many more problems that we convey as written in our letter, which is addressed to the ranks of the central government of the Republic of Indonesia and representatives of these countries in over in the republic of Indonesia.Because it is very painful, sad for us, our report to the ranks of the central government of the republic of indonesia, which then reply to our letter by requesting the government SOUTH SUMATERA PROVINCE through GOVERNOR, and GOVERNOR REGENCY OF MUSI NAYUASIN through its REGENT, respect, respect the local government where the company works. Through this open letter, we ask with all humility, with great respect and respect that the INTERNATIONAL WORLD may play an active role and take responsibility for the impacts of forest development in our country. We also ask the participating countries, UNFCCC MEMBER, european union, and any country that receives forest products of the Republic of Indonesia produced by APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP, in order to consider, review, purchase of products. We are ready to prove to the international world what we have write, we declare, we report in our open letter, if the international world is to prove the truth of our report, and we sincerely hope that the international world will prove, investigate, check the truth of our report. So this open letter we write, sincerely hope the international community cares for our problems, in accordance with international agreements and commitments on CLIMATE CHANGE. 
REPORT OF COMMUNITY OF REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA
MURSAL 
ARJONI"]

文章內容:
"What I learned about autism, first and foremost, was that everyone's experience with autism is different," says Dakota Fanning, who plays an autistic woman in her new film. 

See more women breaking stereotypes about autism: https://news.un.org/en/story/2018/04/1006681 #GlobalGoals
留言:
["Why are you always using celebrities as if their playing a part can really give them an education on the experience or any foresight on the issue that we should revere? They're just actors. Why not actually use someone autistic to educate people about autism?", 'I wish society would recognize and reinforce the difference between a handicap(a penalty to capability) and a disability. The definition of 'disability' is extremely clear.

George Carlin did the world a favor fighting political correctness regarding disability - by pointing out the term used was once "Cripple" instead of "Disabled Person". The word does not shame its target, but it does communicate a level of suffering, and evokes empathy and compassion.', 'Emily Roberts our next movie?', 'Duaa Bani Kenanah', "Open Letter

LAW OF THE REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA NUMBER 11 YEAR 2005 REGARDING INTERNATIONAL CERTIFICATION OF COVENANT ON ECONOMIC, SOCIAL AND CULTURAL RIGHTS (KOVENANINTERNASIONAL ON ECONOMIC, SOCIAL AND CULTURAL RIGHTS)

Is your project taking climate action? You could get funding ??: https://goo.gl/NQq6rp

LAW OF THE REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA NUMBER 16 YEAR 2016 REGARDING PARIS AGREEMENT TO THE UNITED NATIONS FRAMEWORK CONVENTION ON CLIMATE CHANGE (PARIS AGREEMENT TO THE UNITED STATES CONVENTION OF THE NATIONS ON CLIMATE CHANGE).

LAW OF THE REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA NUMBER 11 YEAR 2013 REGARDING NAGOYA PRESENTATION OF PROTOCOL ON ACCESS TO GENETIC RESOURCES AND THE FAIR AND EQUITABLE SHARING OF BENEFITS ARISSING FROM THEIR UTILIZATION TO THE CONVENTION ON BIOLOGICAL DIVERSITY (NAGOYA PROTOCOL ABOUT ACCESS TO GENETIC RESOURCES AND DISTRIBUTION OF ADVANTAGES OF FAIR AND CONSIDERATIONS ARISING OUT OF THE USE OF THE BIOLOGICAL CONVENTIONS OF BIODIVERSITY)

LAW OF THE REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA NUMBER 11 YEAR 2005 REGARDING INTERNATIONAL CERTIFICATION OF COVENANT ON ECONOMIC, SOCIAL AND CULTURAL RIGHTS (KOVENANINTERNASIONAL ON ECONOMIC, SOCIAL AND CULTURAL RIGHTS)

we are very sorry, very disappointed, very sad The UNITED NATIONS, UNFCCC PARTICIPANTS COUNTRIES, EUROPEAN UNION, no matter on the problems that are the impact of forestry activities in order to maintain the survival of this planet earth.

In addition to alleged violations of the applicable laws of the Republic of Indonesia, we have also reported on:
1. Problems of business land, cultivated land, community gardens that have been evicted, forced to work, in serobot by PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI, APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP.

Through this open letter, we ask with all humility, with great respect and respect that the INTERNATIONAL WORLD may take an active and responsible role in the impacts of forest development in our country. We also ask the participating countries, UNFCCC MEMBER, european union, and any country that receives forest products of the Republic of Indonesia produced by APP GROUP, SINAR MAS GROUP, in order to consider, review, purchase of the product. We are ready to prove to the international world what we have written, we declare, we report in our open letter, if the international world is to prove the truth of our report, and we sincerely hope that the international world will prove, investigate, our report is this. So this open letter we write, with the hope that the international community cares for our problems, in accordance with international agreements and commitments on CLIMATE CHANGE.

COMMUNITY OF THE REPUBLIC OF INDONESIA
MURSAL"]

['Who is Architect of Higher Developing Bangladesh

List of implemented programs of mine has become larger day by day since 1982. Now it has become unbelievable that how a person brought so many basic reforms without state-authority! However, higher developing Bangladesh is not only generated from my thoughts, reform programs and initiatives, but also agreements and actions of Ex-President H M Ershad, Ex-PM Khaleda Zia and PM Sheikh Hasina. 

Since 1982,   per capita GDP growth rate is increased was about 5.1% (=6.0-0.9). Ex-President Ershad’s reforms generated less growth rate (1.2%), but were the most difficult and fundamental parts of the DID model. PM Hasina (1.4%) would surpass Ex-PM Khaleda (2.5%), if she creates rest two divisions [2.7% (=1.4+1.3)].

Kami mempertanyakan kapan,di mana dan bagaimana,pelaksanaan,implementasi,komitmen,dunia internasional terhadap dampak dari pembangunan kehutanan yang demi kehidupan seluruh manusia yang berada dalam planet bumi ini.
Yang tertulis,tertuang dalam KESEPAKATAN PARIS,PARIS AGREEMENT,PARIS COP 21.

Inti / permalahan utama,permasalahan pokok,dari surat kami mempertanyakan tentang kesepakatan dunia internasional di bidang perubahan iklim,yang meminta,menyuruh,memerintah kan negara kami untuk menjaga hutan,walaupun ada kata-kata sukarela, yang menurut negara barat sebagai paru-paru dunia,

1. makam/kuburan, nenek moyang,leluhur kami di gusur,

Kami telah memberikan surat kepada sekretaris jenderal perserikatan bangsa-bangsa melalui perwakilan di negara REPUPUBLIK INDONESIA.
.
Kami memberitahukan,melaporkan dampak kegiatan tersebut di atas bagi kami masyarakat yang berada di dalam dan sekitar hutan, sesuai dengan kesepakatan paris bahwa pembanngunan dan dampak dari kegiatan tersebut di atas merupakan tanggung jawab seluruh dunia.

Adapun dampak yang kami terima dari kegiatan kehutanan di bidang hutan tanaman industri di REPUBLIK INDONESIA yang di lakukan oleh PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI,APP GROUP,SINAR MAS GROUP adalah :
1. PELANGGARAN TERHADAP HAK ASASI MANUSIA,
2. HAK-HAK MASYARAKAT ATAS TANAH ( AGRARIA ) di langgar dengan di serobot,di gusur,di garap paksanya lahan usaha,lahan garapan masyarakat.
3. TERJADI NYA KERUSAKAN LINGKUNGAN ALAM

Kami juga meminta kepada DUNIA INTERNASIONAL dan EUROPEAN UNION yang menerima,membeli,produk pulp and paper asal REPUBLIK INDONESIA, agar mempertimbangkan kembali,memikirkan kembali,meninjau ulang pembelian produk PULP and PAPER asal REPUBLIK INDONESIA yang di produksi oleh ASIA PULP and PAPER ( APP ),SINAR MAS GROUP.
demikianlah ,terima kasih.

Surat kami berikan pada : 

1. Yth. EUROPEAN UNION

Tanggal 19 September 2016 di terima oleh saudari Nona dengan nomor Istimewa
Tanggal 24 Maret 2017 di terima oleh saudari MUTIARA dengan nomor Special Istimewa

2. Yth.UNIDO,

Tanggal 16 September 2016 dengan nomor Istimewa 
Tanggal 29 Maret 2017 di terima oleh saudara Lidya dengan nomor Special Istimewa.

3. Yth.UNDP,
Tanggal 16 September 2016 dengan nomor Istimewa

Tanggal 29 Maret 2017 di terima oleh saudara Lidya dengan nomor Special Istimewa.

4. Yth.United Natons OCHA,
Tanggal 16 September 2016 dengan nomor Istimewa
Tanggal 29 Maret 2017 di terima oleh saudara Lidya dengan nomor Special Istimewa.

Surat ini juga kami sampaikan,berikan kepada KEPALA NEGARA,KEPALA PEMERINTAHAN negara-negara peserta UNFCCC melalui DUTA BESAR sesuai dengan tanda terima yang terdapat dalam foto kronolologi kami.

KEPALA NEGARA PESERTA UNFCCC melalui DUTA BESAR

a.Presiden Amerika Serikat
b. Presiden Cina
c. Perdana Menteri Jepang
d. Perdana Menteri Belanda
e. Perdana Menteri Inggris
f. Perdana Menteri Perancis
g. Perdana Menteri Australia
h. Perdana menteri Norwegia
i. Perdana Menteri Denmark
j. Kanselir Jerman 
Melalui surat ini kami meminta kepada DUNIA INTERNASIONAL untuk membuktikan KOMITMEN yang tertuang,tertulis dalam KESEPAKATAN PARIS ( PARIS AGREEMENT / COP 21 ),meminta KONSISTENSI terhadap pelaksanaan butir-butir,poin-poin yang telah di sepakati.

Kami siap membuktikan kepada dunia internasional,PERSERIKATAN BANGSA-BANGSA,EUROPEAN UNION,maupun NEGARA-NEGARA PESERTA UNFCCC,atas apa yang telah kami beritahukan,laporkan kepada DUNIA INTERNASIONAL.
Demikianlah surat terbuka ini kami buat,besar harapan kami DUNIA INTERNASIONAL peduli akan permasalahan kami ini,serta dapat kami pertanggung jawabkan kebenaran nya.

Telang,30 Oktober 2017
PELAPOR
Dto
1. M U R S A L
2. A R J O N I"]

文章內容:
The Spotlight Initiative to end violence against women and girls "will be happening in countries where it matters the most," says Deputy Secretary-General Amina Mohammed. We will find "a way to communicate that and put pressure on policy-makers and those who can take the decisions to bring an end to this.” 

Learn about the next steps for the EU-UN partnership: www.un.org/spotlight-initiative #SpotlightEndViolence #TimeIsNow #GlobalGoals
留言:
["Surat Terbuka.
Setelah surat tertutup,surat dalam amplop,kami tujukan kepada para pihak di bawah ini :

1. SEKRETARIS JENDERAL PERSERIKATAN BANGSA-BANGSA
2. EUROPEAN UNION
3. KEPALA NEGARA / KEPALA PEMERINTAHAN NEGARA-NEGARA PESERTA UNFCCC.

Kami mempertanyakan kapan,di mana dan bagaimana,pelaksanaan,implementasi,komitmen,dunia internasional terhadap dampak dari pembangunan kehutanan yang demi kehidupan seluruh manusia yang berada dalam planet bumi ini.
Yang tertulis,tertuang dalam KESEPAKATAN PARIS,PARIS AGREEMENT,PARIS COP 21.

Inti / permalahan utama,permasalahan pokok,dari surat kami mempertanyakan tentang kesepakatan dunia internasional di bidang perubahan iklim,yang meminta,menyuruh,memerintah kan negara kami untuk menjaga hutan,walaupun ada kata-kata sukarela, yang menurut negara barat sebagai paru-paru dunia,

Dalam kesepakatan paris,PARIS COP21, semua DUNIA INTERNASIONAL yang tergabung dalam UNFCCC,turut bertanggung jawab terhadap dampak dari kegiatan, ( kegiatan kehutanan ) mempertahankan,menunda,memperlambat,laju perubahan iklim,menyediakan cadangan karbon bagi dunia internasional,menahan kenaikan suhu bumi di bawah 2 derajat dan lain-lain.

Apa peduli dunia internasional akibat dari kegiatan kehutanan di indonesia yang mengakibat kan :
1. makam/kuburan, nenek moyang,leluhur kami di gusur,
2. lahan pertanian kami di gusur,di garap,di ambil paksa oleh perusahaan
3. hak sasi manusia kami di langgar,
4. terjadinya kerusakan lingkungan alam.
5. tidak ada kepedulian pada dampak sosial,
sementara kewajiban/janji perusahaan tidak mereka tunaikan seperti :
1. membangun TANAMAN KEHIDUPAN sebesar 20 % dari areal kerja atau areal tertanam
2. mengikut sertakan modal koperasi desa
3. merehabilitasi dan reboisasi DAERAH ALIRAN SUNGAI ( DAS ) 
4. Dugaan tidak mentaati,melaksanakan peraturan yang berlaku di REPUBLIK INDONESIA.
hal ini di lakukan oleh PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI,APPGROUP,SINAR MAS GROUP yang produknya,produksinya di beli juga oleh negara peserta UNFCCC dan juga EUROPEAN UNION. 

seperti yang di katakan yth.bapak yusup kalla dalam acara debat kandidat saat kampanye presiden di tv one,...” barat tak adil,kita di suruh menjaga hutan,menjadi satpam hutan dunia sementara hutan mereka telah jauh lebih dahulu habis,toh hutan kita mereka juga yang menghabiskan”....( kalau tidak salah dalam mengingat dan membaca )

melalui surat terbuka ini,setelah surat tertutup dalam amplop kami tidak mendapat respon,tanggapan,tindak lanjut,kami mempertanyakan.
Kapan,di mana,bagaimana.....pelaksanaan,tindak lanjut,BUKTI NYATA, dari kesepakatan paris/paris agreement,COP 21...

KEPALA NEGARA PESERTA UNFCCC melalui DUTA BESAR

a.Presiden Amerika Serikat
b. Presiden Cina
c. Perdana Menteri Jepang
d. Perdana Menteri Belanda
e. Perdana Menteri Inggris
f. Perdana Menteri Perancis
g. Perdana Menteri Australia
h. Perdana menteri Norwegia
i. Perdana Menteri Denmark
j. Kanselir Jerman 
Melalui surat ini kami meminta kepada DUNIA INTERNASIONAL untuk membuktikan KOMITMEN yang tertuang,tertulis dalam KESEPAKATAN PARIS ( PARIS AGREEMENT / COP 21 ),meminta KONSISTENSI terhadap pelaksanaan butir-butir,poin-poin yang telah di sepakati.

Kami siap membuktikan kepada dunia internasional,PERSERIKATAN BANGSA-BANGSA,EUROPEAN UNION,maupun NEGARA-NEGARA PESERTA UNFCCC,atas apa yang telah kami beritahukan,laporkan kepada DUNIA INTERNASIONAL.
Demikianlah surat terbuka ini kami buat,besar harapan kami DUNIA INTERNASIONAL peduli akan permasalahan kami ini,serta dapat kami pertanggung jawabkan kebenaran nya.

Telang,30 Oktober 2017

文章內容:
Better health & education ?
Economic boom ?
Action on #GlobalGoals ?

#Bangladesh has met the graduation criteria & will be considered for #LDCGraduation in 2021! Learn more about what that means in #UNDESAVoice: http://bit.ly/2BRd6GD
留言:
["Surat Terbuka.
Setelah surat tertutup,surat dalam amplop,kami tujukan kepada para pihak di bawah ini :

1. SEKRETARIS JENDERAL PERSERIKATAN BANGSA-BANGSA
2. EUROPEAN UNION
3. KEPALA NEGARA / KEPALA PEMERINTAHAN NEGARA-NEGARA PESERTA UNFCCC.

Kami mempertanyakan kapan,di mana dan bagaimana,pelaksanaan,implementasi,komitmen,dunia internasional terhadap dampak dari pembangunan kehutanan yang demi kehidupan seluruh manusia yang berada dalam planet bumi ini.
Yang tertulis,tertuang dalam KESEPAKATAN PARIS,PARIS AGREEMENT,PARIS COP 21.

Inti / permalahan utama,permasalahan pokok,dari surat kami mempertanyakan tentang kesepakatan dunia internasional di bidang perubahan iklim,yang meminta,menyuruh,memerintah kan negara kami untuk menjaga hutan,walaupun ada kata-kata sukarela, yang menurut negara barat sebagai paru-paru dunia,

Dalam kesepakatan paris,PARIS COP21, semua DUNIA INTERNASIONAL yang tergabung dalam UNFCCC,turut bertanggung jawab terhadap dampak dari kegiatan, ( kegiatan kehutanan ) mempertahankan,menunda,memperlambat,laju perubahan iklim,menyediakan cadangan karbon bagi dunia internasional,menahan kenaikan suhu bumi di bawah 2 derajat dan lain-lain.

Apa peduli dunia internasional akibat dari kegiatan kehutanan di indonesia yang mengakibat kan :
1. makam/kuburan, nenek moyang,leluhur kami di gusur,
2. lahan pertanian kami di gusur,di garap,di ambil paksa oleh perusahaan
3. hak sasi manusia kami di langgar,
4. terjadinya kerusakan lingkungan alam.
5. tidak ada kepedulian pada dampak sosial,
sementara kewajiban/janji perusahaan tidak mereka tunaikan seperti :
1. membangun TANAMAN KEHIDUPAN sebesar 20 % dari areal kerja atau areal tertanam
2. mengikut sertakan modal koperasi desa
3. merehabilitasi dan reboisasi DAERAH ALIRAN SUNGAI ( DAS ) 
4. Dugaan tidak mentaati,melaksanakan peraturan yang berlaku di REPUBLIK INDONESIA.
hal ini di lakukan oleh PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI,APPGROUP,SINAR MAS GROUP yang produknya,produksinya di beli juga oleh negara peserta UNFCCC dan juga EUROPEAN UNION. 

seperti yang di katakan yth.bapak yusup kalla dalam acara debat kandidat saat kampanye presiden di tv one,...” barat tak adil,kita di suruh menjaga hutan,menjadi satpam hutan dunia sementara hutan mereka telah jauh lebih dahulu habis,toh hutan kita mereka juga yang menghabiskan”....( kalau tidak salah dalam mengingat dan membaca )

melalui surat terbuka ini,setelah surat tertutup dalam amplop kami tidak mendapat respon,tanggapan,tindak lanjut,kami mempertanyakan.
Kapan,di mana,bagaimana.....pelaksanaan,tindak lanjut,BUKTI NYATA, dari kesepakatan paris/paris agreement,COP 21...

Kepada 

Yth.Sekretaris JENDERAL PERSERIKATAN BANGSA-BANGSA
Melalui administrator facebook united nations

Dengan hormat,
ma'af sebelumnya,

Kami telah memberikan surat kepada sekretaris jenderal perserikatan bangsa-bangsa melalui perwakilan di negara REPUPUBLIK INDONESIA.
.
Kami memberitahukan,melaporkan dampak kegiatan tersebut di atas bagi kami masyarakat yang berada di dalam dan sekitar hutan, sesuai dengan kesepakatan paris bahwa pembanngunan dan dampak dari kegiatan tersebut di atas merupakan tanggung jawab seluruh dunia.

Adapun dampak yang kami terima dari kegiatan kehutanan di bidang hutan tanaman industri di REPUBLIK INDONESIA yang di lakukan oleh PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI,APP GROUP,SINAR MAS GROUP adalah :
1. PELANGGARAN TERHADAP HAK ASASI MANUSIA,
2. HAK-HAK MASYARAKAT ATAS TANAH ( AGRARIA ) di langgar dengan di serobot,di gusur,di garap paksanya lahan usaha,lahan garapan masyarakat.
3. TERJADI NYA KERUSAKAN LINGKUNGAN ALAM

Kami juga meminta kepada DUNIA INTERNASIONAL dan EUROPEAN UNION yang menerima,membeli,produk pulp and paper asal REPUBLIK INDONESIA, agar mempertimbangkan kembali,memikirkan kembali,meninjau ulang pembelian produk PULP and PAPER asal REPUBLIK INDONESIA yang di produksi oleh ASIA PULP and PAPER ( APP ),SINAR MAS GROUP.
demikianlah ,terima kasih.

Surat kami berikan pada : 

1. Yth. EUROPEAN UNION

Tanggal 19 September 2016 di terima oleh saudari Nona dengan nomor Istimewa
Tanggal 24 Maret 2017 di terima oleh saudari MUTIARA dengan nomor Special Istimewa

2. Yth.UNIDO,

Tanggal 16 September 2016 dengan nomor Istimewa 
Tanggal 29 Maret 2017 di terima oleh saudara Lidya dengan nomor Special Istimewa.

3. Yth.UNDP,
Tanggal 16 September 2016 dengan nomor Istimewa

Tanggal 29 Maret 2017 di terima oleh saudara Lidya dengan nomor Special Istimewa.

4. Yth.United Natons OCHA,
Tanggal 16 September 2016 dengan nomor Istimewa
Tanggal 29 Maret 2017 di terima oleh saudara Lidya dengan nomor Special Istimewa.

Surat ini juga kami sampaikan,berikan kepada KEPALA NEGARA,KEPALA PEMERINTAHAN negara-negara peserta UNFCCC melalui DUTA BESAR sesuai dengan tanda terima yang terdapat dalam foto kronolologi kami.

KEPALA NEGARA PESERTA UNFCCC melalui DUTA BESAR

a.Presiden Amerika Serikat
b. Presiden Cina
c. Perdana Menteri Jepang
d. Perdana Menteri Belanda
e. Perdana Menteri Inggris
f. Perdana Menteri Perancis
g. Perdana Menteri Australia
h. Perdana menteri Norwegia
i. Perdana Menteri Denmark
j. Kanselir Jerman 
Melalui surat ini kami meminta kepada DUNIA INTERNASIONAL untuk membuktikan KOMITMEN yang tertuang,tertulis dalam KESEPAKATAN PARIS ( PARIS AGREEMENT / COP 21 ),meminta KONSISTENSI terhadap pelaksanaan butir-butir,poin-poin yang telah di sepakati.

Kami siap membuktikan kepada dunia internasional,PERSERIKATAN BANGSA-BANGSA,EUROPEAN UNION,maupun NEGARA-NEGARA PESERTA UNFCCC,atas apa yang telah kami beritahukan,laporkan kepada DUNIA INTERNASIONAL.
Demikianlah surat terbuka ini kami buat,besar harapan kami DUNIA INTERNASIONAL peduli akan permasalahan kami ini,serta dapat kami pertanggung jawabkan kebenaran nya.

2. EUROPEAN UNION
3. KEPALA NEGARA / KEPALA PEMERINTAHAN NEGARA-NEGARA PESERTA UNFCCC.

Kami mempertanyakan kapan,di mana dan bagaimana,pelaksanaan,implementasi,komitmen,dunia internasional terhadap dampak dari pembangunan kehutanan yang demi kehidupan seluruh manusia yang berada dalam planet bumi ini.
Yang tertulis,tertuang dalam KESEPAKATAN PARIS,PARIS AGREEMENT,PARIS COP 21.

Inti / permalahan utama,permasalahan pokok,dari surat kami mempertanyakan tentang kesepakatan dunia internasional di bidang perubahan iklim,yang meminta,menyuruh,memerintah kan negara kami untuk menjaga hutan,walaupun ada kata-kata sukarela, yang menurut negara barat sebagai paru-paru dunia,

Dalam kesepakatan paris,PARIS COP21, semua DUNIA INTERNASIONAL yang tergabung dalam UNFCCC,turut bertanggung jawab terhadap dampak dari kegiatan, ( kegiatan kehutanan ) mempertahankan,menunda,memperlambat,laju perubahan iklim,menyediakan cadangan karbon bagi dunia internasional,menahan kenaikan suhu bumi di bawah 2 derajat dan lain-lain.

Apa peduli dunia internasional akibat dari kegiatan kehutanan di indonesia yang mengakibat kan :
1. makam/kuburan, nenek moyang,leluhur kami di gusur,
2. lahan pertanian kami di gusur,di garap,di ambil paksa oleh perusahaan
3. hak sasi manusia kami di langgar,
4. terjadinya kerusakan lingkungan alam.
5. tidak ada kepedulian pada dampak sosial,
sementara kewajiban/janji perusahaan tidak mereka tunaikan seperti :
1. membangun TANAMAN KEHIDUPAN sebesar 20 % dari areal kerja atau areal tertanam
2. mengikut sertakan modal koperasi desa
3. merehabilitasi dan reboisasi DAERAH ALIRAN SUNGAI ( DAS ) 
4. Dugaan tidak mentaati,melaksanakan peraturan yang berlaku di REPUBLIK INDONESIA.
hal ini di lakukan oleh PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI,APPGROUP,SINAR MAS GROUP yang produknya,produksinya di beli juga oleh negara peserta UNFCCC dan juga EUROPEAN UNION. 

seperti yang di katakan yth.bapak yusup kalla dalam acara debat kandidat saat kampanye presiden di tv one,...” barat tak adil,kita di suruh menjaga hutan,menjadi satpam hutan dunia sementara hutan mereka telah jauh lebih dahulu habis,toh hutan kita mereka juga yang menghabiskan”....( kalau tidak salah dalam mengingat dan membaca )

melalui surat terbuka ini,setelah surat tertutup dalam amplop kami tidak mendapat respon,tanggapan,tindak lanjut,kami mempertanyakan.
Kapan,di mana,bagaimana.....pelaksanaan,tindak lanjut,BUKTI NYATA, dari kesepakatan paris/paris agreement,COP 21...

Kepada 

Yth.Sekretaris JENDERAL PERSERIKATAN BANGSA-BANGSA
Melalui administrator facebook united nations

Dengan hormat,
ma'af sebelumnya,

Kami telah memberikan surat kepada sekretaris jenderal perserikatan bangsa-bangsa melalui perwakilan di negara REPUPUBLIK INDONESIA.
.
Kami memberitahukan,melaporkan dampak kegiatan tersebut di atas bagi kami masyarakat yang berada di dalam dan sekitar hutan, sesuai dengan kesepakatan paris bahwa pembanngunan dan dampak dari kegiatan tersebut di atas merupakan tanggung jawab seluruh dunia.

Adapun dampak yang kami terima dari kegiatan kehutanan di bidang hutan tanaman industri di REPUBLIK INDONESIA yang di lakukan oleh PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI,APP GROUP,SINAR MAS GROUP adalah :
1. PELANGGARAN TERHADAP HAK ASASI MANUSIA,
2. HAK-HAK MASYARAKAT ATAS TANAH ( AGRARIA ) di langgar dengan di serobot,di gusur,di garap paksanya lahan usaha,lahan garapan masyarakat.
3. TERJADI NYA KERUSAKAN LINGKUNGAN ALAM

Kami juga meminta kepada DUNIA INTERNASIONAL dan EUROPEAN UNION yang menerima,membeli,produk pulp and paper asal REPUBLIK INDONESIA, agar mempertimbangkan kembali,memikirkan kembali,meninjau ulang pembelian produk PULP and PAPER asal REPUBLIK INDONESIA yang di produksi oleh ASIA PULP and PAPER ( APP ),SINAR MAS GROUP.
demikianlah ,terima kasih.

Surat kami berikan pada : 

1. Yth. EUROPEAN UNION

Tanggal 19 September 2016 di terima oleh saudari Nona dengan nomor Istimewa
Tanggal 24 Maret 2017 di terima oleh saudari MUTIARA dengan nomor Special Istimewa

2. Yth.UNIDO,

Tanggal 16 September 2016 dengan nomor Istimewa 
Tanggal 29 Maret 2017 di terima oleh saudara Lidya dengan nomor Special Istimewa.

3. Yth.UNDP,
Tanggal 16 September 2016 dengan nomor Istimewa

Tanggal 29 Maret 2017 di terima oleh saudara Lidya dengan nomor Special Istimewa.

4. Yth.United Natons OCHA,
Tanggal 16 September 2016 dengan nomor Istimewa
Tanggal 29 Maret 2017 di terima oleh saudara Lidya dengan nomor Special Istimewa.

Surat ini juga kami sampaikan,berikan kepada KEPALA NEGARA,KEPALA PEMERINTAHAN negara-negara peserta UNFCCC melalui DUTA BESAR sesuai dengan tanda terima yang terdapat dalam foto kronolologi kami.

KEPALA NEGARA PESERTA UNFCCC melalui DUTA BESAR

a.Presiden Amerika Serikat
b. Presiden Cina
c. Perdana Menteri Jepang
d. Perdana Menteri Belanda
e. Perdana Menteri Inggris
f. Perdana Menteri Perancis
g. Perdana Menteri Australia
h. Perdana menteri Norwegia
i. Perdana Menteri Denmark
j. Kanselir Jerman 
Melalui surat ini kami meminta kepada DUNIA INTERNASIONAL untuk membuktikan KOMITMEN yang tertuang,tertulis dalam KESEPAKATAN PARIS ( PARIS AGREEMENT / COP 21 ),meminta KONSISTENSI terhadap pelaksanaan butir-butir,poin-poin yang telah di sepakati.

Kami siap membuktikan kepada dunia internasional,PERSERIKATAN BANGSA-BANGSA,EUROPEAN UNION,maupun NEGARA-NEGARA PESERTA UNFCCC,atas apa yang telah kami beritahukan,laporkan kepada DUNIA INTERNASIONAL.
Demikianlah surat terbuka ini kami buat,besar harapan kami DUNIA INTERNASIONAL peduli akan permasalahan kami ini,serta dapat kami pertanggung jawabkan kebenaran nya.

Telang,30 Oktober 2017
PELAPOR
Dto
1. M U R S A L
2. A R J O N I"]

sementara kewajiban/janji perusahaan tidak mereka tunaikan seperti :

3. merehabilitasi dan reboisasi DAERAH ALIRAN SUNGAI ( DAS ) 
4. Dugaan tidak mentaati,melaksanakan peraturan yang berlaku di REPUBLIK INDONESIA.

Kami telah memberikan surat kepada sekretaris jenderal perserikatan bangsa-bangsa melalui perwakilan di negara REPUPUBLIK INDONESIA.
.
Kami memberitahukan,melaporkan dampak kegiatan tersebut di atas bagi kami masyarakat yang berada di dalam dan sekitar hutan, sesuai dengan kesepakatan paris bahwa pembanngunan dan dampak dari kegiatan tersebut di atas merupakan tanggung jawab seluruh dunia.

Adapun dampak yang kami terima dari kegiatan kehutanan di bidang hutan tanaman industri di REPUBLIK INDONESIA yang di lakukan oleh PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI,APP GROUP,SINAR MAS GROUP adalah :
1. PELANGGARAN TERHADAP HAK ASASI MANUSIA,
2. HAK-HAK MASYARAKAT ATAS TANAH ( AGRARIA ) di langgar dengan di serobot,di gusur,di garap paksanya lahan usaha,lahan garapan masyarakat.
3. TERJADI NYA KERUSAKAN LINGKUNGAN ALAM

Kami juga meminta kepada DUNIA INTERNASIONAL dan EUROPEAN UNION yang menerima,membeli,produk pulp and paper asal REPUBLIK INDONESIA, agar mempertimbangkan kembali,memikirkan kembali,meninjau ulang pembelian produk PULP and PAPER asal REPUBLIK INDONESIA yang di produksi oleh ASIA PULP and PAPER ( APP ),SINAR MAS GROUP.
demikianlah ,terima kasih.

Tanggal 16 September 2016 dengan nomor Istimewa

KEPALA NEGARA PESERTA UNFCCC melalui DUTA BESAR

a.Presiden Amerika Serikat

Melalui surat ini kami meminta kepada DUNIA INTERNASIONAL untuk membuktikan KOMITMEN yang tertuang,tertulis dalam KESEPAKATAN PARIS ( PARIS AGREEMENT / COP 21 ),meminta KONSISTENSI terhadap pelaksanaan butir-butir,poin-poin yang telah di sepakati.

Kami siap membuktikan kepada dunia internasional,PERSERIKATAN BANGSA-BANGSA,EUROPEAN UNION,maupun NEGARA-NEGARA PESERTA UNFCCC,atas apa yang telah kami beritahukan,laporkan kepada DUNIA INTERNASIONAL.
Demikianlah surat terbuka ini kami buat,besar harapan kami DUNIA INTERNASIONAL peduli akan permasalahan kami ini,serta dapat kami pertanggung jawabkan kebenaran nya.

['Rhonda Staudt, I think you are going to like this one.', 'Whatching it from Xalapa, M?xico', 'Idalia Almed that’s the room', "Its progress for the next generation to enjoy the freedom and to take life lightly. There is a difference in making people responsible and dispirited. Teaching the fundamental principles and duties will make them responsible, teaching them the hardships and tragic of past that the world has crossed would weigh heavy in their minds taking away the spirit of hope and joy of freedom that's granted to them as basic in the democratic world.

The values or the learning people need to know for a peaceful society is not the happenings of the past but the principles of the present. 

Peace is definitely not in teaching about history and the past and laying them dos and donts and ensuring through surveillance, policing and control that people are sticking to it. Instead, peace is in setting up an environment that naturally keeps people's minds and energy focused on productive and progressive activities. 

Which form of approach towards peace is more real and reliable? The former serves until there's someone to watch, the latter enables people to stay responsible at all point of time.

Allowing people to follow their passion is definitely a way that would enable us to set up an environment that would promote peace. But whats more important is the recognition and inclusion. Their contribution needs to be readily included and recognised by the government that would encourage them to keep on progressing and prospering adding to the progression and prosperity of the world and nation ensuring that development is eternal. Its the fulfilment of soul that would pave way for peace. Following and facilitating the adopted fundamentals helps us to do this flawlessly and easily. 

So, its following the principles guidelined by the fundamentals and facilitating the provisions enabled through it to fulfil the duties assigned by it, is the key to peace and the solution to all existing problem.", 'Global warming Global warning ? DAILY NUGGETS ON PEACE:
       "A Billion Problems" 

Dealing with frustration and disappointment in a better way is the hallmark of today's Leader and entrepreneur. 

Entrepreneurship is about solving problems. To succeed on a massive scale, you've got to deal with problems on a massive scale. They say the easiest way to get a billion dollars is to help a billion people. That's a lot of pressure on anyone, you can expect moments of frustration and disappointments. 

So when otherwise successful artistes, movie stars, sportsmen self-destruct through harmful habits such as overdose on drugs, suicide or eating disorders, they simply haven't been able to handle frustration and disappointment effectively. 

To truly succeed and stay at the top, today's leader MUST be able to effectively train his brain on dealing with frustration, and be consciously able to reframe his thoughts to seeing the good in every problem. 

2018 will be like every other year. It's going to be about opportunities mixed with difficulties. Learning to spot the opportunities and not just identifying and complaining about the difficulties is what will eventually set you apart for leadership and positions of power. 

C. C. Paradise & Ebuka J. Anichebe Article @UN News #Youth2015

Kepada

1. SEKRETARIS JENDERAL PERSERIKATAN BANGSA-BANGSA 
melalui

B. UNOCHA REPUBLIK INDONESIA
C. UNIDO REPUBLIK INDONESIA

2. KEPALA NEGARA PESERTA UNFCCC melalui DUTA BESAR
a. Presiden Amerika Serikat
b. Presiden Cina
c. Perdana Menteri Jepang
d. Perdana Menteri Belanda
e. Perdana Menteri Inggris
f. Perdana Menteri Perancis
g. Perdana Menteri Australia
h. Perdana menteri Norwegia
i.  Perdana Menteri Denmark
j.  Kanselir Jerman 

3. EUROPEAN UNION INDONESIA
( Tanda terima dalam foto Kronologi kami )

DI- 
Tempat
Dengan hormat,
Menurut yang kami baca,dalam KESEPAKATAN PARIS ( PARIS AGREEMENT ) dampak dari kegiatan kehutanan di dunia,yang di kerjakan,lakukan,demi menjaga PERUBAHAN IKLIM,PEMANASAN GLOBAL,yang demi kehidupan,kemaslahatan,seluruh makhluk hidup di planet bumi ini menjadi tanggung jawab seluruh dunia,seluruh negara yang tergabung dalam UNFCCC.

Mengapa dunia internasional tidak peduli jika,bila, telah menjadi kesepakatan dalam KONVENSI,PERJANJIAN,dunia INTERNASIONAL,terhadap apa yang telah kami beritahukan,kali laporkan,kami telah melaporkan sebanyak dua kali,karena pembangunan kehutanan di REPUBLIK INDONESIA telah berdampak buruk pada kami masyarakat yang berada di dalam dan sekitar hutan,padahal tujuan pembangunan kehutanan itu adalah : menahan laju kenaikan suhu bumi di bawah 2 derajat,mengurangi dampak gas buang/emisi rumah kaca ( GRK ),sebagai cadangan karbon,penyedia oksigen bagi seluruh dunia dll

Sementara dampak yang telah kami alami adalah :
1. Tanah / lahan garapan / lahan pertanian / lahan olahan kami di gusur, 
Di serobot,di garap paksa.
2. Terjadi dugaan pelanggaran terhadap undang-undang lingkungan hidup dan peraturan lainnya dengan di garap nya daerah aliran sungai dengan di tanami nya akasia dan ecalyptus kemudian mereka panen kembali,merubah badan sungai,terjadinya penyempitan dan pelebaran badan sungai,memanfaatkan daerah aliran sungai dan bantaran sungai tanpa izin,membuang limbah kegiatan nursery ke aliran sungai. 
3. Perusahaan juga tidak/belum melaksanakan kewajibannya seperti contoh membangun tanaman kehidupan sebesar 20 % dari areal tertanam,mengikut sertakan modal koperasi desa dan juga merealisasikan janji nya untuk merehabilitasi dan reboisasi daerah aliran sungai.
4. Makam / kuburan,leluhur,nenek moyang kami,yang telah di cek,di lakukan inventarisasi bersama pihak perusahaan pun di gusur kembali oleh pihak perusahaan. 
5. Perusahaan juga di duga melanggar perizinan yang berlaku di REPUBLIK INDONESIA,PROVINSI SUMATERA SELATAN,KABUPATEN MUSI BANYUASIN

Sesuai dengan isi,bunyi.surat yang kami antarkan,berikan langsung,masih banyak lagi dugaan,indikasi pelanggaran yang telah di lakukan oleh PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI,APP GROUP,SINAR MAS GROUP,dan hal tersebut telah di verifikasi faktual oleh TIM dari DIREKTORAT PENEGAKAN HUKUM,KEMENTERIAN LINGKUNGAN HIDUP dan KEHUTANAN,dan laporan kami tak terbantahkan,namun berita acara verifikasi tak kami tanda tangani karena banyak hal yang tak kami sepakati bersama TIM dan pihak perusahaan.

Kami mempertanyakan komitmen dunia internasional yang tidak mau menerima produk yang tidak ramah lingkungan,tidak mengikuti standar internasional ( MELALUI SERTIFIKASI KEGIATAN dan juga SERTIFIKASI PRODUK,karena kami juga telah menyampaikan bantahan,sanggahan atas produk PULP and PAPER yang di hasilkan oleh APP GROUP,SINAR MAS GROUP ) dalam membangun hutan serta melanggar hak-hak masyarakat dan tidak melaksanakan kewajiban serta melanggar HAK ASASI MANUSIA. 

Melalui surat terbuka ini kami mohon kepada dunia internasional agar kira nya dapat mematuhi,manjalan kan apa yang telah di sepakati,mengingat pemerintah kami sendiri REPUBLIK INDONESIA,seakan,terkesan,setengah hati,dalam menangani,menyelesaikan,permasalahan kami dengan PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI,APP GROUP,SINAR MAS GROUP.

Untuk membuktikan atas apa yang telah kami berikan, laporkan,kepada dunia internasional dapat membuktikan nya sendiri dengan melakukan investigasi terhadap apa yang telah kami beritahukan,laporkan.
Demikianlah surat terbuka ini kami buat,dengan harapan dunia internasional peduli pada permasalahan ini dan dapat kami pertanggung jawabkan kebenaran nya.

文章內容:
Goal 2 of the #GlobalGoals aims to leave no one behind in anything--including at the dinner table. However, in many societies women and girls eat the food remaining after the male family members have eaten. Women, girls, the sick and disabled are the main victims of this "food discrimination", which results in chronic undernutrition and ill-health.

Fortunately, the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) has a plan to help: http://bit.ly/2DoRLXI

"Migration powers economic growth, reduces inequalities and connects diverse societies," writes United Nations Secretary-General Ant?nio Guterres in a new op-ed. 

Read it here ?? http://bit.ly/2D531uz #JoinTogether #GlobalGoals

文章內容:
Good news for Planet Earth! A new NASA study shows that a decline in ozone-depleting chemicals in the air has resulted in 20% less depletion in the ozone layer since 2005. It was the Montreal Protocol, an international agreement signed in 1987, that helped secure this promising future for our ozone layer.

Learn about the #MontrealProtocol & become an ozone superhero yourself! https://ozoneheroes.org/
