文章內容:
The biennial Global Platform for Disaster Risk Reduction focuses on reducing the effects of natural disasters and building the resilience of communities and nations. People at this year's meeting in Cancun, held now through 27 May, will discuss how to implement a global accountability mechanism to measure reductions in numbers of disaster affected people and economic losses. 

Details: http://bit.ly/2rimfY5 #MEXICOGP2017 #GlobalGoals

Healthy oceans are critical for sustaining life and eliminating poverty, but they're in serious trouble mostly due to human activities. It's time to #SaveOurOcean and take action to conserve and sustainably use our marine resources.

Follow the United Nations Ocean Conference from 5-9 June: oceanconference.un.org
留言:
['#Environmental 
Friendliness.

Why is it a must for us to protect the environment? The answer is because physically in it we live, work, and do all things.

There are other four (4) things we need to know about the environment for the benefit of humanity:

1. The environment was created before man was made. 

2. The environment can survive without man, it is independent!

3. The environment was created to support humanity. 

4. The environment was created in an orderly manner.

All indications shows that the environment is no more in order, that is why leaves are failing, animals are fleeing, weather is changing abnormally, epidemic keep breaking out, and occurences of natural disasters, just to mention a few.

Now is the critical time to take the subject matter of the environment serious than ever! The earlier we act the better for us all. 

The job is for all of us. The government, International Organisations and Non Governmental Oganisations must work together and be in the fore front to providing the support; awareness, funds, rules and regulations that will regulate industrial externalities and promote clean world. The secondary player which is the (house hold) also have great work to do by thinking green when making purchases and considering eating green. We must begin to think and act our way back to where we came from; that peaceful garden!

Bottom Line
The environment was created to support and sustain humanity; men, living things and non-living things on the planet earth. Our survial as human beings is directly proportional to the workings of the environment. When the environment follow its natural order things will go well with the inhabitants. We depend on the environment to survive and so we must take care of it.

By: Adeleke Amos Ayodele
From: West Africa (Nigeria).', "SURAT TERBUKA
Di mana,kapan dan bagaimana,pelaksanaan,implementasi,komitmen,dunia internasional terhadap dampak dari pembangunan kehutanan yang demi kehidupan seluruh manusia yang berada dalam planet bumi ini.
Yang tertulis,tertuang dalam KESEPAKATAN PARIS,PARIS AGREEMENT,PARIS COP 21.
Inti / permalahan utama,permasalahan pokok,dari surat kami mempertanyakan tentang kesepakatan dunia internasional di bidang perubahan iklim,yang meminta,menyuruh,memerintah kan negara kita untuk menjaga hutan,walaupun ada kata-kata sukarela, yang menurut mereka paru-paru dunia,
Dalam kesepakatan paris,PARIS COP21, semua DUNIA INTERNASIONAL yang tergabung dalam UNFCCC,turut bertanggung jawab terhadap dampak dari kegiatan, ( kegiatan kehutanan ) mempertahankan,menunda,memperlambat,laju perubahan iklim,menyediakan cadangan karbon bagi dunia internasional,menahan kenaikan suhu bumi di bawah 2 derajat dan lain-lain.
Apa peduli dunia internasional akibat dari kegiatan kehutanan di indonesia,makam/kuburan nenek moyang,leluhur kami di gusur,lahan pertanian kami di gusur,di garap,di ambil paksa,hak sasi manusia kami di langgar,lingkungan hidup,lingkungan alam di rusak,mereka tidak peduli pada dampak sosial,hal ini di lakukan oleh PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI,APPGROUP,SINAR MAS GROUP yang produknya,produksinya di beli juga oleh negara peserta UNFCCC. 
seperti kata yth.bapak yusup kalla dalam acara debat kandidat saat kampanye presiden di tv one,...” barat tak adil,kita di suruh menjaga hutan,menjadi satpam hutan dunia sementara hutan mereka telah jauh lebih dahulu habis,toh hutan kita mereka juga yang menghabiskan”....( kalau tidak salah dalam mengingat dan membaca )
Kapan,di mana,bagaimana.....pelaksanaan,tindak lanjut,BUKTI NYATA, dari kesepakatan paris/paris agreement,COP 21....
Kepada
Yth.Sekretaris JENDERAL PERSERIKATAN BANGSA-BANGSA
Melalui administrator facebook united nations
Dengan hormat,
ma'af sebelumnya,
Kami telah memberikan surat kepada sekretaris jenderal perserikatan bangsa-bangsa melalui perwakilan di negara REPUBLIK INDONESIA.
Surat kami berikan pada :
1. UNDP INDONESIA
2.UNIDO INDONESIA
3.UN OCHA Indonesia
Surat pertama ( 1 ) kami berikan pada tanggal 16 september 2016 dengan nama penerima tidak tertera/tercantum.
surat ke dua ( 2 ) kami berikan pada perwakilan united nations di indonesia pada tanggal 29 maret 2017 di terima oleh saudari lidya.
Surat kami berikan untuk di beritahukan,di sampaikan kepada SEKRETARIS JENDERAL PERSERIKATAN BANGSA-BANGSA,UNDP,UNIDO dan juga UN OCHA.
apakah surat kami tersebut telah di sampaikan oleh perwakilan perserikatan bangsa-bangsa di indonesia.
Surat kami berisi tentang dampak pembangunan hutan di indonesia,kegiatan kehutanan di INDONESIA demi menjaga perubahan iklim,menahan laju kenaikan suhu bumi di bawah 2 derajat,dan juga cadangan karbon bagi dunia internasional.
Kami memberitahukan,melaporkan kegiatan tersebut dan dampaknya bagi masyarakat sesuai dengan kesepakatan paris bahwa pembanngunan dan dampak dari kegiatan tersebut di atas merupakan tanggung jawab seluruh dunia.
Adapun dampak yang kami terima dari kegiatan kehutanan di bidang hutan tanaman industri di REPUBLIK INDONESIA yang di lakukan oleh PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI,APP GROUP,SINAR MAS GROUP adalah dugaan PELANGGARAN TERHADAP HAK ASASI MANUSIA,dugaan pelanggaran terhadap HAK-HAK MASYARAKAT ATAS TANAH ( AGRARIA ),dugaan PELANGGARAN TERHADAP UNDANG-UNDANG LINGKUNGAN HIDUP,ketidak PEDULIAN TERHADAP DAMPAK SOSIAL,PELANGGARAN TERHADAP PERIZINAN dan lain sebagainya. 
Maka dengan ini kami melaporkan,memberitahukan tentang sisi/dampak positif dan negatif dari pembangunan hutan di REPUBLIK INDONESIA.yang telah kami uraikan,sampaikan melalui surat kami tersebut.
dengan sangat,serta hormat kami mohon informasinya apakah surat kami tersebut telah di terima UNIDO,UNDP,UNOCHA,EUROPEAN UNION.
Kami juga meminta kepada DUNIA INTERNASIONAL dan EUROPEAN UNION yang menerima,membeli,produk pulp and paper asal REPUBLIK INDONESIA, agar mempertimbangkan kembali,memikirkan kembali,meninjau ulang pembelian produk PULP and PAPER asal REPUBLIK INDONESIA yang di produksi oleh ASIA PULP and PAPER ( APP ),SINAR MAS GROUP.
demikianlah ,terima kasih.
Yth. EUROPEAN UNION
Dengan hormat,
ma'af sebelum nya,
saya mursal berasal dari negara di asia tenggara,yaitu REPUBLIK INDONESIA ( INA ),kami telah memberikan surat kepada european union in Jakarta ( Uni eropa jakarta ) untuk di serahkan,di berikan kepada EUROPEAN UNION pada tanggal 19 September 2016 di terima oleh saudari Nona,karena belum ada respon ,tanggapan,tindak lanjut dari european union kami memberikan surat kembali pada tanggal 28 Maret 2017 di terima oleh saudari MUTIARA.
Apakah surat tersebut telah di kirimkan oleh european union in jakarta kepada EUROPEAN UNION ,karena surat kami tujukan,kami berikan untuk EUROPEAN UNION.
Karena tak mungkin bagi kami untuk mengirimkan,memberikan kepada european union secara langsung maka surat kami berikan melalui perwakilan di indonesia.
dengan hormat,serta sangat kami mohon informasi tentang surat kami apakah telah diterima oleh EUROPEAN UNION.
Demikianlah,terima kasih.
Yth.UNIDO,
selamat malam waktu Indonesia,
Ma'af sebelumnya,
saya mursal berasal dari negara Asia tenggara ,Republik Indonesia,kami telah memberikan surat kepada UNIDO Indonesia pada tanggal 29 Maret 2017 di terima oleh saudara Lidya dengan nomor Special Istimewa.
Surat kami berikan kepada UNIDO Indonesia sebagai perwakilan di negara kami untuk di sampaikan kepada UNIDO.
Kami Mohon dengan sangat serta hormat Informasi dari UNIDO mengenai surat kami,apakah sudah di kirimkan oleh UNIDO INDONESIA kepada UNIDO.
Demikianlah,terima kasih,
Pengirim
Mursal
Arjoni
Yth.UNDP,
selamat malam waktu Indonesia,
Ma'af sebelumnya,
saya mursal berasal dari negara Asia tenggara ,Republik Indonesia,kami telah memberikan surat kepada UNDP Indonesia pada tanggal 29 Maret 2017 di terima oleh saudara Lidya dengan nomor Special Istimewa.
Surat kami berikan kepada UNDP Indonesia sebagai perwakilan di negara kami untuk di sampaikan kepada UNDP.
Kami Mohon dengan sangat serta hormat Informasi dari UNDP mengenai surat kami,apakah sudah di kirimkan oleh UNDP INDONESIA kepada UNDP.
Demikianlah,terima kasih,
Pengirim
Mursal
Arjoni
Yth.United Natons OCHA,
selamat malam waktu Indonesia,
Ma'af sebelumnya,
saya mursal berasal dari negara Asia tenggara ,Republik Indonesia,kami telah memberikan surat kepada United Nations OCHA Indonesia pada tanggal 29 Maret 2017 di terima oleh saudara Lidya dengan nomor Special Istimewa.
Surat kami berikan kepada United nations OCHA Indonesia sebagai perwakilan di negara kami untuk di sampaikan kepada United Nations OCHA.
Kami Mohon dengan sangat serta hormat Informasi dari United Nations OCHA mengenai surat kami,apakah sudah di kirimkan oleh United Nations OCHA INDONESIA kepada United Nations OCHA.
Demikianlah,terima kasih,
Pengirim
Mursal

seperti kata yth.bapak yusup kalla dalam acara debat kandidat saat kampanye presiden di tv one,...” barat tak adil,kita di suruh menjaga hutan,menjadi satpam hutan dunia sementara hutan mereka telah jauh lebih dahulu habis,toh hutan kita mereka juga yang menghabiskan”....( kalau tidak salah dalam mengingat dan membaca )
Kapan,di mana,bagaimana.....pelaksanaan,tindak lanjut,BUKTI NYATA, dari kesepakatan paris/paris agreement,COP 21....
Kepada
Yth.Sekretaris JENDERAL PERSERIKATAN BANGSA-BANGSA
Melalui administrator facebook united nations
Dengan hormat,
ma'af sebelumnya,
Kami telah memberikan surat kepada sekretaris jenderal perserikatan bangsa-bangsa melalui perwakilan di negara REPUBLIK INDONESIA.
Surat kami berikan pada :
1. UNDP INDONESIA
2.UNIDO INDONESIA
3.UN OCHA Indonesia
Surat pertama ( 1 ) kami berikan pada tanggal 16 september 2016 dengan nama penerima tidak tertera/tercantum.
surat ke dua ( 2 ) kami berikan pada perwakilan united nations di indonesia pada tanggal 29 maret 2017 di terima oleh saudari lidya.
Surat kami berikan untuk di beritahukan,di sampaikan kepada SEKRETARIS JENDERAL PERSERIKATAN BANGSA-BANGSA,UNDP,UNIDO dan juga UN OCHA.
apakah surat kami tersebut telah di sampaikan oleh perwakilan perserikatan bangsa-bangsa di indonesia.
Surat kami berisi tentang dampak pembangunan hutan di indonesia,kegiatan kehutanan di INDONESIA demi menjaga perubahan iklim,menahan laju kenaikan suhu bumi di bawah 2 derajat,dan juga cadangan karbon bagi dunia internasional.
Kami memberitahukan,melaporkan kegiatan tersebut dan dampaknya bagi masyarakat sesuai dengan kesepakatan paris bahwa pembanngunan dan dampak dari kegiatan tersebut di atas merupakan tanggung jawab seluruh dunia.
Adapun dampak yang kami terima dari kegiatan kehutanan di bidang hutan tanaman industri di REPUBLIK INDONESIA yang di lakukan oleh PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI,APP GROUP,SINAR MAS GROUP adalah dugaan PELANGGARAN TERHADAP HAK ASASI MANUSIA,dugaan pelanggaran terhadap HAK-HAK MASYARAKAT ATAS TANAH ( AGRARIA ),dugaan PELANGGARAN TERHADAP UNDANG-UNDANG LINGKUNGAN HIDUP,ketidak PEDULIAN TERHADAP DAMPAK SOSIAL,PELANGGARAN TERHADAP PERIZINAN dan lain sebagainya. 
Maka dengan ini kami melaporkan,memberitahukan tentang sisi/dampak positif dan negatif dari pembangunan hutan di REPUBLIK INDONESIA.yang telah kami uraikan,sampaikan melalui surat kami tersebut.
dengan sangat,serta hormat kami mohon informasinya apakah surat kami tersebut telah di terima UNIDO,UNDP,UNOCHA,EUROPEAN UNION.
Kami juga meminta kepada DUNIA INTERNASIONAL dan EUROPEAN UNION yang menerima,membeli,produk pulp and paper asal REPUBLIK INDONESIA, agar mempertimbangkan kembali,memikirkan kembali,meninjau ulang pembelian produk PULP and PAPER asal REPUBLIK INDONESIA yang di produksi oleh ASIA PULP and PAPER ( APP ),SINAR MAS GROUP.
demikianlah ,terima kasih.
Yth. EUROPEAN UNION
Dengan hormat,
ma'af sebelum nya,
saya mursal berasal dari negara di asia tenggara,yaitu REPUBLIK INDONESIA ( INA ),kami telah memberikan surat kepada european union in Jakarta ( Uni eropa jakarta ) untuk di serahkan,di berikan kepada EUROPEAN UNION pada tanggal 19 September 2016 di terima oleh saudari Nona,karena belum ada respon ,tanggapan,tindak lanjut dari european union kami memberikan surat kembali pada tanggal 28 Maret 2017 di terima oleh saudari MUTIARA.
Apakah surat tersebut telah di kirimkan oleh european union in jakarta kepada EUROPEAN UNION ,karena surat kami tujukan,kami berikan untuk EUROPEAN UNION.
Karena tak mungkin bagi kami untuk mengirimkan,memberikan kepada european union secara langsung maka surat kami berikan melalui perwakilan di indonesia.
dengan hormat,serta sangat kami mohon informasi tentang surat kami apakah telah diterima oleh EUROPEAN UNION.
Demikianlah,terima kasih.
Yth.UNIDO,
selamat malam waktu Indonesia,
Ma'af sebelumnya,
saya mursal berasal dari negara Asia tenggara ,Republik Indonesia,kami telah memberikan surat kepada UNIDO Indonesia pada tanggal 29 Maret 2017 di terima oleh saudara Lidya dengan nomor Special Istimewa.
Surat kami berikan kepada UNIDO Indonesia sebagai perwakilan di negara kami untuk di sampaikan kepada UNIDO.
Kami Mohon dengan sangat serta hormat Informasi dari UNIDO mengenai surat kami,apakah sudah di kirimkan oleh UNIDO INDONESIA kepada UNIDO.
Demikianlah,terima kasih,
Pengirim
Mursal
Arjoni
Yth.UNDP,
selamat malam waktu Indonesia,
Ma'af sebelumnya,
saya mursal berasal dari negara Asia tenggara ,Republik Indonesia,kami telah memberikan surat kepada UNDP Indonesia pada tanggal 29 Maret 2017 di terima oleh saudara Lidya dengan nomor Special Istimewa.
Surat kami berikan kepada UNDP Indonesia sebagai perwakilan di negara kami untuk di sampaikan kepada UNDP.
Kami Mohon dengan sangat serta hormat Informasi dari UNDP mengenai surat kami,apakah sudah di kirimkan oleh UNDP INDONESIA kepada UNDP.
Demikianlah,terima kasih,
Pengirim
Mursal
Arjoni
Yth.United Natons OCHA,
selamat malam waktu Indonesia,
Ma'af sebelumnya,
saya mursal berasal dari negara Asia tenggara ,Republik Indonesia,kami telah memberikan surat kepada United Nations OCHA Indonesia pada tanggal 29 Maret 2017 di terima oleh saudara Lidya dengan nomor Special Istimewa.
Surat kami berikan kepada United nations OCHA Indonesia sebagai perwakilan di negara kami untuk di sampaikan kepada United Nations OCHA.
Kami Mohon dengan sangat serta hormat Informasi dari United Nations OCHA mengenai surat kami,apakah sudah di kirimkan oleh United Nations OCHA INDONESIA kepada United Nations OCHA.
Demikianlah,terima kasih,

For almost 50 years, Noorjahan lived with fistula—a childbirth injury that leaves women leaking urine or faeces. Today, thanks to UNFPA, she no longer suffers from this condition and can smile again: bit.ly/2r9DmLJ

#EndFistula #WomensHealth #GlobalGoals

文章內容:
About 6.5% of the world's population is at risk of being left behind in extreme poverty in 2030 due to slow global economic growth, warns a new United Nations financing for development report. 

Secretary-General Ant?nio Guterres called on countries to make long-term investments in the #GlobalGoals, adding that conflicts and megatrends such as climate change also put the progress of the last few decades at risk.

Report: https://developmentfinance.un.org/

['Would you please sign and SHARE this - a petition now calling on the G20 to invest in the prevention of pandemics? https://www.globalcitizen.org/en/action/g20-row-pandemics-petition/ 
The World Health Organisation has just announced a new Ebola outbreak. The planet’s wealthiest countries should do more to prepare for disease crises; the sooner a disease is brought under control, the fewer lives will destroyed, and destruction of economies and families can be minimalised.
Sorry that this seems random –I’m simply trying to spread this because it’s literally a matter of life and widespread death. 
Huge thanks :)', "SURAT TERBUKA
Di mana,kapan dan bagaimana,pelaksanaan,implementasi,komitmen,dunia internasional terhadap dampak dari pembangunan kehutanan yang demi kehidupan seluruh manusia yang berada dalam planet bumi ini.
Yang tertulis,tertuang dalam KESEPAKATAN PARIS,PARIS AGREEMENT,PARIS COP 21.
Inti / permalahan utama,permasalahan pokok,dari surat kami mempertanyakan tentang kesepakatan dunia internasional di bidang perubahan iklim,yang meminta,menyuruh,memerintah kan negara kita untuk menjaga hutan,walaupun ada kata-kata sukarela, yang menurut mereka paru-paru dunia,
Dalam kesepakatan paris,PARIS COP21, semua DUNIA INTERNASIONAL yang tergabung dalam UNFCCC,turut bertanggung jawab terhadap dampak dari kegiatan, ( kegiatan kehutanan ) mempertahankan,menunda,memperlambat,laju perubahan iklim,menyediakan cadangan karbon bagi dunia internasional,menahan kenaikan suhu bumi di bawah 2 derajat dan lain-lain.
Apa peduli dunia internasional akibat dari kegiatan kehutanan di indonesia,makam/kuburan nenek moyang,leluhur kami di gusur,lahan pertanian kami di gusur,di garap,di ambil paksa,hak sasi manusia kami di langgar,lingkungan hidup,lingkungan alam di rusak,mereka tidak peduli pada dampak sosial,hal ini di lakukan oleh PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI,APPGROUP,SINAR MAS GROUP yang produknya,produksinya di beli juga oleh negara peserta UNFCCC. 
seperti kata yth.bapak yusup kalla dalam acara debat kandidat saat kampanye presiden di tv one,...” barat tak adil,kita di suruh menjaga hutan,menjadi satpam hutan dunia sementara hutan mereka telah jauh lebih dahulu habis,toh hutan kita mereka juga yang menghabiskan”....( kalau tidak salah dalam mengingat dan membaca )
Kapan,di mana,bagaimana.....pelaksanaan,tindak lanjut,BUKTI NYATA, dari kesepakatan paris/paris agreement,COP 21....
Kepada
Yth.Sekretaris JENDERAL PERSERIKATAN BANGSA-BANGSA
Melalui administrator facebook united nations
Dengan hormat,
ma'af sebelumnya,
Kami telah memberikan surat kepada sekretaris jenderal perserikatan bangsa-bangsa melalui perwakilan di negara REPUBLIK INDONESIA.
Surat kami berikan pada :
1. UNDP INDONESIA
2.UNIDO INDONESIA
3.UN OCHA Indonesia
Surat pertama ( 1 ) kami berikan pada tanggal 16 september 2016 dengan nama penerima tidak tertera/tercantum.
surat ke dua ( 2 ) kami berikan pada perwakilan united nations di indonesia pada tanggal 29 maret 2017 di terima oleh saudari lidya.
Surat kami berikan untuk di beritahukan,di sampaikan kepada SEKRETARIS JENDERAL PERSERIKATAN BANGSA-BANGSA,UNDP,UNIDO dan juga UN OCHA.
apakah surat kami tersebut telah di sampaikan oleh perwakilan perserikatan bangsa-bangsa di indonesia.
Surat kami berisi tentang dampak pembangunan hutan di indonesia,kegiatan kehutanan di INDONESIA demi menjaga perubahan iklim,menahan laju kenaikan suhu bumi di bawah 2 derajat,dan juga cadangan karbon bagi dunia internasional.
Kami memberitahukan,melaporkan kegiatan tersebut dan dampaknya bagi masyarakat sesuai dengan kesepakatan paris bahwa pembanngunan dan dampak dari kegiatan tersebut di atas merupakan tanggung jawab seluruh dunia.
Adapun dampak yang kami terima dari kegiatan kehutanan di bidang hutan tanaman industri di REPUBLIK INDONESIA yang di lakukan oleh PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI,APP GROUP,SINAR MAS GROUP adalah dugaan PELANGGARAN TERHADAP HAK ASASI MANUSIA,dugaan pelanggaran terhadap HAK-HAK MASYARAKAT ATAS TANAH ( AGRARIA ),dugaan PELANGGARAN TERHADAP UNDANG-UNDANG LINGKUNGAN HIDUP,ketidak PEDULIAN TERHADAP DAMPAK SOSIAL,PELANGGARAN TERHADAP PERIZINAN dan lain sebagainya. 
Maka dengan ini kami melaporkan,memberitahukan tentang sisi/dampak positif dan negatif dari pembangunan hutan di REPUBLIK INDONESIA.yang telah kami uraikan,sampaikan melalui surat kami tersebut.
dengan sangat,serta hormat kami mohon informasinya apakah surat kami tersebut telah di terima UNIDO,UNDP,UNOCHA,EUROPEAN UNION.
Kami juga meminta kepada DUNIA INTERNASIONAL dan EUROPEAN UNION yang menerima,membeli,produk pulp and paper asal REPUBLIK INDONESIA, agar mempertimbangkan kembali,memikirkan kembali,meninjau ulang pembelian produk PULP and PAPER asal REPUBLIK INDONESIA yang di produksi oleh ASIA PULP and PAPER ( APP ),SINAR MAS GROUP.
demikianlah ,terima kasih.
Yth. EUROPEAN UNION

To support today's #WorldDiversityDay, why not apply for the Intercultural Innovation Award? It's a partnership between the United Nations Alliance of Civilizations (UNAOC) and the BMW Group that aims to select and support the most innovative grassroots projects that encourage intercultural dialogue and cooperation around the world.

Deadline is 31 May, 5 p.m. EDT. Details: https://interculturalinnovation.org/the-award/

文章內容:
Just under 50% of all deaths globally don't have a recorded cause, says the 2017 World Health Organization (WHO) report.  While this is an improvement from 2005, when only about a third of deaths had a recorded cause, there's still work to do to better track public health trends. 

Details: https://goo.gl/4j9ihK 
#HealthData #GlobalGoals

文章內容:
Our ocean contributes to ending poverty by providing food and jobs, and acts as the primary regulator of the global climate. Despite this importance, the ocean is in serious trouble.

The UN Ocean Conference, 5-9 June, will bring together all stakeholders to take action to conserve and sustainably use our marine resources. 

Details: oceanconference.un.org #SaveOurOcean

Kami telah memberikan surat kepada sekretaris jenderal perserikatan bangsa-bangsa melalui perwakilan di negara REPUBLIK INDONESIA.
Surat kami berikan pada :
1. UNDP INDONESIA
2.UNIDO INDONESIA
3.UN OCHA Indonesia
Surat pertama ( 1 ) kami berikan pada tanggal 16 september 2016 dengan nama penerima tidak tertera/tercantum.
surat ke dua ( 2 ) kami berikan pada perwakilan united nations di indonesia pada tanggal 29 maret 2017 di terima oleh saudari lidya.
Surat kami berikan untuk di beritahukan,di sampaikan kepada SEKRETARIS JENDERAL PERSERIKATAN BANGSA-BANGSA,UNDP,UNIDO dan juga UN OCHA.
apakah surat kami tersebut telah di sampaikan oleh perwakilan perserikatan bangsa-bangsa di indonesia.
Surat kami berisi tentang dampak pembangunan hutan di indonesia,kegiatan kehutanan di INDONESIA demi menjaga perubahan iklim,menahan laju kenaikan suhu bumi di bawah 2 derajat,dan juga cadangan karbon bagi dunia internasional.
Kami memberitahukan,melaporkan kegiatan tersebut dan dampaknya bagi masyarakat sesuai dengan kesepakatan paris bahwa pembanngunan dan dampak dari kegiatan tersebut di atas merupakan tanggung jawab seluruh dunia.
Adapun dampak yang kami terima dari kegiatan kehutanan di bidang hutan tanaman industri di REPUBLIK INDONESIA yang di lakukan oleh PT.BUMI PERSADA PERMAI,APP GROUP,SINAR MAS GROUP adalah dugaan PELANGGARAN TERHADAP HAK ASASI MANUSIA,dugaan pelanggaran terhadap HAK-HAK MASYARAKAT ATAS TANAH ( AGRARIA ),dugaan PELANGGARAN TERHADAP UNDANG-UNDANG LINGKUNGAN HIDUP,ketidak PEDULIAN TERHADAP DAMPAK SOSIAL,PELANGGARAN TERHADAP PERIZINAN dan lain sebagainya. 
Maka dengan ini kami melaporkan,memberitahukan tentang sisi/dampak positif dan negatif dari pembangunan hutan di REPUBLIK INDONESIA.yang telah kami uraikan,sampaikan melalui surat kami tersebut.
dengan sangat,serta hormat kami mohon informasinya apakah surat kami tersebut telah di terima UNIDO,UNDP,UNOCHA,EUROPEAN UNION.
Kami juga meminta kepada DUNIA INTERNASIONAL dan EUROPEAN UNION yang menerima,membeli,produk pulp and paper asal REPUBLIK INDONESIA, agar mempertimbangkan kembali,memikirkan kembali,meninjau ulang pembelian produk PULP and PAPER asal REPUBLIK INDONESIA yang di produksi oleh ASIA PULP and PAPER ( APP ),SINAR MAS GROUP.
demikianlah ,terima kasih.
Yth. EUROPEAN UNION
Dengan hormat,
ma'af sebelum nya,
saya mursal berasal dari negara di asia tenggara,yaitu REPUBLIK INDONESIA ( INA ),kami telah memberikan surat kepada european union in Jakarta ( Uni eropa jakarta ) untuk di serahkan,di berikan kepada EUROPEAN UNION pada tanggal 19 September 2016 di terima oleh saudari Nona,karena belum ada respon ,tanggapan,tindak lanjut dari european union kami memberikan surat kembali pada tanggal 28 Maret 2017 di terima oleh saudari MUTIARA.
Apakah surat tersebut telah di kirimkan oleh european union in jakarta kepada EUROPEAN UNION ,karena surat kami tujukan,kami berikan untuk EUROPEAN UNION.
Karena tak mungkin bagi kami untuk mengirimkan,memberikan kepada european union secara langsung maka surat kami berikan melalui perwakilan di indonesia.
dengan hormat,serta sangat kami mohon informasi tentang surat kami apakah telah diterima oleh EUROPEAN UNION.
Demikianlah,terima kasih.
Yth.UNIDO,
selamat malam waktu Indonesia,

文章內容:
The level of global carbon emissions has stalled for three straight years, reflecting a shift from coal to natural gas, more renewable energy in global power generation, improvements in energy efficiency and decelerated GDP growth in some major carbon emitters. 

However, these improvements could reverse without concerted effort from the public and private sectors to improve energy efficiency and promote renewable energy. 

More from #WESP2017 mid-year report: http://bit.ly/wespreport #GlobalGoals

留言:
['Would you please sign and SHARE this - calling on political leaders not to scrap the 0.7% (of our Nation’s wealth) that we give in aid? https://action.savethechildren.org.uk/ea-action/action?ea.client.id=7&ea.campaign.id=68655&Source%20Code=CFA006001 
(FYI, aid is roughly 1/20th of the money we make from developing countries http://www.filmsforaction.org/articles/aid-in-reverse-how-poor-countries-develop-rich-countries/  )
Whilst certain tabloids have endeavoured to misled us into thinking that aid is wasted; in reality, it is being used in the poorest places on the planet to save lives and end extreme agony – suffering far worse than we experience, suffering from which there is otherwise no escape (there’s no NHS, no benefits system, no career opportunities, no food banks or homeless shelters). The proportion of humanity in extreme poverty has fallen significantly because of aid in the recent decades; but there are still innocent people who need our help, so that they become able to help themselves. Aid is incredible value compared to money spent here; for example, the government spends £6000 annually on each child’s education, providing education for a child in a developing country costs several £hundreds (and is leading to falling birth rates, so parents are more able to look after each child better). 
We can genuinely help tackle some of the most extreme suffering if enough of us (and our contacts) let those in power know that we care.
Huge thanks!
Sorry that this seems random –I’m simply trying to spread this because it’s literally a matter of life and death. If you’re one of the people who think that Aid should be stopped, please look at this https://www.givingwhatwecan.org/get-involved/myths-about-aid/', 'UNCSD LNYLC & LifeCare supports & join the global celebration for these birds that connect habitats and cultures next Wednesday, May 10!', 'Sonam Paljor Prue Axam Michele Cotton']

["Instead of vaccines, stop forcing people to live in internment camps and slums and give them back their countries and the resources you took from them. Then they could develop proper infrastructure for sanitation and hygiene as well as systems for growing adequate nutrition. You can't depend only on vaccines. Vaccines wouldn't be necessary if people had the ability to maintain adequate living conditions to boost their natural immune systems. Even in major cities and suburbs in the U.S. the reason people are urged to use vaccines is because of how we live being an environment that fosters disease. People need proper hygiene, sanitation and nutrition. Industries that pollute our environment and produce products that harm our health, living in huge crowded cities and having a food system dominated by processed foods and gmos is not the environment that is going to allow us to develop properly. Instead of sacrificing those systems and that unsustainable infrastructure, the solution is to treat us like a herd of cattle and recommend vaccines, ignoring that we don't all live uniform lifestyles, our bodies don't respond in a uniform way to the same stimuli and each of us develop and respond uniquely and have different body chemistry so taking the same dosage and a mass produced uniform concoction of harmful chemicals and a synthesized version of the virus is going to eventually be useless like we've seen with antibiotics. It's absolutely ridiculous to criminalize people who choose not to vaccinate. There is no real data being collected on the adverse reactions mild to severe that people suffer with as a result of consuming vaccines. Meanwhile millions of people suffer mild to severe reactions from getting them and nobody has the right to tell anyone else that they have to settle for that suffering when they don't have to. We aren't a herd of cattle. Vaccines aren't the best way or the healthiest way. Vaccinating is the most efficient and profitable method for people in a centralized network of management to control a huge population. That is the foundation of vaccines and the fundamental goal for those who produce them.", 'And then privileged white people who have never seen these illnesses turn their backs on vaccines and endanger even more vulnerable children. ?

Despite some progress, there continues to be a gap between the formal recognition of indigenous peoples and the implementation of policies on the ground. As a result, indigenous peoples continue to face exclusion, marginalization and major challenges in enjoying their basic rights. The 16th Session of the United Nations Permanent Forum on Indigenous Issues, which starts today in New York, will try to bridge that gap. 

Watch opening: http://webtv.un.org 
Details: bit.ly/UNPFII16
#WeAreIndigenous #UNPFII16

Did you know? The United Nations Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples is the most comprehensive international instrument on indigenous peoples’ rights. It establishes a universal framework of minimum standards for the survival, dignity and well-being of indigenous peoples.

This year’s UN Permanent Forum on Indigenous Issues (UNPFII), which kicks off Monday in New York, celebrates the 10th anniversary of this pivotal declaration.

Details: bit.ly/UNPFII16

The United Nations-backed International Finance Facility for Education is vital to ensure that half of the world’s children don’t miss out on the basic schooling needed to meet the #GlobalGoals.

That’s the view of the UN Special Envoy for Global Education,  Gordon Brown, who said this week in an interview with UN News that “education has been neglected for too long” and the international community needs to “act now” through a new Financing Compact between developed and developing countries.

More via United Nations News Centre: http://bit.ly/2orHthe

文章內容:
The yellow-breasted bunting may look like just another colorful songbird, but in parts of Asia it's eaten as a delicacy. These birds are so prized that at one market in Sanshui, China, at least 10,000 birds are sold each day--no surprise that their population has decreased by 80% in 10 years. World Migratory Bird Day 2017, coming up on 10 May, will help bring attention to their plight. 

Learn about more endangered birds & what you can do to help via World Migratory Bird Day (WMBD): http://www.worldmigratorybirdday.org/ 

#TheirFutureIsOurFuture #GlobalGoals

A treat for the eyes and not a stuff for satisfying the palate.', 'hou could someone eat such beauty like this for an option only  . 文章內容:
Join United Nations Secretary-General Ant?nio Guterres and turn off your lights for Earth Hour this Saturday! Around the globe, millions of people, businesses, and landmarks--like the UN Secretariat in New York--will switch off their lights to take a stand for climate change action. Earth Hour is Saturday at 8:30-9:30 p.m. your local time. 

More info via WWF: https://www.earthhour.org/ 
#EarthHour #GlobalGoals

Today is World Meteorological Day! This year's theme, Understanding Clouds, highlights the enormous importance of clouds for weather, climate and water. Clouds play a critical role in the water cycle and shaping the global distribution of water resources. 

Do you know how to recognize clouds? Test yourself with the World Meteorological Organization's cloud atlas: http://bit.ly/2l0IAFu 

#WorldMetDay #GlobalGoals

文章內容:
Most of the wastewater we produce returns directly to the ecosystem without being treated or reused. The opportunities from exploiting wastewater as a resource are enormous. Safely managed wastewater is an affordable and sustainable source of water, energy and nutrients. Let’s reduce & reuse! 

www.worldwaterday.org #WorldWaterDay #GlobalGoals

文章內容:
Freshwater is the single most important natural resource on the planet, and it’s finite and increasingly scarce. It makes little sense to use drinking water for things like municipal washing, crop irrigation or industrial cooling. We need to treat and reuse more wastewater, at the same time as we reduce the quantity and pollution load of wastewater we produce. 

#WorldWaterDay is 22 March! www.worldwaterday.org

World Down Syndrome Day calls for enabling people with Down syndrome to speak to policy makers & people with influence. They must be included on a full and equal basis in all aspects of society.

Public health depends on access to safe water and sanitation. Polluting our water sources and environment with untreated wastewater puts people's lives at risk, especially in the poorest communities. Let's reduce and safely reuse wastewater to take better care of this precious resource and protect the health of our most vulnerable citizens. #WorldWaterDay is 22 March. #GlobalGoals 

www.worldwaterday.org

文章內容:
The 17 #GlobalGoals are the United Nations' road map toward achieving lasting peace, security and happiness for all people. Even the Smurfs know that one small individual can make a big difference. 

To celebrate the International Day of Happiness, the UN is hosting the Smurfs and "Smurfs: The Lost Village" voice actors Demi Lovato, Mandy Patinkin and Joe Manganiello today for a special event. Watch our Facebook Live on the United Nations Facebook page starting around 11 a.m. EDT. 

#SmallSmurfsBigGoals

One in five people still lack access to electricity, but Brainy Smurf knows that solar power is a simple and sustainable way to generate energy. Find out more about how you can pitch in at www.smallsmurfsbiggoals.com. 

#SmallSmurfsBigGoals #GlobalGoals

文章內容:
A large portion of the most common causes of death among children aged 1 month to 5 years—diarrhoea, malaria and pneumonia— are preventable by interventions known to reduce environmental risks, such as access to safe water and clean cooking fuels. 

New World Health Organization (WHO) report: www.who.int/phe
#GlobalGoals

In the first of a four-part series, United Nations Office for Project Services explores the story of one community taking part in a government scheme to improve 50,000 homes nationwide, through the eyes of Luis Alfredo Torres Redondo – a community leader known as Lucho. This is the story of El Salado, a small town which was the site of one of the worst massacres in Colombian history.

http://bit.ly/2iSrKEl #Seeds4Stability #GlobalGoals

Every day, lesbian, gay, bi, trans and intersex kids are bullied at school, at home and in their community. Children who experience this kind of abuse have a higher risk of anxiety, loneliness, low self-esteem, self-harm, depression and suicide. 

The United Nations calls on everyone to protect these children’s fundamental right to live free from violence and discrimination. Your actions matter! Details: bit.ly/2mrpDuy #theLesson #GlobalGoals

文章內容:
By placing poverty eradication at the centre of the #GlobalGoals, the 2030 Agenda sets a powerful vision towards creating peaceful and inclusive societies. This year, the 55th Commission for Social Development (1-10 February) will focus on "Strategies for eradicating poverty to achieve sustainable development for all."

The #CSocD55 will provide an opportunity for dialogue on policy options to make further progress on the eradication of poverty, building on the experience in implementing the Copenhagen Programme of Action adopted at the World Summit for Social Development. Learn more here: http://bit.ly/csocd55
留言:
['MY THOUGHTS ABOUT THE SDGs
"I think the menace of drug abuse and addiction is underestimated. Eradicating drug addiction in all its forms and ramification is a major global challenge and is crutial to ending poverty, hunger, infant mortality, crime and ensuring healthy lives."

The greatest challenge I faced as a graduate Psychologist was fixing my younger brother's drug addiction problem. It was a very hard nut that I was compelled to launch an investigation into the case. After 15 months of research and observation, I came to understand that DRUG ADDICTION is not what we think it is [you can read the report here https://www.naij.com/1076758-the-surprising-truth-addiction.html ]

That is not all, I also realised that the very factors militating against global development (hunger, poverty, crime, infant mortality, spread of HIV/AIDS and illiteracy) are to a greater degree influenced by drug addiction. 

About seventeen years ago, the Millennium Development Goals were agreed, which promised among other goals to end poverty in all its forms everywhere, end hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition, ensure healthy lives, promote well-being for all (particularly those related to maternal, newborn and child health and reproductive health) in 15years. 

This target was not met, particularly among the most vulnerable (children, youth, persons with disabilities, people living with HIV/AIDS, older persons, indigenous people, internally displaced persons and migrants) in Africa, least developed countries, landlocked developing countries, and small island developing States. These are states suffering from the epidemic of drug abuse and addiction. 

And it is getting worst... 

A research conducted in Nigeria (in 2005) among adolescents reported that 69.3% respondents were abusing psychoactive drugs. With all the war against drug use and trafficking, later research published in 2014 in the Global Journal of Medicine and Public Health (Vol. 3, issue 6) revealed that the consumption of illegal drugs and the harmful use of other psychoactive substances has increased at an alarming rate over the years. It went on to state that Nigeria is the highest consumer of cannabis and amphetamines in Africa. These are the set of people who drop out of school and easily resolve to criminal acts to make ends meet. For every one of these people we fold our arms and watch go down this path of self-destruction,
That is one more person we'll have to protect ourselves and love ones from. 
That is one more person who would've become a productive member of the society, 	creating jobs and solving problems, become enervated. 
That is one more infant who faces the risk of abuse and malnutrition.  

Every one of these youngsters are important to us as a people, we must not lose any of them to drugs or any form of abuse. 

INTERVENTION
My team recognised that eradicating drug abuse in all its forms and ramification is a major global challenge and an indispensable requirement for sustainable growth and development. We also understand that no government or single entity can fight it alone, winning this war requires the collaborative effort of stakeholders, NGOs, the media and everyone and we'd committed ourselves to this course. We adopted the Matrix Intensive Outpatient Treatment Manual developed by U.S. Department of Health and Human Services for this purpose. 

10 years ago, we watched drug addicts only in movies, 
But now, they are our friends, neighbours, and siblings. 

If we bring up just one generation correctly, 
If we give today ’s children what they need, 
Even to a small extent and encourage them to pass it on, 
Generations to come will no longer be declining, but ascending. 
Otherwise, generations unborn will sink into despair and drugs;
What a pity for our children." 

Sincerely yours, 
Sarki Gadah, 
From Nigeria.', "Pur meritevole di rispetto, come direbbe anche #Lenin, l'ascetismo non ? la via delle masse. Mi compiaccio. Giusto si affermi una visione #integrale e #sostenibile per la #crescita", 'That is great.', 'Great one', '? great initiative indeed.']

The #SDGLive stage at the World Economic Forum happening now in Davos, Switzerland, brings the global problem-solving to you! Watch the conversation between Patricia Espinosa of UNFCCC and Erik Solheim of UN Environment on combatting climate change and protecting our planet.

#GlobalGoals #WEF2017
留言:
["Hi I am from Tamil Nadu ( India)  here lakhs of lakhs youngsters are doing protesters from more than 6 days to ban PETA in India and we want jallikattu. But state government and central government didn't take a single positive step. Here all the youngsters need help from union nation council to take step.", 'After cop22 WE need to make true action !', "Combating Climate Change

The time is now to embrace the call to Combat Climate Change for the survival of human race among other things. But certain things needed to be done before we can subscribe to combat climate change.

First, we need to realise and accept the fact that we, as human beings have failed our responsibility given to us by God in the Garden of Eden according to the account in Genesis Chapter two. 

Secondly, we need to know that our living, well being and sustainability are tied to the condition of our environment. Climate change has a lot of health and economic implications. Climate change can increase poverty rates in the world, it can reduce life expetancy of the people in the world as it usher in diseases, it can increase global rates of natural disasters etc.

However, the time is now, when we need to see the global call to Combat Climate Change as God's call - as he commanded us in the garden of Eden to dress and keep the garden. It is the sole responsibility of ALL; government organisations, non governmental organisations, private sectors, and house hold as well as individual to ensure that we care for our environment if we want this temporal world to be habitable for us and the posterity. 

Finally, the world we live now is not in good order as far as Climate condition is concerned and this is caused by our actions and inactions. This has led to series of problems but we have all the resources needed to take care of climate change, so, let us act now.

By: Adeleke Amos Ayodele
E-Mail: adelekeamosa1@gmail.com
Country: Nigeria", 'Combating climate change needs well coordination of each living creatures (human, birds, animals, plants, whole ecosystem). Each creatures must have equal rights to their habitation.
Thanks', "Let us stop wars everywhere to stop it's effect upon climate change", 'Shaye D??ng', 'https://m.facebook.com/story.php?story_fbid=1409401799132588&id=573101092762667']

Today is Martin Luther King, Jr. Day in the US. Dr. King was a visionary civil rights leader and recipient of the 1964 Nobel Peace Prize.

In this photo from 1964, Dr. King and his wife, Coretta Scott King, are greeted by Ralph J. Bunche, UN Under-Secretary for Special Political Affairs (and himself a Nobel Peace Prize winner), at United Nations Headquarters in New York. Dr. King's legacy continues in many ways, including in the #GlobalGoals, where reduced inequalities and peace and justice are key to our vision for a better world.

Refresh your knowledge on the New Urban Agenda: http://bit.ly/2hQwvPV #GlobalGoals

文章內容: Coffee, cocoa, nuts and many fruits and vegetables are all crops that depend on pollinators - that means bees, butterflies, hummingbirds and even bats! Without them, agricultural production would suffer dramatically putting at risk our food security. Many pollinators are facing global extinction and countries at the UN Biodiversity Conference are discussing how to protect them. Find out more on these valuable creatures:  http://www.un.org/sustainabledevelopment/blog/2016/12/pollinators/

The wealthy mostly western countries can adopt liberal trade on their food supply chain resources because they have strict regulations to control foreign owned food supply chain businesses, not the poverty stricken countries where the Chinese swallows and control the food supply chain businesses, wiping out the local entreprenuers, not giving them the opportunity to develop and sustain their local food supply chain resources. The Chinese can do other businesses like other foreigners in poor countries, not monopoly and control of the country's food supply chain businesses.", 'The increase in human population ; increase in pollution along with other human related activities is mounting undue pressure on the Ecosystem, the collateral impact, affect this pollinators, along with other endengered species, some. 文章內容: Yolanda Ter?n of the Indigenous Women's Biodiversity Network talks about why indigenous people play an important role in protecting biodiversity, and why their voices must be heard by the international community when taking decisions regarding this issue. Ms. Ter?n is taking part in the UN Convention on Biological Diversity (COP13) in Cancun, Mexico.

By the end of 2016, 3.5 billion people will be using the Internet, up from 3.2 billion last year and equal to 47% of the global population. But that means 3.9 billion people – 53% of the world’s population – still are offline. How can we bridge this gap? Representatives from governments, NGOs & the private sector will discuss this at the IGF - Internet Governance Forum in Mexico from today through Friday. 

Watch opening ceremony live at 4 p.m. CST & all sessions here: youtube.com/igf

文章內容:
A report by our friends at the United Nations Decade on Biodiversity found that marine debris is harming more than 800 species like seabirds, fish, reptiles and marine mammals. It's also costing countries a lot of money due to expensive cleanups, repairing damaged vessels and missed tourism revenues. 

What can we do? Reduce your use of plastic as much as you can! Here's a list of the top 10 marine debris items.

Read more about the report: http://wp.me/p5Mdaw-64y

文章內容:
Over the weekend, more than 190 countries adopted the Cancun Declaration to accelerate action to protect the world's biodiversity. 

This is the first time that ministers from many sectors such as forests, agriculture, fisheries and tourism come together at the UN Biodiversity Conference (cop-13) 2016  to find ways to work together to conserve biodiversity. Over 100 business also pledged to take biodiversity into account in their decision-making, and many countries made additional commitments in the areas of coral reef and pollinators protection, funding for climate change initiatives and fighting invasive species, among other topics.

Read more on the Cancun Declaration: http://www.un.org/sustainabledevelopment/blog/2016/12/cancun-declaration/

文章內容:
The Internet gender gap worldwide widened from 11% in 2015 to 12% in 2016—that’s 257 million more men online than women! Government leaders and tech experts will discuss bridging this digital divide, plus other Internet issues such as how to increase connectivity in developing countries and improve cybersecurity, at the IGF - Internet Governance Forum, happening this week in Jalisco, Mexico. 

Details: http://bit.ly/IGF2016
Follow live 5-9 December: youtube.com/igf
#IGF2016 #GlobalGoals

文章內容:
The UN Biodiversity Conference starts today in Cancun, Mexico. During the Conference known as #COP13, more than 190 countries will discuss how to integrate biodiversity into their national policies for agriculture, fishing, and tourism - sectors that benefit greatly from biodiversity but that are also largely responsible for biodiversity loss.

For example: 
- Global benefits from coral reefs including tourism, fisheries and coastal protection are estimated at some $30 billion per year
- Insect pollination of over 40 commercial crops in the United States alone at $30 billion per year
- The international trade of medicinal plants is estimated to be worth around $60 billion per year.

But biodiversity loss can threaten progress made towards addressing climate change and achieving the Sustainable Development Goals. So how can we protect life in our planet and ensure it will continue for future generations? Follow along live at: https://www.cbd.int/cop2016/webcast/

Video credit: COP13MX

文章內容:
"The cost of sidelining people with disabilities is a potential loss of up to 7% of national GDP," writes Anthony Ford-Shubrook, one of the #UNYoungLeaders for the #GlobalGoals. As a person with disabilities in London, Anthony writes that the city infrastructure excludes people with disabilities from many aspects of life.

Read his ideas for making cities more inclusive: http://wp.me/p5Mdaw-61B

What will happen at the UN Biodiversity Conference #COP13 in Cancun, Mexico, over the next two weeks? The Executive Director of the United Nations Decade on Biodiversity explains. Topics will range from oceans and tourism to invasive species and how indigenous cultures can benefit from the use of biodiversity.

An estimated 1.9 million adults worldwide have become infected with HIV every year for at least the past five years, and the number of new HIV infections is rising in some regions, says UNAIDS. To end AIDS as a public health threat by 2030, the world must take urgent and immediate action to close the HIV prevention gap. 

Find out more: www.unaids.org #EndAIDS #WorldAIDSDay #GlobalGoals

Virtually everywhere, some individuals and groups confront barriers that prevent them from fully participating in social, economic, political and cultural life. Against a backdrop of high inequalities and social exclusion, the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development has pledged that no one will be left behind.

Read the new World Social Situation Report 2016 on “Leaving No One Behind: The Imperative of Inclusive Development” from United Nations Department of Economic and Social Affairs (DESA): http://bit.ly/RWSS2016

#RWSS #InclusionMatters

留言: ["The following is a message I posted on Chris Hedges' ON CONTACT program on RT television's webpage. He was interviewing on this week's episode,Kandi Mossett of the Indigenous Environmental Network about Standing Rock:***We could take a more strategic approach to this colonial problem by establishing a network of legal clinics across Turtle Island that are actual, authentic community legal services that acculturate the Universal Declaration of Human Rights from 1948. The typical community legal services offices completely ignore the core principles in the Declaration - in that they follow a triage model that only allows for the lowest income population to be allowed to get services. This is a complete disregard of Article 29 of the Universal Declaration that holds there to be a duty to the community to ensure that everyone's rights are protected. The legal clinic that excludes 90% of potential clients based on income level, inadvertently is creating factors of serious social alienation and destruction of empathy between social populations. We should have seen this coming 68 years ago.***", 'Check this one out!\nhttp://www.nature.com/articles/srep36619', 'Happy AIDS day everybody. Hope you all come down with aids today on this, another UN celebration day ?? ? ? ?']

"Every dollar invested in water and sanitation leads to $4 in economic returns," says UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon this #WorldToiletDay. 

"Yet at least 2.4 billion people across the world lack access to toilets and are struggling to stay well, keep their children alive and work towards a better future. Investing in appropriate toilets is especially important for women and girls so that they have private, clean and safe facilities, and are able to manage menstruation or pregnancy safely."

What can you do to break the taboo? www.worldtoiletday.info

文章內容:
Before the UN Climate Change Conference (COP22) wraps up on Saturday, parties hope to define the rules of implementation of the #ParisAgreement and establish a viable plan to provide financial support to developing countries to support climate action.

UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon said the UN will help countries implement the Agreement and on Tuesday he called on developed countries “to honour their commitment to mobilize climate finance – $100 billion by 2020 – to help developing countries to mitigate and adapt to climate vulnerability.”

More of our coverage of #COP22: bit.ly/UNcop22
留言:
['Working for a World based on Ethics and Equity 

Our Association, Permanent Observer Member of the UNFCCC, is aware of the fact that 
climate change is in a point of no return. This is no breaking news, besides, there is plenty 
of scientific evidence to support this. Extreme events are proof of this too, and with the 
passing of time such events seem to occur more often, destroying entire populations 
including vital means of living jeopardising humanity as a whole. 

Nevertheless, the old perverse model of production, financing and commercialization as 
well as the consumption patterns seem to prevail. To mention but a few examples of such 
dependency take a look at the continuous use and abuse of fossil fuels, one of the main 
sources of pollution of our planet. Just look well around yourselves and see how negative 
the impact is. 

Although most countries have signed to the COP21 binding agreement finally ratified this 
year, the economic model mentioned above remains unchanged. Deforestation is 
intensified, the change in the use of land, mega mining projects, fracking, single crop 
farming in all its variations, all lead to the pollution of river basins and hence all living 
things. That is to say, the lost of natural ecosystems to sustain life on earth, our source of 
living, is put at stake due to the greed of a few. In many cases, the rights of indigenous 
peoples are also violated. 

Reality shows that it is impossible to reduce or maintain the 1.5? C agreed if we do not 
change the paradigm right now! will it be possible? Of course it will. The new paradigm 
should be based on ethics and equity, values already tarnished by greedy interests of big 
multinationals whose sole goal is to make profits. They are the main contributors to global 
warming. 

Now in the COP22, we see a major opportunity to work on a paradigm shift that may 
benefit the Common Good. Therefore, political leaders shall not give in to pressure from 
economic groups responsible for climate change and the negative effects that put humanity 
at stake. 

Today’s “leaders”, should take the challenge, few things are required: self-control, common 
sense, listening to the scientific community and above all listening to the common man who 
suffers the damaging consequences of the lack of responsibility. Leaders should think of 
the common good in order to guarantee sustainability to protect the present and future 
generations. We hope that greed is left aside and that the very much needed “Political Will” 
flourishes to sustain a life with dignity and in perfect harmony with Nature. 
Only in this way so much uncertainty may come to an end. 
All of us, from here and there, are claiming for an end to apathy.

                                                                           Buenos Aires, November 13 2016

Juan Ortiz Burgos 
President

文章內容:
A world without bananas? Not if the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) and Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) have anything to do with it. These two UN agencies work together to provide more food for poor populations by developing plants that are able to grow and flourish in unfavourable environmental conditions.

http://iaea.org #GlobalGoals
留言: ['Personal experience in growing produce in one hundred and ten degree desert airid climates.  The only probelm is sufficient humidity and water.  Diricting the water flow towards stabilization of each plants natural water consumption.  Soil nutrition is easily done as well; however, more variations of water and light are required with unbalanced soil qualities (grown melons and berries in arid sand).  Light variations are the qualities of variating shady spots in the feilds or variating the variety of plants towards shade.  Life adapts quick if given a chance and nurtured properly and every seed is planted to sustain an even better eco system.   What happens to one area affects everyone through the weather.', 'I wish them luck.', 'Bananas go in the tropics.', '?']

文章內容:
Day Three at the #COP22 in Marrakech was all about water and its role in successful climate change mitigation, as many efforts to reduce greenhouse gas emissions depend on reliable access to water resources.

Also a hot topic: The US presidential election and what its impact will be on long-term climate action. United Nations Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon stressed that the UN “will count on the new Administration to strengthen the bonds of international cooperation," while climate experts said it was too early to know much. 

Follow our daily blog live from the climate conference: http://bit.ly/2fttFyZ #GlobalGoals

Managing water resources is critical if our society wants to successfully mitigate the effects of #climatechange. Check out this #Film4Climate entry.

More from #COP22: www.un.org/sustainabledevelopment/cop22/

Just launched! A new online alert system designed to help government agencies and small and medium-sized enterprises keep track of the latest information on regulatory requirements for international trade was launched today by the United Nations Department of Economic and Social Affairs, the World Trade Organization - WTO and the International Trade Centre.  

Check it out here: http://bit.ly/ePing #GlobalGoals

文章內容:
“The eyes of the world are on us,” said COP 22 President Salaheddine Mezouar on Monday at the start of the United Nations Climate Change Conference in Marrakech, Morocco, just days after the landmark #ParisAgreement entered into force.

“This conference comes within a climate of hope and of legitimate aspirations for all of humanity," Mr. Mezouar said. 

Want to know more? Read our blog post covering Day One at #COP22, which runs through 18 November: http://bit.ly/2fttFyZ

文章內容:
Food should not be a threat to sustainability, but a source of more sustainable development, according to celebrity chefs the Roca brothers Joan, Josep and Jordi. As UNDP Goodwill Ambassadors for the SDG Fund, they're offering cooking challenges that invite social media users to submit sustainable recipes.

Learn more about the #Recipe4Change challenge: www.sdgfund.org/sustainablecooking

The Paris Agreement is also an integral part of the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), also agreed in 2015. What started as two agendas have merged into one bold vision of a better world for every man, woman and child.

Under the Paris Agreement, all nations have agreed to combat climate change and to unleash actions and investment towards a low carbon, resilient and sustainable future that will keep a global average temperature rise well below 2 degrees Celsius with the accepted international aim of working to limit it to 1.5 degrees Celsius.

The Paris Agreement and the SDGs will be successful only if everyone fully supports them and helps bring their ambitious goals to life with real action – from national, regional and local leaders; from investors and businesses to citizens who desire to live in a safe and prosperous world, and who want to actively shape that world.

Hearty congratulations to humanity for arriving at this historic agreement.

The #ParisAgreement on climate change enters into force this Fri., 4 Nov. The Agreement calls on countries to combat climate change and to accelerate and intensify the actions and investments needed for a sustainable low carbon future, and to adapt to the increasing impacts of climate change.

Its early entry into force triggers the operational provisions of the agreement and accelerates efforts to limit global temperature rise to well below 2 degrees Celsius.

More information: http://www.un.org/sustainabledevelopment #GlobalGoals

Good day,

I would like to suggest the United Nations to include two new Sustainable Development Goals, one for culture and one for religion, as follows:

1. Culture: Lack of cultural development in developing communities around the world is causing social rupture, producing public insecurity and institutions failure. In order to accomplish overall economic and social development, a dose of local culture is required and can be measured as the percentage of population participating in cultural activities.

2. Religion: Decomposition of religious values in developing communities is undermining people?s individual capacity to react to lack of peace, security, economic, and social growth. Inclusion of world?s religious approaches, individual spiritual renovation, and community spiritual accompaniment are elements that can be measured as the percentage of population participating in religious activities.

Best regards,

Elizabeth Anne Villegas Hernandez

文章內容:
Cities are remarkable engines of growth, centres of diversity and hubs of creativity. Let us use their potential to transform our world for the better. —Ban Ki-moon at #Habitat3 Opening Ceremony

Follow the UN conference on sustainable cities through 20 Oct.: bitly.com/habitatthree #GlobalGoals

The #Habitat3 UN conference on sustainable urban development officially kicks off this morning in Quito, Ecuador! More than 50% of the world's population lives in cities, a percentage that will grow to almost two-thirds by 2050, making it important to plan for sustainable urban growth now.

Watch live at 10 a.m. ECT & get all the info at bitly.com/habitatthree.

17 October is the International Day for the Eradication of Poverty

The good news: extreme poverty rates have been cut by more than half since 1990.  However, there are still more than 700 million people living in extreme poverty.  And poverty is not only about a lack of money. It also means not having enough food to eat and limited access to education for so many children. 

The #GlobalGoals unanimously adopted by world leaders in 2015 seek to ensure poverty is eradicated by 2030.

Details at http://www.un.org/sustainabledevelopment/poverty/

文章內容:
The Habitat III Conference which will take place in Quito, Ecuador, from 17-20 October, is the UN's first global summit on urbanization since the adoption of the #GlobalGoals. Habitat III offers a unique opportunity to discuss the important challenges of how cities, towns, and village can be planned and managed and help cities drive sustainable development and shape the implementation of the Sustainable Development Goals and the Paris Agreement on climate change.

In Quito, world leaders will adopt the New Urban Agenda which will set global standards of achievement in sustainable urban development, rethinking the way we build, manage, and live in cities, drawing together cooperation with committed partners, relevant stakeholders, and urban actors at all levels of government as well as the civil society and private sector.

Find out more & watch the #Habitat3 action live starting 17 October here: http://bit.ly/habitatthree

Did you know that 1.3 million people have died in disasters in the last 20 years? In storms and floods, heat waves and droughts, earthquakes and tsunamis. Many could have been saved with better preparedness, early warning systems and stronger buildings.

Find out more on International Day for Disaster Reduction from UNISDR: http://www.unisdr.org/2016/iddr/ #GlobalGoals #LiveToTell

Millions of people around the world live with depression. Many of these individuals and their families are afraid to talk about their struggles, and don't know where to turn for help. A new campaign from the World Health Organization (WHO) seeks to erase the stigma that sometimes comes with admitting you struggle with depression. http://ow.ly/hghO3055sQH

文章內容:
For the International Day of the Girl today, UN Women Goodwill Ambassador Emma Watson is visiting Malawi to shine a spotlight on the need to end child marriage. Half of girls in the country are married before the age of 18 – a fact Malawi President Peter Mutharike is working to change as part of his #HeForShe commitment. 

Last year, he enacted a law raising the minimum legal age of marriage to 18. It’s so encouraging to see how such a harmful practice can be stopped when communities work together to 
pass laws, and then turn those laws into reality, 
Ms. Watson said. 

http://ow.ly/vDbh3052r2A #dayofthegirl #GlobalGoals

Did you know it's #WorldSpaceWeek? In 2006, Marcos Pontes was the first Brazilian astronaut to go to outer space. Orbiting over Brazll, Marcos was especially touched by the fragility of the Amazon. Now Goodwill Ambassador of United Nations Industrial Development Organization, he is committed to promote sustainable development and made a bold proposal to create the world’s first eco-state in Roraima, Brazil.

World Space Week info: http://www.worldspaceweek.org/ #GlobalGoals

文章內容:
Great news! The historic #ParisAgreement on climate change will enter into force on 4 November, as the requirements for entry into force were satisfied today when Austria, Bolivia, Canada, France, Germany, Hungary, Malta, Nepal, Portugal and Slovakia, as well as the European Union, deposited their instruments of ratification with Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon.

“This is a momentous occasion,” Mr. Ban said. “What once seemed unthinkable, is now unstoppable. Strong international support for the Paris Agreement entering into force is a testament to the urgency for action, and reflects the consensus of governments that robust global cooperation, grounded in national action, is essential to meet the climate challenge.”

http://wp.me/p5Mdaw-5sc #GlobalGoals

Happy #WorldMaritimeDay! According to the United Nations Conference on Trade and Development, around 80 per cent of global trade by volume and more than 70 per cent of global trade by value are carried by sea and are handled by ports worldwide. These shares are even higher in the case of most developing countries. Without shipping, the import and export of goods on the scale necessary to sustain the modern world would not be possible.

Learn more from International Maritime Organization - IMO:
http://www.imo.org/en/About/Events/WorldMaritimeDay/Pages/WMD-2016.aspx #GlobalGoals

文章內容:
The #ParisAgreement on climate change is on track to enter into force in 2016. United Nations Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon said Wednesday that 60 countries have formally joined it, officially crossing one of the two thresholds required to bring into force the landmark pact that seeks to put the world on a path towards low-carbon growth and a more sustainable future.

“I am confident that, by the time I leave office, the Paris Agreement will have entered into force,” he said.

Get the latest UN climate news, videos from the day and list of countries that have joined: www.un.org/sustainabledevelopment/climatechange 

#GlobalGoals #UNGA

文章內容:
"Action on climate change is essential for creating a livable future" - United Nations Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon.

The Paris Climate Agreement moved closer into force as 31 more countries joined the Paris Agreement on climate change Wednesday at UN Headquarters in New York, and several large emitting countries also announced they were committed to joining the agreement this year. 

For more details visit: http://bit.ly/2cZorMw
留言:
['New world order', 'Comment le Maroc a d?jou? un plan alg?ro-mauritanien pour d?localiser les camps de Tindouf vers Lagouira:

L'intervention marocaine au-del? du mur de s?curit? a permis de barrer la route devant l'axe Alger-Nouakchott, projetant d'implanter en secret une partie de la population de Tindouf dans la r?gion de Lagouira, frontali?re de la ville mauritanienne de Nouadhibou. R?v?lations.
Des r?v?lations ?poustouflantes commencent ? percer au travers de la crise suscit?e autour de l'intervention marocaine au-del? du mur de d?fense, dans la r?gion de Guerguerat frontali?re de la Mauritanie. "La projection des forces de s?curit? marocaines, en ce m?morable 14 ao?t, au-del? du mur de d?fense, a mis en ?chec un plan con?u secr?tement par Alger et Nouakchott pour d?localiser une partie de la population de Tindouf dans la ville marocaine de Lagouira", d?voilent les sources de Le360.

Cette intervention a permis au Maroc de gagner plusieurs points sur le plan g?ostrat?gique, font valoir nos sources. Le projet d'Alger de d?localiser une partie de la population de Tindouf vers Lagouira et, du coup, r?aliser un r?ve qu'elle a toujours caress?, soit un acc?s ? l'Oc?an Atlantique, est maintenant tomb? ? l'eau.

Et ce n'est surtout pas cet appel onusien pour le retour au statu quo ante qui va nous contredire. Pas plus d'ailleurs que celui du Conseil de s?curit? qui a ?t? on ne peut plus clair pour demander le retrait de toute pr?sence militaire de la zone d?militaris?e de Guerguerat. Il faut savoir que ces appels servent plut?t le Maroc qui, ? travers la projection de ses gendarmes (une dizaine) au-del? du mur de s?curit?, a mis en br?che la th?orie s?paratiste fumeuse des "zones lib?r?es"! Cette projection dans Guerguerat, consid?r?e mensong?rement comme ?tant "premi?re zone militaire" du front Polisario, a d?montr? que le Maroc est bel et bien souverain et qu'il n'a jamais renonc? ? cette partie ch?re de son Sahara, ?vacu?e par les FAR au tout d?but des ann?es 90 juste pour ?viter toute friction avec les ?l?ments arm?s du Polisario et dans un geste de bonne foi et de respect de l'accord de cessez-le-feu.

L'intervention marocaine dans cette r?gion d?montre ainsi que le royaume n'a jamais renonc? ? cette r?gion d?militaris?e. Pas plus d'ailleurs qu'? la ville de Lagouira!

Autre perc?e, et pas des moindres: les travaux d'asphaltage, pr?c?demment report?s ? trois reprises, ont pu ?tre r?alis?s aujourd'hui ? 90%, sachant qu'il ne reste qu'un seul kilom?tre ? goudronner sur six de la fronti?re nord de la Mauritanie.

Autre acquis, le Maroc a pu atteindre ses objectifs trac?s pour cette op?ration sans avoir eu ? tirer une seule balle. Il a pu, non seulement mettre en ?chec le projet alg?ro-mauritanien pour d?localiser une partie des camps vers Lagouira, mais il a aussi pu assainir la r?gion de Guerguerat de toutes sortes de trafics (armes, drogues, voitures vol?es, cigarettes de contrebande), et neutraliser la menace que font peser les groupes terroristes sur une r?gion rest?e jusqu'ici ? l'abri des attaques jihadistes, gr?ce ? la vigilance des services marocains.', 'Reaching an agreement is not where the the problem lies but on implementation. The developing countries in Africa especially will always  lack the political will and resources to implement agreements consistently. Mr Ban Kimon are there particular  provisions in  place towards helping the developing countries whose mono economy is dependent on fossil fuel exploitation and use?Drastic reduction of carbon emission through could adversely affect their already battered economy.', 'Dear Secretary General Ban. The United Nations Summit on Refugees and Migrants "shows that we can find common ground," Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon said Monday as he launched the new UN "Together" initiative. 

The campaign will highlight the economic, cultural and social contributions that migrants and refugees make to countries of origin, transit and destination. It will also counter some of the misinformation and misperceptions about them. 

Learn more: https://refugeesmigrants.un.org/together #GlobalGoals #UN4RefugeesMigrants

Some of the things you can do with the SDGs Action app: 

1. Get news on your favourite goals
2. Get suggestions on what you can do to achieve each goal
3. Access to the World’s Largest Lesson explaining the SDGs
4. Find actions and events near you that you can join to support the goals.
5. Create your own actions you’re planning in your area, and invite others to join.

You can download it here: https://sdgsinaction.com/

文章內容:
Rural populations still make up three-quarters of the world's poorest and hungriest people. In a fast-changing world, rural areas must transform and be sustainably included in growing economies. International Fund for Agricultural Development (IFAD)'s Rural Development Report 2016 analyses systematically the patterns of change and transformation that are taking place in developing countries and in the rural sector.

Explore the new report and its findings: www.ifad.org/ruraldevelopmentreport

#RuralTransformation #GlobalGoals

文章內容:
UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon on Wednesday launched a new UNICEF Time Machine art exhibit meant to draw attention to how more data is needed to make sure no children are left behind when working on the #GlobalGoals. 

"Quality numbers alone will not change people’s lives," Mr. Ban said. "But being counted makes everyone visible, that’s the first thing, and this act of recognition makes it possible to address their needs and advance their rights. In other words, good data is essential to good decisions."

A high-level event at United Nations Headquarters on 21 September will advance efforts to secure early entry into force of the #ParisAgreement by providing an opportunity for countries to deposit their instruments of ratification, acceptance, approval or accession to the agreement with the Secretary-General, as stipulated in the agreement.

Learn more: http://wp.me/p5Mdaw-5by #GlobalGoals

文章內容:
A new Global Education Monitoring Report, "Education for People and Planet," from UNESCO shows that achieving Goal 4, universal primary education, by 2030 is at risk. 

Learn more: Bit.ly/sdg4all #GlobalGoals
留言:
["The UN has no authority over education. Education is developed locally based on individual's needs. The educational needs in America or the U.S. aren't going to be the same as in China or India or Africa, etc.", "Global Goals 4 by 2030 and even beyond is at risk only when the system of education is confined to what is officiated as common facilitation through schools. 

The risk is because we recognise people's knowledge only if its in the way we expect & stipulate as procedure but not for the purpose met. When recognition can be to what an individual presents as his/her skills, global goals 4 is easy to accomplish even before 2030. 

Education is not about creating skills for the world tailor made, Education is nurturing the skills inherent in an individual that will enable them to contribute their best in development of the globe. 

Quality of education is not the syllabus or curriculum, its in the degree of nurturing that an individual gets in grooming his/her individuality to the best form that would enable him to participate in the development of the globe, his self and social progress along with enabling him with his self-worth, confidence and dignity.  

Stipulating the world's activities to a specific procedure, process or format is against the principle of democracy and human rights. 

By democracy and the principles of UDHR, every single individual are born free, equal in dignity and entitlement to claim opportunities through which their free and full development of personality is possible enabling them to use the economic and natural resource of the globe in enabling social progress and global development that would inturn enable them with better standards of life. 

To accomplish not just Global Goals 4 but all the goals in the 2030 agenda, reforming the functioning of the world inline with the principles of UDHR is essential leaving behind the practise of the routine. 

Cognising, practising, spreading and promoting human rights AS PRINCIPLED THROUGH UNIVERSAL DECLARATION OF HUMAN RIGHTS IS IMPORTANT TO ACCOMPLISH #GlobalGoals and #VisionOfUnitedNations.", 'So sad to hear!', '#ThankyouTeacher Month.', '#indoctrination #propaganda #disinformation #mindcontrol #nazi #dictators #gotyourkids  #unitednations  #deception #markofthebeast #endtime #martusministryDOTorg']

    European Council	  

    5/9/2016 | PRESS RELEASE

    G20 leaders’ communique, Hangzhou summit, 4-5 September 2016

    At their meeting in Hangzhou, China, on 4-5 September 2016, G20 leaders adopted a communique focusing on:  

        strengthening the G20 growth agenda
        pursuing innovative growth concepts and policies
        building an open world economy
        ensuring that economic growth benefits all countries and people

    The communique also covers the migration and refugee crisis, the fight against terrorism and climate change.
    G20 Leaders’ Communique, Hangzhou summit, 4-5 September 2016
    Annex - agreed documents, Hangzhou Summit, 4-5 September 2016

文章內容:
Why does sustainable development matter to youth? A new interview from the United Nations Department of Economic and Social Affairs (DESA) asks why responsible consumption and production matter to young people, and how they play a leading role in achieving the #GlobalGoals, reducing poverty and fostering sustainable growth. 

Read more in the September issue of DESA Voice: https://www.un.org/development/desa/undesavoice/expert-voices/2016/09/#28014

文章內容:
New data from the Great Elephant Census shows that African savanna elephant populations declined by 30 per cent (144,000 elephants) between 2007 and 2014. 

However, UNEP deputy head Ibrahim Thiaw insists there's hope for elephants as people see that wildlife is worth more alive than dead, and that it can generate revenue to fund infrastructure that will improve human well-being and drive economic growth. "As depressing as these numbers are, I hope they act as a further spark for action and change."

More info: bit.ly/2c56cDa #ElephantsCount #WildforLife #GlobalGoals

As much as half of all Caribbean coral reefs have been lost since the 1970s. And the remaining 50 per cent could disappear in the next 20 years, stifled by overgrown algae. However, saving the parrotfish could save our coral reefs. 

Learn more from UNEP: http://bit.ly/2bQOmmm #GlobalGoals

文章內容:
PLURAL+ is an annual youth-produced video festival, co-organized by the United Nations Alliance of Civilizations (UNAOC) and International Organization for Migration, that focuses on migration through the celebration of diversity and social inclusion. Festival Jury member Joy Obuya hosts a Facebook live stream Tues., 30 Aug., at 9 a.m. GMT to discuss PLURAL+ and the stories of joy, hope and courage it promotes.

Join the live stream on IOM's Facebook page, and watch out for more info on the festival, to take place 27 October in New York: https://www.facebook.com/IOMmigration/
