文章內容: World Water Week kicked off in Sweden today. Learn the basics on Goal 6 of the #GlobalGoals, Water and Sanitation: http://bit.ly/1FcK4NW #WWWeek

The second annual Solutions Summit is a catalytic gathering that will take place during United Nations General Assembly week. The purpose of the Solutions Summit is two-fold:

1.) to lift up exceptional innovators -- technologists, engineers, scientists, and others -- who are developing solutions that address one or more of the SDGs
2.) to catalyze a grassroots effort, where communities scout and convene resources around solution-makers.

Do you have a solution for the #GlobalGoals? Submit it by today, 28 Aug! http://solutions-summit.org

文章內容:
Roads and railway links are typically build along accessible paths, which often tend to follow rivers, valleys or coastlines. However, these are more exposed to flooding, landslides, storm surges, cyclones and tsunamis. In Europe alone, damage to road and railroad lines caused by flooding is estimated to amount to US$470 million annually. 

Find out how critical infrastructure helps reduce the negative effects of natural hazards both in terms of loss of life and economic damage in the new United Nations University World Risk Report 2016 on Logistics and Infrastructure: www.ehs.unu.edu 

#GlobalGoals #WRR2016

文章內容: The #Zika virus is spreading rapidly in Latin America and the Caribbean, infecting more than one million people. The International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) and Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) have made available a nuclear technology that controls pests by rendering the males infertile with radiation. It is an efficient, safe, and environmentally-friendly technique to control pests and fight diseases such as Zika. Watch how it works: http://bit.ly/28TJEDP

PLEASE, REFER TO THE IRAN CONTRA CASE BELOW:
Iran-contra affair

Iran-contra affair, in U.S. history, secret arrangement in the 1980s to provide funds to the Nicaraguan contra rebels from profits gained by selling arms to Iran. The Iran-contra affair was the product of two separate initiatives during the administration of President Ronald Reagan. The first was a commitment to aid the contras who were conducting a guerrilla war against the Sandinista government of Nicaragua. The second was to placate "moderates" within the Iranian government in order to secure the release of American hostages held by pro-Iranian groups in Lebanon and to influence Iranian foreign policy in a pro-Western direction.

Despite the strong opposition of the Reagan administration, the Democratic-controlled Congress enacted legislation, known as the Boland amendments, that prohibited the Defense Dept., the Central Intelligence Agency (CIA), or any other government agency from providing military aid to the contras from Dec., 1983, to Sept., 1985. The Reagan administration circumvented these limitations by using the National Security Council (NSC), which was not explicitly covered by the law, to supervise covert military aid to the contras. Under Robert McFarlane (1983–85) and John Poindexter (1985–86) the NSC raised private and foreign funds for the contras. This operation was directed by NSC staffer Marine Lt. Col. Oliver North. McFarlane and North were also the central figures in the plan to secretly ship arms to Iran despite a U.S. trade and arms embargo.

In early Nov., 1986, the scandal broke when reports in Lebanese newspapers forced the Reagan administration to disclose the arms deals. Poindexter resigned before the end of the month; North was fired. Select congressional committees held joint hearings, and in Dec., 1986, Lawrence E. Walsh was named as special prosecutor to investigate the affair. Higher administration officials, particularly Reagan, Vice President Bush, and William J. Casey (former director of the CIA, who died in May, 1987), were implicated in some testimony, but the extent of their involvement remained unclear. North said he believed Reagan was largely aware of the secret arrangement, and the independent prosecutor's report (1994) said that Reagan and Bush had some knowledge of the affair or its coverup. Reagan and Bush both claimed to have been uninformed about the details of the affair, and no evidence was found to link them to any crime. A presidential commission was critical of the NSC, while congressional hearings uncovered a web of official deception, mismanagement, and illegality.

A number of criminal convictions resulted, including those of McFarlane, North, and Poindexter, but North's and Poindexter's were vacated on appeal because of immunity agreements with the Senate concerning their testimony. Former State Dept. and CIA officials pleaded guilty in 1991 to withholding information about the contra aid from Congress, and Caspar Weinberger, defense secretary under Reagan, was charged (1992) with the same offense. In 1992 then-president Bush pardoned Weinberger and other officials who had been indicted or convicted for withholding information on or obstructing investigation of the affair. The Iran-contra affair raised serious questions about the nature and scope of congressional oversight of foreign affairs and the limits of the executive branch.

See B. Woodward, Veil (1987); T. Draper, A Very Thin Line (1991).

The Columbia Electronic Encyclopedia, 6th ed. Copyright ? 2012, Columbia University Press. All rights reserved.

Our process is Hydro Electric;
Hydro electric power has been and is a proven source of efficient long lasting power.
Our process is NEW and will require NO DAMS, thus reducing the cost of Hydro electric power to consumers further.
Our process will not be tied to climate or weather patterns or lake and river levels, and will provide steady and reliable power for a hundred years.
Our process will allow for the use of treated waste water and or treated industrial waste water, further saving our natural resources.
Our process will allow the power to be placed anywhere, which is important, because it will be closer to where the power is needed, thus reducing the strain on grids and making power transmission more efficient too.
What is more reliable than Sun and Wind, I ask because there are Days it's not always clear, sometimes for prolonged periods, and the wind doesn't always blow, so what is more reliable ?
Gravity, it's constant, day and night, season after season 
whether the Sun shines or not, and whether the wind blows or not !! 
Our company's patent is completed on a new process. 
Our process will use space a lot more efficiently than other supposed "green solutions", and take up a tiny fraction of the space, and use a fraction of the cost to construct.
True Green Energy, there is no effect on the environment or habitat, and no emissions or discharges and no hazardous materials or waste products.
Our process will go beyond COP21 and CPP and EPA standards, and will be Clean Safe and Secure ! Our Process will offer the lowest cost power to both industrial and home consumers, and the power will be low cost and promote electric transport like trains busses and trucks and cars, heated roads, and better lighting for safety.
We are going to make this available to the WORLD !!!! P & P Green Energy, A Virginia Company! This year, ECOSOC will convene the fifth biennial high-level meeting of the DCF at United Nations Headquarters in New York on 21-22 July, as part of its annual High-level Segment.

Get all the details on the event here: http://bit.ly/ECOSOC_HLS
Watch live: http://webtv.un.org

Join our celebration of the International Day of Cooperatives 2016 on 11 July at UN Headquarters in New York to increase awareness about how cooperatives help eradicate poverty and contribute to achieving the #GlobalGoals for all. 

Get details on the #CoopsDay event: http://bit.ly/UN-IDC2016 Watch live on 11 July (1.15-2.30 p.m. EDT): http://webtv.un.org

文章內容:
Samoa has its first female deputy prime minister in Fiame Naomi Mata'afa and more women in Parliament than ever after elections last winter. 

The #GlobalGoals are in full swing six months into the ambitious 2030 Agenda. Learn more about what countries are doing to achieve them: bit.ly/17days17goals #17days17goals
Pangolins are now the most illegally traded mammal. Is your Kindred Species at risk? Take the quiz at http://wildfor.life #wildforlife #GlobalGoals

Norway to give NOK 400M (US $48M) to schools in & around Syria for the period 2016–2018. It is planned that NOK 200 million of this funding, channelled through UNICEF, will be provided this year.

Learn about more #GlobalGoals actions ahead of #HLPF2016: bit.ly/17days17goals #17days17goals

文章內容:
The #GlobalGoals have been in effect for six months now -- how are countries acting on them? Ask Assistant Secretary-General Thomas Gass of United Nations Department of Economic and Social Affairs (DESA) in a Twitter chat on 8 July ahead of the High-level Political Forum on Sustainable Development that starts next week.  

More info: http://bit.ly/29nTLkf
#SDGsChat #HLPF2016

The Republic of Korea's "Safe Life for All" initiative will give $100B toward improving global health, including eradicating diseases. 

What other measures are countries taking toward achieving the #GlobalGoals? Find out here: bit.ly/17days17goals #17days17goals

文章內容:
Introducing our #17days17goals campaign! Real progress is being made toward achieving the Sustainable Development Goals, for instance, more Georgians now earn a sustainable living via farming. 

Every day from now through the end of the UN High-Level Political Forum on Sustainable Development, we'll showcase one of the 17 #GlobalGoals and what different countries are doing to achieve them. 

Learn more: bit.ly/17days17goals #HLPF2016

文章內容:
You could catch Zika virus if you are bitten by a mosquito in areas where the virus circulates. Follow travel advice from your national health authorities and protect yourself from mosquito bites.

Fact sheets from World Health Organization (WHO): http://www.who.int/mediacentre/factsheets/zika/en/
Nominations now open! The UN is calling all #YoungLeaders to help achieve the #GlobalGoals. If you know someone leading exceptional change, nominate them now. Learn more: www.SDGYoungLeaders.org

Hey, it's #SocialMediaDay (who knew?)! Many thanks to you, our friends around the world, for supporting the United Nations' Sustainable Development Goals and our work to leave no one behind. 

Visit our website for the latest on #GlobalGoals implementation news: http://bit.ly/1UF9aAX

文章內容:
Every child has the right to a fair chance in life. But around the world, millions of children are trapped in an intergenerational cycle of disadvantage that endangers their futures – and the future of their societies.

A new UNICEF report shows the time is now to invest in the world's most disadvantaged kids: http://www.unicef.org/sowc2016/ #GlobalGoals

India's Zubaida Bai recognized as one of the United Nations Global Compact's first-ever local #SDGPioneers. She'll use the global stage to inspire #GlobalGoals action on health.

More: bit.ly/1Xuz7DL

文章內容:
So many women around the world are locked out from getting equally paid jobs, starting a business, opening a bank account and more.

Women's economic empowerment is: 
• closing the gender pay gap
• supporting their human rights to work
• achieving financial independence.
And it benefits women and their families, communities, and national economies.

Take the short @UnitedNations survey to have your say about how women can be supported to be economically empowered: bit.ly/empower247  

#empowerwomen24_7 #GlobalGoals
Hear from 97-year-old yogi Tao Porchon-Lynch about what joy yoga brings to her life in this recap of the United Nations' International Day of Yoga festivities! #YogaDay #Yoga4SDGs #GlobalGoals

文章內容:
26 June is World Drug Day and this year UNODC - United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime is asking parents and adults to "Listen First" to youth to help them grow healthy and safe -- and therefore be less likely to turn to dangerous behaviours. 

Learn more: https://www.unodc.org/listenfirst/

文章內容:
Thanks to new hospital facilities:
Mothers receive better care.
More children’s lives are saved.
Families have a safe space to heal. 

Learn about what #Hands4Health is doing for women in South Sudan: http://bit.ly/1U40Qp1

Today's Day of the Seafarer honours those working #Atseaforall & toward #GlobalGoals.

Take this quiz from the International Maritime Organization - IMO: http://dayoftheseafarer2016.imo.org
留言: ['Thanks again for the quizzes looking forward for more.']

文章內容:
During a sport event organized by the United Nations in Egypt, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Ministry of Youth and Sports, and Egyptian athletes issued a declaration vowing to advocate for the #GlobalGoals and “promote friendly relations and solidarity between world population groups … within the framework of intercultural dialogue and the alliance of civilizations.”

Read more from UNIC-Cairo: http://bit.ly/28T1Uw5
留言: ['MRvelous .']

文章內容:
United Nations Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon announced Friday the launch of a first-of-its-kind initiative developed among the six largest communications businesses globally in support of the #GlobalGoals. The initiative, called Common Ground, was developed among Dentsu, Havas, IPG, Omnicom, Publicis Groupe and WPP. 

“Today, the communications industry is taking a historic, first-of-its-kind step to beat poverty, injustice and inequality,” said the Secretary-General, speaking at the Lions Festival of Creativity, Cannes.

Learn how Common Ground will support the 17 goals: http://bit.ly/28XJAov

文章內容:
The new 2016 World Drug Report from UNODC - United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime provides a global overview of the supply, demand and health impact of opiates, cocaine, cannabis, amphetamine-type stimulants and new psychoactive substances. 

Also, it reviews scientific evidence on the use of multiple drugs, and the recent developments since the legalization of cannabis for recreational use in some parts of the world. AND there is a thematic chapter on the links between the world drug problem and all aspects of sustainable development through the lens of the #GlobalGoals.

Read all about the 2016 World Drug Report here: http://bit.ly/WDRe2016

The United Nations Global Compact this week announced 10 inspiring Local #SDGPioneers to link business with the #GlobalGoals. One of them is Sonia Consiglio Favaretto, who has spent more than a decade working to enable sustainable and transparent capital markets in Brazil.

Learn more: bit.ly/1tAQhn9
There are some 259 million widows around the world & nearly half live in poverty. They deserve better; here's what we can do: http://bit.ly/28MTQfb #WidowsDay #GlobalGoals
留言: ['Think  Twice  - -\nAnother Day You & Me In  PARADISE . . .']

文章內容:
Today we celebrate the United Nations Public Service Day! A High-Level Panel will discuss the importance of innovative public service delivery in ensuring that no one is left behind in the global development process. #GlobalGoals

Learn more about the day and the celebrations: https://publicadministration.un.org/en/unps2016

Just announced! The world’s two primary city-led climate change and energy initiatives, the EU Covenant of Mayors and the Compact of Mayors, announced the formation of a new, first-of-its-kind global initiative of cities and local governments leading in the fight against climate change. 

This single initiative will create the largest global coalition of cities committed to climate leadership, building on the commitments of more than 7,100 cities from 119 countries and six continents, representing more than 600 million inhabitants.

Learn more: http://bit.ly/28MFV9n #GlobalGoals

On 22-23 June 2016, global leaders will convene at the United Nations Global Compact Leaders Summit in New York to translate the #GlobalGoals into business action and innovation. Follow the discussions on how leaders are making global goals local business here: http://bit.ly/26Cwliw
Yoga helps some United Nations peacekeepers build outer strength and inner peace. Learn more: http://bit.ly/1dLT4l7 #Yoga4SDGs #YogaDay

Ban Ki-moon met fifth-grade students from P.S. 333 and Cottage Lane Elementary in New York on Tuesday for a climate discussion inspired by letters they wrote to the Secretary-General thanking him for the #ParisAgreement and urging further climate action. 

"Congratulations to you on the Paris Agreement," one letter said. "Your parents must be very proud of you. This is definitely going to have a big impact on our generation."

Read the kids' letters here: http://bit.ly/28MPrwa
分享內容: Global Goals for Sustainable Development added 10 new photos.

文章內容: Even Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon appreciates the spiritual, physical and mental well-being of yoga! Practicing yoga brings thought and action together in harmony. Learn more on #YogaDay today: http://bit.ly/1dLT4l7 #Yoga4SDGs

Tuesday is #YogaDay! Yoga can help our spiritual & mental well-being, and #GlobalGoals (particularly Goal 3 Good Health)! 

http://bit.ly/1dLT4l7 #Yoga4SDGs

Today's World Day to Combat Desertification is a unique occasion to remind everybody that desertification can be effectively tackled, that solutions are possible, and that key tools to this aim lay in strengthened community participation and co-operation at all levels. 

Learn more: http://bit.ly/1RU3dcl #GlobalGoals #WDCD2016

文章內容:
Did you know that in 2015, almost 250 million economic migrants living outside their countries of origin sent about US$450 billion in remittances to their families back home?

16 June is the International Day of #FamilyRemittances. Learn more: http://bit.ly/1Xpcv7x
留言: ['The diaspora seems to be making a good income. It is always good to invest back home especially for those who are making a living from poorly countries in rich countries to invest back home?', 'Amazing  post  very informative I love motivation']

文章內容: Calling all yogis or potential yogis! Do you have a question about yoga and its health benefits? We want to know. Yoga experts Sadhguru Jaggi Vasudev & Tao Porchon-Lynch will answer some questions from Facebook during an event at the United Nations on Monday. Submit your questions now in the comments!

文章內容: High-income countries must recruit more young people to #GiveBlood, says @WHO on World Blood Donor Day today: http://bit.ly/1ZNkZU7 #GlobalGoals

The Conference of States Parties to the Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities (CRPD) opens its 9th session today and runs through 16 June under these important themes:

• Eliminating poverty and inequality for all persons with disabilities
• Promoting the rights of persons with mental and intellectual disabilities
• Enhancing accessibility to information and technology and inclusive development
• Celebrating the 10th anniversary of the adoption of the convention

Watch the opening ceremony at 10 a.m. EDT: http://webtv.un.org/

文章內容:
“We now know that although the oceans are seemingly endless, their capacity to withstand human activities is limited, particularly as they also cope with the threats posed by climate change. Urgent action on a global scale is needed to alleviate the world’s oceans from the many pressures they face, and to protect them from future dangers that may tip them beyond the limits of their carrying capacity.” 
— United Nations Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon

This #WorldOceansDay, it’s more important than ever for us to make the connection between healthy oceans and a healthy planet. More info: http://bit.ly/1BfNe0O #GlobalGoals

We must all commit our efforts and focus our mindset to protection of the environment and protect the species. \nWhat can we tell the generations when the prevailing manners and attitudes we are treating our environments? \nWe must be honest to ourselves in to do the right thing to enable sustainable and secured environment free from all threats.', 'Mr Ban ki moon , The World is suffering and we are doing very less for our mother Earth. Let us not live in a world where we are ignoring the consequences.']

文章內容:
Tomorrow (8 June) is #WorldOceansDay! Oceans cover more than two-thirds of the earth’s surface and contain 97 percent of the planet’s water. Oceans contribute to poverty eradication by creating sustainable livelihoods and decent work.

The United Nations recognizes the importance of oceans in Goal 14 of the #GlobalGoals, Life Below Water. Learn more about why sustainable seas need our protection: http://bit.ly/1BfNe0O
留言: ['The biodiversity living under water are integral part of global agenda to save life spent under water. Primarily,it has been a source of food for billions of people,and hence the need to save oceans. Despite the fact that life in sea water has been under threat due to climate change often agitated by human activities that remain unsustainable. In anticipation for a sustainable future for biodiversity living under water, the world must solicit for the support of all stakeholders to save sea animals from extinction. #Goal14 in its standalone position is worth it, saving all life under water is like we are making life more meaningful for humanity and saving the planet.']

文章內容:
Some of world’s most vulnerable wildlife, like rhinos and elephants, are being killed at a rate that has grown by more than 25 per cent every year in the last decade. The Rise of Environment Crime report from @UNEP and Interpol explores the extent to which illegal trade in wildlife has had an impact on our planet and offers solutions towards an end to this issue. 

More: http://bit.ly/28aoYj9  #WED2016

Yuri Fedotov, Executive Director of UNODC - United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime, and Famke Janssen, actress and humanitarian, spoke out against the illicit wildlife trade today at the United Nations. They, with other high-level representatives, launched the new World Wildlife Crime Report that provides a broad assessment of the nature and extent of the problem at a global level. 

Read the report here: http://bit.ly/24tWWe0

['Amazing; he was a shampion in many fields .', 'There is a Special Place in Hell For Hillary - Patricia Smith, Bengahzi Mom 
Benghazi victims mother says "There's a special place in Hell for Hillary!! Patricia Smith, whose son Sean was killed in the 2012 terrorist attack on the US consulate in Benghazi, Libya, responded to Democratic presidential candidate former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton’s statement about her being “absolutely wrong” by saying there’s “a special place in hell” for people like Clinton “and I hope she enjoys it there” on Thursday’s broadcast of the Fox Business Network’s “Intelligence Report with Trish Regan.”

Smith said, “She lied to me. She told me it was a fault of the video. … And she knew full well it wasn’t at that time. And then she says, she was going to check, and if it’s any different, she would call me back. She would let me know. She has never once spoken to me, or her office. The only thing I ever got out of them is that I am not a member of the immediate family, and I don’t need to know.”

She later added, “I want Hillary to talk to me personally, and tell me why there was no security there, when they were asked for it. I know this, because I spoke to my son. That day, he says he was really scared, because he saw the 17 people — 17 November, whatever it was, that they were walking around taking pictures. And he was afraid. He says it didn’t look very good. And he was afraid. And that he asked for security, and he was turned down.”

When asked about criticisms that the matter had been politicized, Smith stated,”All I want is for Hillary to tell me what happened. What’s political about that? Deadline extended to 31 May! Every year, a group of young Palestinian journalists make the journey to UNHQ in New York, where they spend several weeks learning about the #UN, especially its various activities and programmes affecting the lives of the people in their region. The journalists attend briefings by senior officials of the United Nations, interact with representatives of UN programmes and specialized agencies, and participate in various meetings with media experts, policy-makers and international organizations based in New York and Washington D.C. 

Since 1995, more than 160 Palestinian journalists have benefitted from the programme. Registration for the 2016 training programme is now open. Apply here: http://unic.un.org/palestinemediatraining/

Did you know that more than a million UN peacekeepers have been deployed in 71 operations since 1948? Today, on the International Day of UN Peacekeepers, help us honor our heroes. Show your support for the courageous peacekeepers working for peace around the world: http://ow.ly/x8WxF

You could earn a $1 million United Nations Department of Economic and Social Affairs (DESA) grant to institutions or individuals to promote leadership and innovation in energy for sustainable development. The thematic focus this year is "Energy for Sustainable Transport."

To find out more about the grant, visit: https://poweringthefuture.un.org #GlobalGoals

The #GlobalGoals about health, education and inequalities particularly resonate for several indigenous peoples representatives that came to a UN forum last week. 

Read the full story from United Nations Department of Economic and Social Affairs (DESA) about how the 2030 Agenda can help these native peoples: http://bit.ly/27RDgVM

In a nutshell, the Sustainable Development Goals are all about taking better care of each other. At the close of the World Humanitarian Summit in Istanbul, let's move forward with this idea and encourage our countries' leaders to do the same. 

Check out the summit's core commitments: http://www.worldhumanitariansummit.org/summit/roundtables

#GlobalGoals #ShareHumanity

Never since World War II have global humanitarian needs been so high. From the crisis in Syria to the drought in Ethiopia, from the conflict in Sudan to the violence in the Lake Chad Basin--125 million people around the world are affected by conflicts and disasters. This why United Nations Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon’s is convening the first-ever World Humanitarian Summit. 

The Summit continues Tuesday in Istanbul. Find out more: whsummit.org #ShareHumanity #GlobalGoals

Day One of the World Humanitarian Summit is in the books! Check out the commitments already made to leave no one behind, and check out Tuesday's agenda: http://www.worldhumanitariansummit.org/summit 

#ShareHumanity #GlobalGoals

#Biodiversity is the foundation for life and for the essential services provided by ecosystems. It therefore underpins peoples’ livelihoods and sustainable development in all areas of activity, including economic sectors such as agriculture, forestry, fisheries, and tourism, among others.

By stopping biodiversity loss, we are investing in people, their lives and their well-being. Join the United Nations Decade on Biodiversity in celebrating the variety of life on earth today and everyday. http://bit.ly/1BTSCMd 

#IDB2016 #GlobalGoals

Forests cover 30 per cent of the Earth’s surface and in addition to providing food security and shelter, forests are key to combating climate change, protecting biodiversity and the homes of the indigenous population. Join Ban Ki-moon & celebrate the variety of life on earth this #BiodiversityDay. 

Goal 15 information: http://bit.ly/1BTSCMd 

#IDB2016 #GlobalGoals

UNEP’s latest Adaptation Gap Report finds that although total international public finance for climate adaptation has increased in recent years, it would have to skyrocket in order to meet the estimated costs of adaptation and avoid an adaptation gap.

The World Economic Situation and Prospects as of mid-2016 Report from United Nations Department of Economic and Social Affairs (DESA) reveals that economic activity in the world economy remains lacklustre, with little prospect for a turnaround in 2016.

World gross product is expected to expand by just 2.4 % in 2016, the same rate as in 2015. This marks a significant downward revision of 0.5 percentage points to forecasts reported in December. Global economic growth prospects for 2017 also remain well below pre-crisis trends.

Learn more about the state of the world economy and prospects for the short- and long-term: http://bit.ly/WESP

Can't think of a better advocate for Goal 5 of the #GlobalGoals, gender equality, than feminist icon Gloria Steinem. She visited the United Nations on Tuesday to draw attention to human trafficking. More than 97% of people trafficked for sex are women, according to UNODC - United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime. 

Several of the sustainable development goals include indicators that will help put an end to this crime, including Goal 5 Gender Equality, Goal 8 Decent Jobs and Goal 16 Peace & Justice. Learn more: www.un.org/sustainable development

The #GlobalGoals are front and center today at the United Nations as the President of the General Assembly hosts a High-Level Thematic Debate on the Sustainable Development Goals. The event will bring together global political, business and civil society leaders in New York to discuss implementation of the 17 goals. It will also be a unique opportunity to address the link between the #ParisAgreement and the broader 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development. 

Watch the opening ceremony starting at 9 a.m. EDT: webtv.un.org

More details about the event: http://www.un.org/pga/70/events/sdgs/

United Nations Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon opened the 49th Commission for Population and Development on Monday with a personal story about how his own birth records are inaccurate:

"When I was born, my parents didn’t record the date of my birth. Families were understandably worried that babies would not survive. Therefore, they waited until they are sure that these babies are able to survive. That’s why my passport date of birth is actually different from my real [one]. My wife’s birth date is also different. ... I understand that in some countries that kind of practice still persists. All births and deaths must be registered. All countries should have archives of these records, and guarantee the rights of citizenship and identity to all." 

The Commission continues in New York all week. Learn more: http://bit.ly/CPD_49 

#CPD49 #UNPopulation #GlobalGoals

#SDGs #GlobalGoals

Tomorrow, 7 April, is World Health Day, and this year the United Nations is bringing attention to #diabetes. 

Newly released figures from the World Health Organization (WHO) show that the prevalence of diabetes has grown steadily – nearly quadrupling from 108 million to 422 million adults since 1980. That is 1 in 11 adults around the world. This WHO video illustrates just how important Goal 3 of the #GlobalGoals is. 

More information: http://who.int/campaigns/world-health-day/2016/en/

UNMAS works for a world free of the threat of landmines and unexploded ordnance, where individuals and communities live in a safe environment conducive to the #GlobalGoals, and where mine survivors are fully integrated into their societies.

Today, on the International Day for Mine Awareness and Assistance in Mine Action, we want to let the world know why #MineAction is Humanitarian Action. Join us in the work for a world free of explosive hazards.

Let’s get the word out about #MineAction. Share the UNMAS virtual photo exhibit showcasing programmes in Afghanistan, Cyprus and South Sudan. More info: http://bit.ly/1q2ZbZ1

2 April is World Autism Awareness Day! Autism and other forms of disability are part of the human experience that contributes to human diversity. The United Nations seeks to raise up and protect those with autism through several of the Sustainable Development Goals:  4) Quality Education; 8) Decent Work and Economic Growth; 10) Reduced Inequalities; 11) Sustainable Cities and Communities; and 17) Partnerships for the Goals.

Learn more: www.un.org/sustainabledevelopment 

#GlobalGoals

Last week, UN Member States at the United Nations Commission on the Status of Women (CSW) committed to the gender-responsive implementation of Agenda 2030. A set of agreed conclusions called for enhancing the basis for rapid progress, including stronger laws, policies and institutions, better data and scaled-up financing.

The Commission recognized women’s vital role as agents of development. It acknowledged that progress on the #GlobalGoals will not be possible without gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls.

Learn more about the agreement: http://bit.ly/1WNs19I

#GlobalGoals #Planet5050
留言: ['For any development to be genuinely sustainable and cut across the demographics evenly, women should be inclusive. If an important segment of the population are left out of the circle, the circle will be a vicious one. The more the world invest in women the more the well-being of children. The success of #SDGs depends on how much we carry women along in parity consciously in dealing with #inequality in its standalone position.']

文章內容:
In the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development, there is a stand-alone goal aimed at eliminating inequality around the globe. 

Learn more about what this goal is set to achieve:
http://bit.ly/1NlhWLo #SDGs #GlobalGoals

Whether it's income, wealth, gender, sexuality, health or education, there are many faces to inequality around the globe. For example, did you know that the average income of the richest 10% of the world's population is about 9x that of the poorest 10%?

Reduced inequalities benefit us all. This is why the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development places such importance on its reduction in its standalone Goal 10. This is also why the UN's ECOSOC President is convening a special meeting on this topic today. #SDGs #GlobalGoals

Here's what the meeting hopes to achieve: http://bit.ly/1UHnV3X
Follow live via United Nations Department of Economic and Social Affairs (DESA): http://webtv.un.org
留言: ['The level of income disparity between the most richest and poorest is quite alarming and need to be addressed. The richest 1% of world population had 50% of income accrued to them in 2015 and if the trend continues, it will certainly create discontent and disaffection in the system. We need to reduce inequality in all paradigm as in its standalone position in the SDG initiatives for a better world.']

International Fund for Agricultural Development (IFAD) shares #happyfacts and stories guaranteed to brighten up your day! 
Despite the bleak headlines in the news, the world has made progress in lifting people out of extreme poverty. Between 1990 and 2010, the number of people in extreme poverty was reduced by almost 1 billion.

Since 1978, IFAD has invested more than $17.6 billion in grants and low-interest loans to projects in developing countries, empowering about 456 million people to break out of poverty.

['These adorable twins Gideon and Esther age 4 need sponsors at $15 a month each to keep them in pre-k and cover school lunches & uniforms . They live in Mbiko ,Uganda their mom has 5 kids and sells some items in a small shop to make a living. 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dxc-DkxFkrY www.auntiesangels.com', 'Press release: 
UN Commission on the Status of Women urges
gender-responsive implementation of Agenda 2030
Meeting concludes with agreement on foundations to accelerate action for all women and girls.
Date: 24 March 2016

Excerpts:
A record number of more than 80 government ministers from around the world attended the Commission. Around 4,100 non-governmental representatives from more than 540 organizations participated as well, the highest number ever for one of the Commission’s regular annual meetings.

Members of the Commission united behind ensuring women’s equal participation in leadership at all levels of decision-making in the public and private spheres, encompassing governments, businesses and other institutions, and across all areas of sustainable development.

Depending on different circumstances, this may involve establishing temporary special measures, setting and achieving concrete benchmarks and removing barriers to women’s participation. -

The agreed conclusion also emphasized fully engaging with men and boys as agents of change and allies in the elimination of all forms of discrimination and violence against women and girls.

- See more at:
http://www.unwomen.org/en/news/stories/2016/3/press-release-csw60-urges-gender-responsive-implementation-of-agenda-2030']

文章內容:
Happy Leap Day! This 29 February, help UNEP make leaps and bounds with this year's World Wildlife Day (3 March) theme, "The Future of Wildlife Is #InOurHands." 

Did you know that vultures provide people with important services as nature's "waste-disposal units," as they are able to resist and detoxify bacterial poisons in rotting flesh that would kill other organisms. However, vultures are being killed in Africa and Asia for traditional medicine and because their scavenging can alert authorities to recent poaching kills. 

Learn more about the plight of vultures, and about what you can do to help! http://www.cms.int/en/news/opinion-tackling-africas-impending-vulture-crisis

Congratulations to United Nations Messenger of Peace Leonardo DiCaprio for winning the Best Actor Academy Award! Thanks to him for  using his acceptance speech to remind people that 2015 was the hottest year on record and that we need to support indigenous people and the disadvantaged most affected by climate change. 

"Let us not take this planet for granted; I do not take tonight for granted."

www.un.org/sustainabledevelopment

文章內容:
Migration is well integrated into the #GlobalGoals, and the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development pledges to leave no one behind. To help make this happen, the 14th Coordination Meeting on International #Migration is taking place in New York on 25-26 February. 

United Nations entities, Member States, intergovernmental organizations and civil society will all take part, providing a unique opportunity to strengthen collaboration and coordination between organizations to address the issue of international migration and development. 

Event details: http://bit.ly/14CoordMeetIntlMigration
Watch live via UN Web TV: http://webtv.un.org
留言: ['(RIGHT to BREATH) SDG 13&11 Stop polluting cities/Wasting fuel by cars,GPS electric capsule is solution https://www.facebook.com/Global-Goal-No13-A-solution-for-City-Pollution-The-Smart-City-147941658897870/', 'Migration was a historical game changer since time immemorial, and a driver of important development initiatives that has transformed human lives. Collaboration between states, institutions and concerned bodies to address impediments is worthwhile at this crucial moment of its climax. Migration is as good as humans and it entails prospects.']

Did you know that 80% of shark hotspots in some areas of the North Atlantic overlap with fished areas, making the animals more vulnerable to fisheries activities? Although overfishing is one of the greatest threats to sharks, catches of many highly migratory oceanic sharks remain largely unregulated with poor monitoring and data reporting. 

Learn more from the Convention on Migratory Species (UNEP-CMS): http://www.cms.int/sharks/ #GlobalGoals #SharksMOS2 #Time4Sharks

文章內容:
#SawfishSunday! Sawfish are amazing! Did you know that they are among the most threatened family of marine fishes? One species grows to reach seven metres in length. Their most obvious characteristic is their large, flat, toothed snout which makes up about one quarter of the total length of the animal. They use it to stir prey up from the seabed and to attack mid-water shoals of fish, stun and kill them. Incidental capture in trawls and gillnets is the primary threat to sawfish and has led to severe population declines. 

All five species are classed as Endangered or Critically Endangered. Five species of sawfish listed on CMS Appendices in 2014 may be added to the Memorandum of Understanding on the Conservation of Migratory Sharks, being discussed this week in Costa Rica. #SharksMOU #SharksMOS2 IUCN Shark Specialist Group

http://www.dulvy.com/global-sawfish-conservation-strategy.html

['Important Disclosure: Words in quotation marks are double entendre and should be read at surface level 1st read)
What greater success do/can you have in life other than understanding the (valid) definition of "Love?"
Simple logic shows that “Love” is always firstly dependent on “Hope” as "choice" because although you may choose to “Love” another (person or thing), there is no valid way of guaranteeing that “Love” will be returned/reciprocal; therefore it is a “blindtrust”/”Hope.”
Selflessly,
Ps. "Love" is the best tangible manifestation of "Hope!" Nevertheless, as long as the one and only ("infinitely perfect") ultimate rule/law of “E.O” is followed ("treat others how you want to be treated") then, the respect of life and choices will exist. Without free-will ("choice") humans would naturally or instinctively do the “right-thing” because there is no right, wrong, and no choice made for our best interests. But, most importantly, without free-will there is ultimately no choice to be made.', 'https://www.facebook.com/%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B4%D8%A8%D9%83%D8%A9-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%AF%D9%88%D9%84%D9%8A%D8%A9-%D9%84%D9%84%D8%B3%D9%84%D8%A7%D9%85-%D9%88%D8%AD%D9%82%D9%88%D9%82-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%A5%D9%86%D8%B3%D8%A7%D9%86-1861549204070262', 'SUSCO Organization in Kurdistan-Iraq please support us

文章內容:
United Nations Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon needs your support to help #EndFGM!

留言:
['I'll support you, my UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-Moon, by sharing this message at several of  "Association for World Education", AWE ' information platforms. Among those are, AWE - Educators Across Borders',  https://www.facebook.com/groups/rex.schade/?fref=ts. Have a nic day at office UN HQ!', '(SIRDI) is a research and development organization which entails sustained efforts to raise the quality of life of rural and tribal people without compromising the capacity of future generation.  We are focused to work in rural and tribal areas to enhance livelihood, food and nutrition security at grass-root level. Our goal is to enhance creativity through research, training and skill development to promote United Nations’ recently adopted Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) to end extreme poverty, fighting inequality and tackling the climate change at grass-root level.  Please visit: https://www.facebook.com/www.sirdi.org.in/notifications/', 'Global Goal 13&11 Stop polluting cities/Wasting fuel by cars,Capsule GPS electric trolley is solution https://www.facebook.com/Global-Goal-No13-A-solution-for-City-Pollution-The-Smart-City-147941658897870/', 'SUSCO Organization in Kurdistan-Iraq please support us
www.susco-kurdistan.org', 'The Sustainable Development Goals [SDGs] are JOKE because they miss the leverage on the most important variable: the electron!!! 

The electron is the variable that binds all the current SDGs goals together, based on the leverage form: ELECTRICITY!!!! The presence or absence of an excess of electrons is responsible for all electrical (development) phenomena. The transmission of the right kind of information, energy and human development potential to source is the most important effort of all in achieving any human development goal.

If nothing is ever enough, then close to enough is better! Is that not the case? 
So why not one simple goal to take us all home?
...And there you go: the one single variable in which to invest aggressively to improve human development in developing countries from all angles. 

Imagine all the possibilities if all [SDGs] funds went into electricity generation infrastructure development? 

Imagine the benefits of access to electricity to the women, to the children, to potential innovators etc. in developing countries. Imagine how electricity can influence mobility, health, education, life expectancy, access to water, communication and the environment (on DEFORESTATION) in developing countries?

There you go! YOUR ONE GOAL! ACCESS TO ELECTRICITY on a per CAPITA basis! Do numbers not matter?

...But people like complexity, so let us break this goal into 3 goals and their measures:

Goal #1, No GLOBAL poverty, should be measured in terms of [HDI] averages in countries, where the target is 1 unit, depending on the (dimensionless) scales used, with a cue from the UNDP [HDI] index), for everyone. In that case, goals 2, 3, 4 become embodied in 1 as specific numbers. As stipulated by goal 17, commitments can be measured on a global scale, based on numbers that seek to balance global human development.

Infrastructure development should be a separate goal (# 2) where the key infrastructure is clean electricity (with "developing countries" target installed capacity in Gigawatts, measured on per capita basis) as even more relevant to least developing countries. In that regard, goals 1 - 17 are also embodied in infrastructure development and could all be merged as 1 goal, with a special focus on electricity generation infrastructure in developing countries! The installed capacity TARGET should be based on the capacity for the average electricity consumption of at least 2000 KWh per capita in developing countries. In that regard, all other SDG's can be achieved.

The next goal (#3) will then be GLOBAL environmental stewardship, with emphasis on each person planting a tree in his lifetime and making sure it lived! It is a matter of getting information around as a complete picture, for people to see where they belong in the overall plan, and one needs electricity to make that possible.

Such should be the sustainable development goals. They should be bound by specific numbers. Otherwise the joke is still on developing countries for the next century #SDG.

#execution
#capitalPOOLING
#ResourcePOOLING
Strive to carry the right kind of information and energy across, in the limited time available, and so much will work in a broken system with all forms of uncertainty being created by the snag in the flow of the right kind of information!
Contact me @ #ResourcePOOLINGprogram for more…
\AND SHARE IF YOU AGREE!
#TIME']

文章內容:
"Cancer affects all countries, but those with fewer resources are hit hardest. Nothing illustrates this better than the burden of cervical cancer. The world’s poorest countries are home to more than 8 in 10 women newly diagnosed with cervical cancer, and 9 in 10 deaths from the disease," says United Nations Secretary-General on World Cancer Day. 

Comprehensive women’s healthcare must include cervical cancer screening & HPV vaccination. More info from Every Woman Every Child: http://bit.ly/1LiW9sp 

#EWECisME #WorldCancerDay #GlobalGoals
留言: ['Please support SUSCO Organization in Kurdistan Iraq', 'Free access to better healthcare for all would be the most serious platform for the eradication of cervical cancer among women. With free medicare, it would be easier to detect and treat  before it becomes a serious health issue. Both rich and poor would be able to know their level of exposure to cervical cancer at the earliest.']

文章內容:
Reducing inequality is fundamental to achieving the overall objective of the #2030Agenda of promoting sustainable development without leaving anyone behind! Inequalities are also at the root of many of the challenges that the 2030 Agenda sets out to overcome, including poverty, economic instabilities, environmental degradation, social exclusion and threats to peace. 

Learn more here: http://bit.ly/CSOCD54 #GlobalGoals #CsocD54 United Nations DESA Division for Social Policy and Development - DSPD
留言: ['SUSCO Organization in Kurdistan-Iraq please support us\nwww.susco-kurdistan.org', 'Inequality as a parochial social evil is central to contemporary problems besieging humanity. With inequality at stake, the world would be bedevilled in an absolute unfair,unjust, and repugnant to natural justice. The world must deal with inequality in all its forms to attain parity for all and sustainable development. The status quo should change for the better for all regardless of gender or status.', 'Heartly thanks now', '<3', 'Good! Goal NO. 10']

文章內容:
Stay tuned for an important announcement at the United Nations Economic and Social Council Youth Forum tomorrow! Guy Ryder, Director-General of the International Labour Organization, will announce a new global initiative – the first in its kind – to create decent jobs for youth. 

Learn more here http://bit.ly/youth2030 and follow live starting from 10 a.m. EST: http://webtv.un.org #Youth2030 #GlobalGoals
留言: ['HE 3 WEEK DIET is a revolutionary new diet system that not only guarantees to help you lose weight — it promises to help you lose more weight — all body fat — faster than anything else you’ve ever tried... <3 <3 ;-)', 'Goal 8.Decent work and Economic growth', 'SUSCO Organization in Kurdistan-Iraq please support us\nwww.susco-kurdistan.org', 'http://www.legendsint.org/', "The rethink on decent jobs for youth through goal 8 would change the status of jobs from a means of income to a more prosperous growth and development jobs. As UNDP's  HDR 2015 had proven,  not all jobs worth it, some jobs are not really promising for our youth, we need to improve our job to hold growth and development for this generation and future generations. A job with decency and inclusive growth is paramount and should mindlessly replace the existing jobs that are not far away from servitude. The new order should be decent jobs with growth prospects, not the former.", 'Sustainable Development Goals']

文章內容:
The power of people to exercise their rights and make choices will determine the health and well-being of present and future generations and of our planet. We must innovate and ensure that we use available and emerging technologies to let women and girls win the game of life! 

More info: www.unfpa.org/icfp2016 #ICFP #FamilyPlanning #GlobalGoals
留言: ['SUSCO Organization in Kurdistan-Iraq please support us\nwww.susco-kurdistan.org', 'http://www.legendsint.org/', 'www.doit4charity.co.za/gvmhf', 'It is quite a disturbing stage for a young girl in developing nations Ordinarily this is the best time for a girl to  decide what the future would holds for her, but most of the time they are denied the right to decide. This is what is really working against growth and development potentials for the teeming girls demography. They are often denied access to education and social services which are fundamentally key in an attempt to improve the well-being of girls globally. What is worth mentioning is that, no society would progress without the effort of young ones. The role of girls in defining the future course is enormous and worth it, the world must allow girls to prosper as a matter of fact. Gender parity is a right not a privilege.']

文章內容:
With over 1.2 billion young people in the world, youth are the torchbearers of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development. Their active engagement from community to the international level will ensure that by 2030, the #GlobalGoals have been implemented. 

Taking action for this new agenda will be at the heart of the United Nations Economic and Social Council Youth Forum on 1-2 February. Learn more http://bit.ly/youth2030 and follow live http://webtv.un.org #Youth2030
留言: ['The youth need to be engaged in pursuance of 2030 agenda. They should be at the center stage in transforming the dreams of making the world a beautiful place free of vices.', '(SIRDI) is a research and development organization which entails sustained efforts to raise the quality of life of rural and tribal people without compromising the capacity of future generation.  We are focused to work in rural and tribal areas to enhance livelihood, food and nutrition security at grass-root level. Our goal is to enhance creativity through research, training and skill development to promote United Nations’ recently adopted Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) to end extreme poverty, fighting inequality and tackling the climate change at grass-root level.  Please visit: https://www.facebook.com/www.sirdi.org.in/notifications/', "Great to see the youth matters getting taken care of i think now it's up with the youth to start making a difference from schools colleges the campuses and in their communities as a way forward to develope.", 'http://www.legendsint.org/', '<3']

文章內容:
We must create a world where every pregnancy is wanted & every childbirth is safe to make the #GlobalGoals a reality!

Poor women suffer disproportionately from unintended pregnancies, unsafe abortion, maternal death and disability, sexually transmitted infections, and related problems. Young people are also extremely vulnerable, facing disproportionately high HIV rates and barriers to reproductive health information and care. 

Access to voluntary family planning is crucial to achieving Goals 3, 4 and 5, and more. It is our responsibility to ensure that all women everywhere have the means to decide the number and spacing of their children and that no woman dies in childbirth.

www.unfpa.org/icfp2016

文章內容:
Women who have access to family planning, use family planning!

Universal access to reproductive health will cut maternal deaths and injuries and enable women to choose the number and spacing of their children. Fewer births, fewer deaths and fewer injuries mean women obtain more education, better employment and greater equality to help eradicate poverty and transform our world. 

Learn more: www.unfpa.org/icfp2016

#ICFP #FamilyPlanning #SRH #GlobalGoals

文章內容:
Today, women globally earn less, have fewer assets, bear the burden of unpaid work and care and are largely concentrated in vulnerable and low-paying activities. To address these issues, the United Nations Secretary-General has appointed a new High-Level Panel on Women’s Economic Empowerment. Supported by DFID - UK Department for International Development and an Independent Secretariat hosted by UN Women, it will make recommendations for key actions to achieve the #GlobalGoals as they relate to the economic empowerment of women and girls. 

Learn more: http://owl.li/X47Pk #empowerwomen

Who are international migrants? 43% of those who moved from 2000-2015 – that’s 104 million – were born in Asia. 62 million (25%) came from Europe; 37 million (15%) from Latin America and the Caribbean; 4 million (2%) from North America; and 2 million (1%) from Oceania. 

Check out the new #Migration dataset “Trends in International Migrant Stock: The 2015 Revision” from United Nations Department of Economic and Social Affairs (DESA): www.unmigration.org #GlobalGoals

留言: ['Most of the girls and  women who have been subjected  to absolute inequality in all aspects of life are intentionally made to be so by the society or men folks to be specific. That is why gender disparity is more prevalent and pronounced in politics and economy. They are always denied the best education, the best job with the best pay. Girls are left with rank and file, with no chance to display or test their talents. More over, the concoctions of biased traditional norms make any advancement efforts impossible and futile. The immediate tool to deal with gender inequality is in education. Let women and girls know who they are and their rights, period. They will there and then stand up for their rights on their own. Most of the  victims of unequal treatment are the ultra poor and the less privileged, and greater part of them are women. The more inequality exist in a given society the more extreme poverty flourish. Gender inequality is an attribute of poverty and extreme hunger. Servitude and domestic violence are terrestrial products of gender inequality. Power and politics knows no gender, women should stand and vote or voted, what matters is how prudent one is with his subjects. We must track gender inequality and stop it now.']

['ON THE ISSUE OF CLIMATE CHANGE (PART ONE)
In my commitment towards true environmentalism, today I want to write on what affect US all, biotas (living things)------ CLIMATE CHANGE
Climate change, also called global warming, refers to the rise in average surface temperatures on Earth. It is a scientific fact that climate change is due primarily to the human use of fossil fuels, which releases carbon dioxide(CO2) and other greenhouse gases into the air. The gases trap heat within the atmosphere, which can have a range of effects on ecosystems, including rising sea levels, severe weather events, and droughts that render landscapes more susceptible to wildfires.

To many the issue of climate change does not in any way make sense, to them it is largely a scientific fiction aimed at scaring and forbidding them in exploring and enjoying the fullest gift that nature as to offer, while even if it makes sense to YOU or not, the fact is that it is AFFECTING YOU and ME…all!

Day after day, the consequences or an effect of this simple reality (CLIMATE CHANGE) keeps flooding-in with force from every angle. Is it the cover pages of Newspaper, Magazines, Social Medias, TV programmes e.t.c. Even if you care or not, the evident reports of increasing rate of disasters (flooding, hunger, drought), new diseases (that I called them International diseases cause they seems not to respect borders), War, oh, yes! I say WAR (I will surely one day write WAR and CLIMATE CHANGE) e.t.c What propelled me to write this is simply our PERCEPTION TOWARDS DISASTERS AND RISKS in this part of the world---- AFRICA!. Many of us perceived the alarming rate of global disasters as simple “AN ACT OF GOD”! While is it true that everything happens because GOD permit them to but it is also true that there is a PERMISSIBLE WILL OF GOD and PERFECT WILL OF GOD. That means that even the theologians understood the fact the sometimes GOD allows some certain things to happen due to mainly our action and activities In and on the environment, mind you that include the topic of CLIMATE CHANGE!!!!!

Frances Harris in his book titled “Global Environmental Issues” pointed out the need for global synergy in tacking this Issue because to him this requires LOCAL ACTION aimed at achieving a GLOBAL RESULT. Govind Prasad published the Hand Book of Conservation Biology and suggested BIOSEQUESTRATION as the key in absorbing, storing and utilizing the atmospheric Carbon (CO2), a greenhouse gas.

Man has realized the fact that he is heading towards a catastrophic end and according Prof. S. S. Sanusi he is left with two option 1. To Change his approach and methods of dealing with the environment or 2. To DIE with the Environment. UNEP suggested mitigation and adaptation as the key in combating Climate Change. To UNEP adaptation is the best, cause once a community or individual adapt to the ever changing environmental parameters the better the chances for survival. To me, personally, I say, NO! cause there is a point beyond resilient where the system can withstand the change talk more of coming back to its former state.

Today, all I want from YOU is a simple act of conservation our planet! Plant flowers, trees and involve in GREEN DESIGN, reduce your fossil fuel consumption (trek where possible)…. And help in educating your neighbours! We are all in this! Together we can save our Planet!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

To be continued........

文章內容:
Did you know that 48 countries are classified as least developed countries? LDCs are defined as low-income developing countries suffering from structural impediments to sustainable development. To identify LDCs, the Development Policy and Analysis Division of UN-DESA UN Committee for Development Policy uses three criteria: gross national income per capita; a human assets index and an economic vulnerability index.

Check out the LDC 2015 Country Snapshots, which profile key data for all 48 LDCs: http://goo.gl/7d3oP5 #GlobalGoals #LDCs

文章內容:
Least developed countries (#LDCs) are defined as low-income developing countries suffering from structural impediments to sustainable development. How are they identified and how do other countries help them?

Find out in the 2nd edition of the "Handbook on the Least Developed Country Category: Inclusion, Graduation and Special Support Measures." The Handbook provides comprehensive information on the LDC category, on the procedures and methodologies used for the identification of LDCs and on international support measures for these countries. 

Learn more at: http://goo.gl/PyH4g5 #GlobalGoals

文章內容:
Do quotas boost women’s political participation? Get the myths and facts on quotas from the United Nations Development Programme - UNDP. 

Find out more about achieving gender equality at: http://j.mp/bycQyS

2014 is the International Year of Crystallography. 

"If it were not for the discovery (of X-ray crystallography) 100 years ago, the world would look a very different place than it does now," said Mike Glazer, emeritus professor of physics at the University of Oxford, at the launch of the Year.

The Year aims to generalize crystallography, which is currently practiced in only about 80 countries around the world, even though this fundamental science is essential for innovation and for socio-economic development. 

Find out more at: http://www.iycr2014.org/home

UN Africa Renewal magazine online and check out the features in December’s issue.  ow.ly/rXy9d

How can companies engage in the climate challenge and join the world's largest climate action platform? They can sign up to Caring for Climate, an initiative of the United Nations Global Compact, UNEP and the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change. Learn more: htl.li/rXWDN

What are some bold steps to reduce extreme poverty in Africa? 

With the help of the World Bank, the Tanzanian government is conducting a pilot programme to reach the poorest families in the country by providing them with cash on the condition that they send their children to schools and get regular health check-ups.

Watch this video to see how it works: http://wrld.bg/rSRLO
留言: ['Good strategy hope it will yield results']

文章內容:
Around one-third of all food produced for human consumption is lost or wasted each year, amounting to 1.3 billion tonnes -- or  enough food to feed 2 billion people.

Three UN agencies, the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO), the International Fund for Agricultural Development (IFAD) and the World Food Programme (WFP), have announced that they will work together on a $2.7 million project funded by the Swiss Agency for Development Cooperation to target food losses in developing countries. 

Find out more at: http://j.mp/1jAE0YS

Find out more about the UN’s work to combat HIV/AIDS and other diseases: http://j.mp/dtJqpO

Ban Ki-moon has announced the appointment of two Special Envoys on Climate Change: John Kufuor, former President of Ghana, and Jens Stoltenberg, former Prime Minister of Norway.

The Secretary-General has asked the Special Envoys to assist in engaging world leaders to mobilize political will and action, and raise ambition in advance of the 2014 Climate Summit that he is hosting in New York next September. 

Get  more details at: http://j.mp/1kAgEAv

文章內容:
The world produces enough to feed the entire global population of 7 billion people. And yet, one person in eight on the planet goes to bed hungry each night. In some countries, one child in three is underweight. Why does hunger exist?

Here are the six reasons according to @WFP: http://goo.gl/R0yOP8

There is enough fresh water on the plant for everyone. Yet 884 million people don’t have access to safe drinking water and, by 2050, at least 1 in 4 people is likely to live in a country affected by chronic or recurring shortages of fresh water.  Find out more at http://j.mp/wdsahO

文章內容: Featured Photos: These images from UNAIDS Asia Pacific capture people in Yangon, Myanmar marking World AIDS Day earlier this month. Take a look: http://j.mp/18XFJTB

The World Health Organization (WHO) is the driving force behind global health - impacting all of our lives, whoever we are, wherever we live.

Watch how WHO brings health to life: http://j.mp/1bdDk16

Do you want to mentor youth-led organizations from around the world?

The United Nations Human Settlements Programme ( UN-HABITAT) has kicked off a new and exciting opportunity for people who want to mentor youth to become active citizens in their communities and bring about global change.

This is a unique opportunity for grassroots experts and consultants to work with top youth groups globally, and take youth empowerment to the next level. 

Get more information and details of the application process at: http://j.mp/1gDXMAr

Football legends and United Nations Development Programme - UNDP Goodwill Ambassadors Ronaldo and Zin?dine Zidane have announced that the 11th Match Against Poverty will take place at 20:00 local time on 4 March  in Bern, Switzerland.

Proceeds raised will help recovery efforts in the Philippines in the wake of Typhoon Haiyan, one of the most devastating storms in history.

Ticket prices range from CHF 20.00 up to CHF 60.00 are available as of 19 December at: www.stadedesuisse.ch/tickets or www.ticketcorner.ch

Get more information at: http://j.mp/1etMyyt

On Thursday the UN General Assembly held a special meeting to pay tribute to the life and memory of Nelson Mandela, a leader in the fight against poverty and inequality. 

“Through his extraordinary life, Nelson Mandela showed that tyranny and oppression never have the last word. Justice triumphs in the end”, said Ban Ki-moon at the event. 

“Now it is our duty to build the better world that he showed is within our grasp”, he added. 

Read his full remarks at: http://j.mp/19AVZrS

Find out more about Mandela’s life and legacy and how you can take action and inspire change in his honour: http://j.mp/jzCBwS

Friday is International Human Solidarity Day, which this year focuses on bridging gaps to achieve the MDGs. 

Marking the Day, Ban Ki-moon urged people from all nations, faiths, cultures and traditions to work together and leave a legacy of peace, prosperity and sustainable progress for generations to come.

Read more at: http://j.mp/dZdTat
留言: ['Great inspiration!']

文章內容:
A new UN report says that empowering women in the management and decision-making on key natural resource such as land and agriculture can strengthen peacebuilding and recovery in warn-torn countries. Yet women are often excluded from owning land, benefitting from resource wealth and decision-making in conflict-related settings. 

Find out more in “Women and Natural Resources: Unlocking the Peacebuilding Potential”: http://j.mp/1fFym2v

文章內容:
The global economy should grow 3% in 2014 and 3.3% in 2015 –- compared to 2.1 % for 2013 -- but it remains vulnerable to new and old headwinds, says a UN report released on Wednesday.

Take a look at this infographic for an overview of the World Economic and Social Prospects 2014 and get more details at: http://j.mp/kvDAOn

All over the world, mobile phones are being used to transform lives by connecting people, sharing information and disseminating knowledge -- and now the International Labour Organization is using them to advance labour rights. 

This new blog post explains: http://bit.ly/19G6tCG

Wednesday is International Migrants Day, focussing this year on how migrants contribute to development. 

Did you know that almost half of migrants are women and that 1 of every 10 migrants is under the age of 15? 

Share this image and spread the word about the positive impacts of migration on communities.  

Find out more at: http://bit.ly/1j330HV

On Tuesday, Ban Ki-moon said that next year will be crucial for development, both for achieving the MDGs and agreeing on a set of sustainable development goals. 

The Secretary-General added that “reaching a climate agreement in 2015 means doing heavy lifting in 2014”.

 Get his full remarks at: http://j.mp/18MjxGd

EFA Report UNESCO wants to hear from you. Have your say at: http://j.mp/1992Me8

文章內容:
Theatre is a powerful weapon in HIV/AIDS prevention and awareness: when a play is performed by a local drama group for a local audience in a local language, it can have a lasting impact. 

In this video, watch how Botswanan Tumisang, a rape survivor, regained the ability to dream and to empower others through a drama training programme held by Wise Up Botswana, a collaboration by UNICEF and the Government of Botswana to raise awareness among youth about the risks of HIV/AIDS:  http://uni.cf/18dWWHG

Featuring posts by experts and thought-leaders from around the globe, a newly-launched blog from the Global Partnership for Effective Development Co-operation aims to drive debate on development cooperation in a changing world. Take a look at: http://devcooperation.org.

According to the latest data from the specialized cancer agency of the World Health Organization, cancer rates worldwide rose to more than 14 million new cases in 2012, up from 12.7 million in 2008. Cancer-related deaths also climbed from 7.6 million in 2008 to 12.7 million in 2012.  

While incidence rates are highest in more developed regions, mortality is relatively higher in developing countries due to a lack of early detection and access to treatment facilities. 

Find out more at: http://j.mp/1hRe0GO
留言: ['its painful u know 4  those who facing']

文章內容:
The UN-backed Green Climate Fund was launched earlier this month in the Republic of Korea and is a significant step in the collective effort to support climate mitigation, adaptation and resilience measures in developing countries.

Find out more about the Fund and its partners at: http://j.mp/18GMO8z

文章內容:
In Japan this month, World Health Organization chief Dr. Margaret Chan said that universal health coverage is the ultimate expression of fairness. 

“Mounting evidence tells us that investments in health, especially when they aim for universal access to quality services, contribute to poverty alleviation and shared prosperity among nations”.

Get more details at: http://goo.gl/Pdo7ke

The United Nations is calling for nominations for the UN Public Service Awards 2014. This is an international contest designed to promote and support innovations in public service delivery worldwide. The award is open to public organizations of all kinds, including Governments and public-private partnerships that are involved in delivering services to citizens around the globe.

Nominations are due on 18 December. Find out more from the United Nations Department of Economic and Social Affairs: http://bit.ly/1big6v1

Africa's Sahel region faces many complex and interconnected challenges – from the food crisis to environmental issues to fragile economies and more. 

Read the latest analysis -- “The Sahel: One region, many crises” -- from UN Africa Renewal and find what the UN is doing to help.   http://goo.gl/A7eNV2

文章內容:
Can you imagine a world without forests? European Forest Week is being celebrated with events across Europe this week highlighting the vital importance of forests for a sustainable future. 

Learn more about what happening and why we need to safeguards forests in all regions at: http://bit.ly/1aQbWXi 

Photo: FAO Forestry

A new UNICEF report shows that the births of nearly 230 million children under five -- that's 1 in 3 -- have never been registered. 

Children unregistered at birth or without identification documents are often excluded from education, healthcare and social security. 

“All children are born with enormous potential. But if societies fail to count them, and don’t even recognize that they are there, they are more vulnerable to neglect and abuse,” said Geeta Rao Gupta, UNICEF Deputy Executive Director. 

Read a full report: http://j.mp/19hlVIZ
留言: ['Very true. Everyone must shoulder their responsibility and education will help to cure the global ills.']

文章內容:
According to the World Malaria Report 2013, launched on Tuesday by the World Health Organization, global efforts to control and eliminate malaria have saved an estimated 3.3 million lives since 2000, reducing malaria mortality rates by 45% globally and by 49% in Africa. 

The large majority of the lives saved were in the 10 countries with the highest malaria burden, and among children under 5 – the group most affected by the disease.
 
The report calls for sustained financing to maintain progress and reduce deaths.

Read more at: http://j.mp/IPqIX6
留言: ['Good job..']

文章內容:
Wednesday is International Mountain Day, an opportunity to promote the conservation and sustainable use of increasingly scarce resources from mountain areas. 

Did you know that mountains are home to 12% of the human population and cover approximately one-quarter of the world’s surface? Or that some of the world's largest cities, including New York, Rio de Janeiro, Nairobi, Tokyo and Melbourne, are dependent on freshwater from mountains? 

Take a look at this animated video from the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations to see how mountains are the key to the sustainable future we want: http://j.mp/1aZ3ViI

文章內容:
In his latest LinkedIn Influencer piece on a “Big Idea for 2014”, Ban Ki-moon says that in 2014 we must turn the greatest challenge facing humankind today into the greatest collective opportunity: Next year is the year for climate action. 

“I firmly believe that every one of us can step up and become leaders in combating climate change, promoting sustainable development and building lives of dignity for all”.

Read his post in full at: http://j.mp/1gWjAof

文章內容:
On Monday Ban Ki-moon arrived in Johannesburg, where he will join scores of world leaders on Tuesday at the official memorial service for Nelson Mandela – a leader in the fight against poverty, disease and inequality. 

“We join together in sorrow for a mighty loss and in celebration of a mighty life,” said the Secretary-General at the Nelson Mandela Centre of Memory. 

Get the full story at: http://j.mp/IYJBHF

Human rights have become central to the global conversation on development in recent decades and are essential for achieving sustainable development. To mark Human Rights Day on Tuesday, take a look at the other most important achievements in human rights since the creation of United Nations Human Rights 20 years ago: http://j.mp/1g320Bj  

Find out more about human rights and the post-2015 development agenda at: http://j.mp/1gjSPN8

“People here don’t know what HIV is, and, when they find out you are HIV positive, they don’t want to have anything to do with you,” says 13-year-old Jean in C?te d’Ivoire. 

The country has the one of the highest HIV prevalence rates in West Africa – 3.7 per cent. However, stigma associated with HIV is so strong that people living with HIV are reluctant to disclose their status – even to their immediate family. 

Watch Jean's storay and see how UNICEF helps adolescents living with HIV: http://uni.cf/IS7Mbe

文章內容:
Corruption is a serious crime that can undermine social and economic development in all societies. No country, region or community is immune.

Monday is International Anti-Corruption Day, and this year's theme is "Zero Corruption. 100% Development”. You can fight corruption and support education by teaching children that corruption is unacceptable. What part will you play in tacking corruption? 

Find out more from UNODC - United Nations Office on Drugs and Crimen and the United Nations Development Programme - UNDP at: http://j.mp/IACD2013

文章內容:
In this new video from the United Nations Department of Economic and Social Affairs, UN statistician Stefan Schweinfest talks “sustainable statistics” and shares lessons learnt from MDG monitoring and what it takes to prepare for development data beyond 2015. 

“The MDGs have been good for statistics. They have highlighted the need of solid and good information for policy and decision-making”. 

Watch at: http://bit.ly/Il6NzW

Nelson Mandela said that "Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.”

How do you put education first? Take a look at efforts being made around the world to achieve quality education for all: http://j.mp/19mGFvc

文章內容:
According to UNFPA's The State of World Population 2013: Motherhood in Childhood, adolescent pregnancies are more common among the poor, the uneducated, and those in rural  areas throughout the world. They occur more frequently among girls who are marginalized and who have no access to information and services.

Take a look at this video to see how young Roma women are trying to challenge the high teen pregnancy rate in their community: http://video.unfpa.org/

Nelson Mandela was a leader in the fight against poverty and HIV/AIDS. 

“We are all human, and the HIV/AIDS epidemic affects us all in the end. If we discard people who are dying from AIDS, then we can no longer call ourselves people”. 

As the world mourns his passing, we invite you to post your thoughts and messages in this condolence book from the United Nations Information Centre South Africa: http://j.mp/1d4YYI7

Nelson Mandela fought for human dignity, equality and freedom for all. 

In remarks on the death of Nelson Mandela, Ban Ki-moon said that he was a giant for justice and a down-to-earth human inspiration and that no one did more in our time to advance the values and aspirations of the UN. 

“Nelson Mandela showed what is possible for our world and within each one of us -- if we believe, dream and work together”. 

Read his full statement at: http://j.mp/1gIbpfa
